"Terrible experience. Awful service and food. Beef enchilada, worst I've had. Not authentic Mexican. Margarita, straight from a can. Waste of cash."
"Walmart, same as all the rest. Employees? Rude, unhelpful. Not worth my time. Drive extra miles for a smile, friendly help."

"Avoid this joint at all costs. Worst club I've stepped foot in. Girls? Hideous, fat. Suzy Q, a dancer, reeks. Left a stench on my shirt that'll make your eyes water. Unfriendly, lazy lot. Great drink specials, but not worth the risk. Wouldn't recommend it to my enemy."
"Terrible massage from my girl. Lasted 90 minutes, but I bolted early. Better off doing it myself. Disappointment reigns."

"Booked this joint on Hotwire for a night. Cost was a third of what it'd be on the strip, and we only needed it for nine hours. Figured, why not? Place needs some work, though. Water dripping from the ceiling in the hall, and they got a garbage can set up to catch it. Still drippin' on folks, though. Room was alright, bed was comfy. Went down to the pool before checkout, and it ain't too crowded, so that was good. Went back to the room for a quick shower before checkout, but found a puddle of black gunk on the floor. Decided against showerin' in it. Told the front desk, and the girl had a bit of an attitude. Said I shoulda called someone to tell 'em first. Explained there wasn't time for that, but she gave me a free upgrade for next time. Don't think I'll be back, though. Can see why they lost their Hilton affiliation."

"Donut shop nearby, I was stoked. But, damn, it was a bust. Menu? What menu? Just some donuts on a counter, no descriptions. Asked the employee, got some attitude. Got four donuts, two for me, two for the wife. Greasy and sticky, that's all I remember. Wife didn't even finish hers, still in the fridge two weeks later. Not going back, period."

"Food came cold, taste nonexistent. Staff scarce, rushed us like they had better things to do. Busy location, won't last long. Competition across the street, Burger King. Familiar name, but still a poor choice. Freddy's hamburgers, only 1/4 mile away, the one to beat. Not impressed."

"Terrible coffee shop experience. No contest. 

Snobbish, slow service. Overpriced, mediocre coffee. Limited options. That's 21st. 

I've had great coffee worldwide. Intelligentsia in Chicago, where 21st gets their beans, treats customers with respect. Pour-overs and direct trade aren't new. Get over it, 21st. 

Skip the attitude. Go to Espresso a Mano, Cannon Coffee, La Prima, or others for great coffee without the snootiness. I wanted a good cup, not a lecture and a bad one. Total waste."
"San Fran, store next door for brekkie. Uniform shop closed despite signs saying otherwise. Waited 'til 8:15, still no one. Disappointing."

"Liked this joint, till they started with the dress code nonsense. Owner walks by, doesn't say a word. Bartender takes my wristband, pays my cover, no issue. Then some employee gives me grief about my lid. Demands my money back, I peace out. Won't be coming back. Same owner as Images, rethinking my visits there too."

"O, what a woeful sight doth lie before mine eyes! A buffet most foul, that doth pale in comparison to yonder Hometown Buffet's feast. The Rio and Mirage, their spreads doth shine with glory, while this pit doth sink with mediocrity. Alas, the design and air doth lack the grandeur of old Rome, and thus, doth fail to impress. Verily, 'twere named after a god, but alack, the victuals and ambiance doth falter, leaving us, poor mortals, to suffer in disappointment."

"Tried the place again, still a letdown. Service at the bar dragged, took forever to get our apps. Salads circled the joint twice 'fore the server finally found us. Waiter brought the main courses, then vanished. No check-in on how things tasted. Portions? Puny. Valet service was tops, but that ain't enough. Skip this spot, eat somewhere else with pals."

I walked into the office, confused. Thought it was a free clinic. Still not sure. My appointment was for 1 pm. Didn't get seen until 1:50 pm. If I had been that late, they would've cancelled. Saw Bryan Monson, or so I thought. Maybe it was Silver Surfer or Green Lantern. The whole thing lasted 1 minute 35 seconds. Referred me to Dr. Garcia for surgery. Explained it quick to my daughter. Guess I'm too old to understand. Out like a light. Won't be going back. No thanks for the Botox.

"A pox upon this wretched place, where Chinese fare doth fail,
A culinary catastrophe, beyond compare.
Their ineptitude doth know no bounds, a sorry tale,
Of mangled orders, and a staff so frail.

Their language barrier, a hurdle they cannot clear,
A simple call, a Herculean task, it doth appear.
My credit card, they did proclaim, with nary a care,
The security code, they shouted, without a single thought of despair.

Their food, a travesty, a mockery of the art,
A pitiful excuse, for what Chinese cuisine should be.
Avoid this dump, my friends, a warning I do impart,
For better options, there be, in this fair city.

So heed my words, and shun this woeful place,
Where mediocrity doth reign, with nary a trace of grace."

"Hills, run for 'em! Owner's a jerk, doesn't know how to act like one. Place is filthy. Found a black hair in my salad. Owner said it was the wind, then offered a side salad. Refused, asked for a refund. She got mad, but coughed up the dough. Don't care about customers, just the benjamins. Sad."

"Second time in a row they've overbooked. Now I'm waiting for a car. What's the point of reservations when they can't deliver? Supposed to pick up my ride at 11:15, it's 12:30, and they say it'll be ready in 30. Operations manager needs to find a new line of work. This ain't their strong suit."

"Upon the nineteenth of December, in the year of fourteen hundred and fourteen, I chanced upon a sight most vexing. A puddle of water, 'twas, that surrounded my outdoor freezer, a most unwelcome sight, indeed. In haste, I sped to Lowe's, in search of a replacement, for our needs, 'twas dire. To Fort Mill, we went, my dear, where they told us they would look and see, if any freezers, they had in stock, they would. But alas, none could they find, yet they promised to call Rock Hill, to check, they would. And so we waited, patiently, for the call, that never came, nor did they deign to let us know, their decision, by and by. Displeased, we were, with Lowe's, and sought other stores, Sears and Home Depot, we did explore. At last, a store, with a freezer, we found, but from Fort Mill, no word, we heard, a poor showing, indeed. Inconsiderate, they were, and slow, their service, we did find. So, in the future, when appliances we seek, to Sears and Home Depot, we shall go, for their aid, we shall entreat."

"Overhyped reviews. Suspect PR firm's doing. 

Rooms controlled by TV, but remote's dead batteries left us sweltering. Replaced 'em myself. Two days to fix burnt-out bulbs. Moved 'em around so the loo wasn't pitch black. 

One star for the mini-bar charge - $68! Didn't even use it. They claimed it was a common accounting error. Opening the fridge, which we used for our own stuff, triggered the fee. Sick and twisted way to make a buck. Check-in and check-out? Pure hell."
"Came by during regular hours, four o'clock sharp. Place was shut tight, not a peep. Disappointing, to say the least."

"Don't bother with this joint. I did, after reading some glowing reviews, but let me tell you, it was a waste of time. Me and a buddy ordered a couple pasta dishes, and they were godawful. I mean, seriously, what kind of idiot puts just sauce and noodles in an Alfredo? And don't even get me started on the quality of the food. If you're starving, maybe it's worth a shot, but honestly, there are better places to stuff your face."

"I support local businesses, but John Mull's employees lied to me. I called, asking if they had grass-fed beef. They said yes, so I bought two steaks. Before buying, I checked again, and they confirmed. The steaks were great, but grass-fed has a distinct taste. Feeling suspicious, I called back to check availability and supplier. The woman checked with someone else and said they didn't carry grass-fed beef, never have."

"Hark, good sir! I didst venture forth to this establishment,
In search of sustenance and a draught of Smithwick's,
But lo, the fridge didst hold naught but premade sandwiches,
And not a drop of Smithwick's didst it contain, alas!

I do declare, 'tis not an Irish Pub, my friend,
If but one of six beers on tap doth bear the name,
Of Guinness, that most noble brew.

So, off I went, to find a place more meet,
Where I might find my craving's sweet retreat."

"I got delivery from this joint, about $35 worth of sushi and grub. When the driver showed up, I asked for change on a forty and was gonna give him a tip. But this little Asian dude starts yellin' at me, sayin' he drove all the way across town and can't believe I'm only gonna give him a five-dollar tip. Like, what the hell, man? I ain't gotta tip you at all! He was real rude, so I'll never order from this place again. Word of advice: go to Edo on Monona Drive. They're always good and they got great customer service."

"A pox upon the house that doth deny
My entrance, rude and uncivilized.
Forsooth, I came with intent to buy,
And bring my mother, dearest prize.
But lo, they didst shut the door in my face,
With nary a word or gentle grace.
At two and five, the hour of closing,
They turned me away, my heart still glowing.
Oh, how the customer doth suffer wrong,
By their ill manners and unjust song."
"Taco Bell's still kickin' in AZ, despite the abundance of legit Mexican joints. Don't get it. Their grub's pure trash."

"By th' stars, I pray thee, let this place have naught but zero! Forsooth, 'tis worst Mexic food I e'er didst taste. Firstly, horchata, made from mix, doth taste most chalky. Next, nachos with fake cheese and yellow chips, naught authentic or Mexican. Meat, th' only saving grace, yet still, a poor excuse for sustenance. Overpriced and vile, fit for drunken fools alone. Thou hast been warned, fair traveler, seek elsewhere for true Mexican fare."
"Subpar subway service. Employees lack uniforms, attitude's rough. Jersey Mike's a better bet."

"Monday night, on hold, trying to make a group reservation. They consider eight people a large group. Speak directly to someone at the restaurant, they don't want to deal with me, tell me they'll transfer me to group reservations. Liar! Transfer me to Caesar's restaurant line, which I already know can't reserve large parties. Ping pong between lines for 15 minutes. Write this review while I wait. Guy named Brandon tells me they'll take my number, call me back. Let's see when, if they call me back."

"Things ain't been the same 'round here lately. Been comin' to this joint regular, but the drive-thru's been slow for three weeks now. If it don't pick up, might have to make a trip to Dutch Bros instead."

"Foul. Foul, foul, foul. Not my pick for grub. Greasy, fake, and unpalatable. Even the fruit cup had lousy produce—unripe and lacking variety. \n\nVegas has plenty of great eateries, and they ain't all pricey. If you're consulting Yelp, do yourself a favor and find a better breakfast joint."

"Alas, this eatery doth disappoint, my friends!
The menu, a feast for mine eyes, didst promise much,
But alas, the sushi, freshness didst lack.
The rolls, all pretty, yet didst taste so foul,
Like California, with too much rice, o'er-burdened.
Eel, four pieces, chewy and tough, didst make me frown,
And rice, undercooked, or so it didst seem,
Didst not melt in mine mouth, like good sushi should.
Five rolls, and soups, we didst order, in hope,
But mushroom soup, with few small fragments, didst cost
Three coins more than the usual miso brew.
Chopsticks, of the cheap sort, with splinters, didst they give,
A shame, for sushi, elsewhere, better, canst be found.
Nevermore, shall I return, to this place, so poor."

"Septic service was solid last time I used 'em. Seven years later, they doubled their price and halved their effort. Rude dude, too. Job wasn't done right and my tank's full again in six months. Don't recommend 'em. Find someone better."

"Went back to this joint for the second time, expecting better service than last time. Ordered some chicken wings, but they screwed up my credit card payment. Lady said she voided it, then ran my card again and fixed the price. Five days later, the wrong amount was still deducted from my account. My bank's gonna sort it out, but I shouldn't have had to go through all this trouble for some damn wings. Gonna find another place with better service. What if I needed that money for a bill or something? Get your act together."

"First visit, great. Second, not so much. Tom kha soup, too damn spicy. Sent it back, server barely spoke English. New soup, same pot, just coconut milk added. Asked for manager, none available. Senior employee, poor English. Soup sent back, mixed with soup mix. Finally, a new one, all ingredients, didn't taste like fire. But still, a pain in the ass to get it right."

"Beef was burnt, dry, and flavorless. But, it was still soft, cut thin against the grain. Used a Groupon, so not too broken up about it. If I'd paid full price, I'd be damn mad though. For what they charge, it should be way better than what they got."
"Terrible service. Sent an item back, still charged. Crossed off the list for good."

"Hark, what news is this? Our meal was most delectable,
Robata Kobe, wasabi-kissed, did melt within my mouth,
Enoki mushrooms wrapped in bacon, oh how sweet,
My taste buds sang with joy, my senses did greet.

But alas, fair service, thou didst not meet,
Our server, dull and listless, did our spirits beat,
With monotone voice, he did our orders take,
And left us waiting, forsook, for twenty long minutes, forsooth!
I pray thee, good sir, why such hasty departure?
Didst thou not know, we too, didst wait with bated breath?
Our children, dear, didst witness this foul play,
And we, who always give, didst leave but scant display.
I, who work in service, do proclaim,
Such treatment, ne'er shall be my aim."

"We swung by again a couple weeks back, thinking things might've improved. Nope. We wanted to sit outside by the fire, but the hostess gave us the stink-eye like we asked to sit on the roof. Service was slow, even though it wasn't packed. And for crying out loud, can you tell your staff to keep it down? They were hollering orders and whatnot. Sorry, but we won't be back. I like supporting local spots, but this one's a bust."
I returned, the place was dead. Service dragged, the server clueless. Fruit rotted, salad wilted. Never again.

"US Today's brunch buffet? Pure garbage. Twenty-five bucks for a spread that's got more repetition than a Hemingway novel. Brisket's like jerky, sausages are meh. Seafood bar's got more ice than a hockey rink. Shrimp and crab? Maybe if you're into that sorta thing. Tea's good though. Desserts? Don't get me started. Gelato's alright, but the rest? Forget about it. Raw fuji apple's the highlight. That's what I said, a raw apple. Save your cash, skip the hype, and avoid this dump."

"Tough review to write. Cook's great though. Makes a mean breakfast burrito, especially with bacon and jalapenos. Lunch specials are hit or miss. One's usually good, one's bad, and one's just okay. Cashier's always grumpy. Not exactly welcoming. Still, I'll take their burritos any day."

"Don't believe the rave reviews. This ain't no real Greek joint. The grub's not freshly cooked, and the pita bread's like cardboard. I asked the owner about the chicken, and he gave me some lip about how they season and grill it, then nuke it in the oven when it's ordered. Sounds like microwave magic to me. I couldn't even stomach the pita bread, it was so hard and cold. When I eat out, I expect my food to be cooked from scratch, not processed and reheated."
"Went twice. Closed both times. Not worth my time. If they can't keep hours, they don't need my business."

"Rude bartender at the airport. Forty-something, miserable guy. No reason for his attitude, just a jerk. Other employees looked defeated, heads down. He was probably a manager, unhappy with his life. Took it out on me, and likely others. Avoid this place."

"O, woe is me! This day, this wretched place,
Hath brought me naught but bitter disgrace.
Thirty minutes in the drive-thru line,
And then, the youth, with attitude divine,
Did say, "We're understaffed, and busy too,"
As if that were some kind of excuse to do.

And thus, we waited, fifteen minutes more,
For iced birthday cakes, and watermelon in store.
And lo, the staff, they stood about,
Gazing upon each other, with nary a doubt.

Alas, I oft have loved this place,
But now, in summer's heat, 'tis plain to see,
They lack the staff, to meet the demand,
Of customers, who crave their icy treat in hand."

"We hit this joint every year for some Chinese grub while in town for a trade show. It's loud and packed, but the food's decent and the price is right. Or so we thought. After this year's fiasco, we've had enough. Service is crap. Waitstaff's either rude or incompetent. Twice in a row, they lost our reservation and refused to seat us. Looks like they don't give a damn about repeat business. Time to move on, plenty of better options in Vegas."
"Lived nearby, visited often. Evenings, long lines. Understaffed, slow service. Mistakes when busy. Management should prioritize customer service. Avoid this spot, find elsewhere."

"Spirit Airlines. You get what you pay for. First and last trip. Vegas to Fort Lauderdale and back. Plane was a dog. Window seat cleaned with mop water. Garbage in seat pocket. Seat wouldn't recline. Dirty headrests. Four-and-a-half hour flight. Not even offered water. One working lavatory out of two. Got there on time. Ran for a shower immediately."

"Living in Henderson, I'm on the road near weekly. TSA's a crapshoot, mostly misses. Good luck with that. My gripe's with TSA Pre-Check. I use the tram at Gate C, easy peasy since I don't check bags. But they don't offer Pre-Check, though they do at D gates next to C. They tried, then stopped. Last time I went through D, a TSA agent let me into C. Nobody showed. Two agents came in, I tried to leave, and I got an earful: 'WHERE ARE YOU GOING!?' Condescending, too. Showed my pass, of course. Next time, they blocked C gate passengers. Now, I hit the main C-Gate (Southwest) security area. Show my pass, get pointed to a special line that snakes along the wall to ONE TSA agent at a TSA PREcheck booth. It's usually packed. Thing is, TWO OTHER agents, both with Pre-Check signs, let anyone in line go through. The'main' Pre-Check line doesn't connect to those two stations."
"Finnz's joint, next door. Grub's nearly as bad. Fish 'n' chips? Forget it. Menu's a bust too. Don't bother."

"I phoned 'em up for a quote on fixin' my tile roof. No response. Unacceptable. They got an answerin' service, too. No excuse. If I'd said I needed a whole new roof, maybe they'd've called back. Gave 'em the name of the fella who sent me their way, too."

"Alas, my friends, I must report a woeful tale of wretched fare and scanty portions. Verily, the burger came with naught but three frites, a paltry sum indeed. Fie upon the cook, who doth stint his guests with such parsimony! And as for service, 'twas lacking, to say the least. The bartenders, like startled deer, didst fumble and falter, their minds addled, it seemed, by some unknown woe. Pray, let us seek elsewhere for our culinary delights, lest we suffer similar disappointment."

"Me and the missus were hankerin' for some BBQ on the Fourth. We swung by Tom's, hopin' for a taste of that sweet, sweet 'cue. But let me tell you, friend, it was a bit of a disappointment. Fatty ribs, bland mac and cheese, and bake beans straight from a can. Not exactly the best way to spend your Independence Day. But hey, if you're new to the BBQ scene, it might do the trick."

"Disappointing experience. Went in for carry-out, hoping for a decent Bahn Mi sandwich. Waited almost 20 minutes, lady who took my order didn't seem to care. Sandwich was small and didn't taste fresh. Not worth it."

"Idiot. Wanted full interior detail, pre-trip. Didn't need exterior wash - bugs'd ruin it anyway. Offered $150, fine with me, got a baby at home. Guy refused, said he needed more. Won't be calling him again."

"Terrible experience. Staff lied to us throughout. Cashier was rude, called us liars. Wait time ballooned from one to three hours. When we checked on our status for the fourth time, we were told it'd be another hour. Staff is disrespectful, treats customers like they're beneath them. Wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy."

"I gotta search hard for non-expired goods at this joint. They ain't got much of what they advertise. Lines are long, store's dirty. Tell myself I'll go elsewhere, but this is the only game in town. Assistant managers don't give a damn, they blow me off or stutter like fools. Only bright spot: the guys who bag and collect carts, they're friendly and helpful."

"Staff let some broad mouth off at me 'bout her brats. She came back twice, too. Told me what a rotten guy I am for askin' her to keep 'em quiet. Asked the staff to boot her, but they just stood there like bumps on a log. Never been treated so poorly in a joint. Me and my buddy won't be comin' back, and I'll make sure everyone knows about it. Asked for the manager, but he didn't bother showin' his face. As a ex-restaurant owner, I'm appalled and sickened."

"Terrible joint. Grub's alright, nothing special. Service? Worst I've seen. Went with some pals, and the waiter was a mess. Forgot our orders, brought the wrong drinks, and screwed up the bill. Manager gave us some game cards, but that didn't make up for it. Avoid this dump."
"Lipstick on a pig, that's what I saw. An hour on the casino floor, not a single drink offered. Small space, cramped, difficult to navigate. Handicap unfriendly. Valet guys, courteous though."

"Bring three IDs and a credit card. Don't know why, but these guys can't seem to tell their customers apart. Waited almost an hour while four bouncers argued over my friend's ID. Even after she showed them her credit card with a different pic, they still gave her grief. What a waste of time. Never had this problem at any other club in Vegas. Staff needs to get their act together and stop hassling people over minor differences in their appearance."

"Luxor? More like Lousy-or. Presidents' Day weekend, last resort. Tropicana was full, too. Smells like death. Room was cramped, two queens instead of a king. Sheets weren't changed, floor wasn't vacuumed. Double charge on my card, didn't find out 'til I got home. What the hell, man? $788 for that dump? Might as well have stayed at the Wynn. Called accounting, they said it was a pending transaction. Why didn't the front desk tell me? Finally got a refund, but still, what a pain. Tacos & Tequila was decent, though. Staff seemed unhappy, wonder why. Avoid the Luxor, folks. Big letdown."
"Coupon caught my eye. Took my kid to check it out. Got there at 9:29, place was shutting down. Open sign off, screens down. Yelp said 10 pm close. Bad start. Sticking with Froyona."
"Popeye's, ate 'em in many states. This ain't it.\nSpicy chicken, not spicy, just full of grease and not much chicken. How they get away with it in a corporate setting, I got no idea."

"Place was a real letdown. Saw it on TV, thought it'd be top-notch BBQ. Detoured off to grandpa's in Tucson, figured might as well give it a shot. Got there early, around 11 am, thinking I'd beat the crowd. Waitress said everything was good, so I ordered one of everything. She brings out this huge plate, must've weighed six pounds. Couldn't tell what was what. Had a bite of each, paid my thirty bucks, and headed to Weinerschnitzel for some real grub."

"Greenberg's got rave reviews? Must be folks don't know their Jewish deli food. It's a fast food joint, not a real deal like Katz's or Canter's. People need to taste the difference between a true deli and this imitation. Greenberg's is two stars, tops. It's a shame people think this is the real deal."

Monday afternoon, I chanced upon Coco's place,
Where parking space was scant, a wondrous sight,
But three cars only, in the lot did grace,
A strange and eerie feeling, did imbue the night.

Inside, seating was swift, our order soon took flight,
Salads arrived with haste, no time to tarry,
But main course delayed, an half hour's plight,
The restaurant empty, save two or three in sight.

A cow, I thought, must needs be slain to feed,
Two cheeseburgers, my stomach did protest,
For after an hour, great discomfort did breed,
And service, fair, but flaws, did not cease.

Our waitress, reminded, tea did pour,
But dishes, cleared, did not ensure,
The manager, some took, and promised to return,
But alas, his word, did not burn.

The check, we asked, to split, a simple deed,
But nay, our wish, the waitress did not heed,
So back she went, to make the change, indeed,
A tale of woe, this visit did proceed.

Coco's, alas, doth follow Marie's path,
Downward, it goes, in culinary wrath.

"Hark! My update doth bring tidings of woe,
For my sweet tooth doth long for Eis,
A treat most dear, yet prices doth gore.
At Hagsfeld's Ochsenfest, I didst seek
A Kugel Eis for my young son,
But alas! The vendor didst demand
A Pappbecher, and twenty cents more,
For a Waffel, which my son cannot eat,
Due to his milk allergy, oh what a feat!
I didst decline, for the price was steep,
And the Kugel, already ninety cents, didst seem cheap.

So I didst ride forth, to find a new place,
Where Eis doth flow like a river in grace.
A kind Eisverkäuferin didst greet me with cheer,
And offered two Kugels, with Eis so clear.
The Zitrone was pleasant, but alas!
The Heidelbeer Eis didst not impress,
For it doth have ice crystals, and a strange taste,
Like a frozen puddle, with no creamy embrace.
Perhaps they doth rush the Eis, and not let it sit,
For a longer time, to let the flavors knit.
The Waffel too, didst not delight,
And so I didst discard it, with all my might.
It doth remind me of Esspapier, oh so bland,
And thus, my search doth continue, through the land."

"Terrible service. Felt like they were favoring regulars and members of the same race. Waited 15 minutes for a table, no big deal. Sat down, waited 10 minutes, no water or anything. Flagged down a busser, told him I was ready to order, 30 minutes passed, nothing. Told my wife to wait a little longer, nothing. Finally ordered, waited 23 minutes for my food, ate, and then waited another 24 minutes for my check."

"Awful, just awful. Friendly waitress, prompt service, but a 30-minute wait for grub? Unacceptable. Pineapple upside down pancakes, you'd think they couldn't screw that up. But no, bland, flavorless cakes and sour pineapple. Disappointing. Country fried steak and gravy, not bad. But the wait and those pancakes? No thanks. I'll take my business elsewhere."

"I'm in the restaurant game, and let me tell you, Uncle Bears is a mess. Can't quite pin down what it's supposed to be - sports bar, family joint, who knows? Whatever it is, it's not doing it for me. Food's terrible, ambiance is confusing, and the prices are laughable. Don't waste your time or money."

"Terrible experience. Waited 20 minutes for a table, surrounded by a crowd. Don't mind waiting, but when servers are chatting and the place is half empty, it's an issue. Food was terrible, and the bill was a rip-off. Avoid this joint."
"Drivers? Thieves. Write in their own tips. Managers? Useless. All thieves. Order elsewhere."

"Le Chariot? Some folks might dig it. Me? Not so much. It's a glorified junk shop, pretending to be something special. Outside, you'll see some neat trinkets, like military medals and collectibles. But step inside, and you'll realize it's all just a bunch of useless junk. Broken, damaged, and overpriced. I spotted an old street sign that caught my eye, but the grumpy old owner wanted \u00a330 for it. When I passed, he ignored me the rest of the time. Later, I saw it in the window with the rest of the "good" stuff, priced at \u00a345. Avoid this joint, it's all just junk."

"Took me damn near three years to write this. Daughter's eighth birthday, that's why. Place was a dump, service worse. Lady behind counter gave me attitude when I asked questions. Party was a disaster, most expensive too. Hostess made a guest cry, moms didn't even get water. Zero good memories. Asked for owner's email, older lady ignored me. Didn't trust it anyway. Friend had to speak for me, I was in tears. Horrible experience."

"I showed up Friday night, Nov 21st, for a quick pie. Asked the girl at the register how much a large cheese costs. She said $12.92. I asked about two medium cheeses. $12.95, she says. Ordered 'em, paid, and split. Girl said it'd be 15-20 min. I'm back in less than 15, and there's a line of two people now. Waited over 10, starin' at my pies on the shelf. This chick in a green apron is puttin' parchment in the box, pressin' down on it with her bare hand, then slappin' a pizza on top. Other employees in the kitchen, none of 'em wearin' gloves. Not a single one of 'em. Finally get to the front, girl asks what she can do for me. Place ain't exactly bustlin', feels like she shoulda remembered me. Pissed me off, waitin' in line for pizzas I already paid for. Pizza's average. None of us got the stomach flu...yet."

"Insurance co. said they'd tow my Dodge Magnum RT to mechanic at 10:30. Showed up an hour late. Asked for flatbed, got regular tow truck instead. Called Walker Co., spoke to Tim - real piece of work, that one. Wouldn't give me flatbed, told me to find another tow co. Driver was nice, though. Said if customer wants flatbed, they should get one. Tim's a jerk, unprofessional, no place in customer service."

"Ten bucks for a smog check, cheap oil change too. But then they hit me with a phony lower ball joint job. My boyfriend knows cars, told me they'd pull something like that. Almost four hundred bucks! Guy in there got ripped off twice, pissed as hell. Cashier said they gave him a three hundred discount, real generous. Then they tried to sell me some overpriced tires, six hundred plus. Nerve, they got plenty."

"Cocky young waiter, thought he was the bomb. Not even close, kid. Moved here from San Fran, know my Indian food. You're not it. Food was okay, nothing special. Chicken tikka, vindaloo, flavorful but not worth the price. Portions small, prices high. Indian food expensive in Madison? Ridiculous. All restaurants same price range. Owners' union maybe? South Indian food on menu with Rogan Josh? Flagged. Serious owners wouldn't mix. Menu too long, below average fare. Won't return unless prices drop. Way down."
"Visited doc twenty times, still no clue what ailed me. Bedside manner? Non-existent. Rushed, like he had better things to do."
"Terrible service. Go there often 'cause it's on my way to work. Always regret it. Slow as hell, even when I'm the only one in line. Take 'em forever just to say hi. Coffee ain't that great either."

"Terrible service. Hour wait for eggs. Asked twice for our order to be taken. Asked where our food was. Breakfast, not a multi-course meal. Empty tables everywhere. Should've left. Finally seated, no service. Had to ask again. Food was good, but who cares? Bad experience."

"This joint's got one good thing goin' for it - it's open on Saturdays and the dental assistant's a peach. Other than that, I wouldn't recommend it. Me and the missus went in for a checkup, cleaning, and some X-rays. But all we got was a list of problems and prices. The receptionist? Not exactly the friendliest. Hard to get a straight answer outta her."

"Overpriced, overcooked, no slaw or cornbread. Had to settle for wings since they were out of chicken. Smelled rancid, hubby wouldn't let me eat it, tossed the whole thing. Ate one thigh, meat was dry, skin oozed grease. Clear sign the grease wasn't hot enough during cooking. What a disappointment. Oh well, c'est la vie."
"Nah, not a chance. Water only on the jug at each hole. Saw the cart girl once in four hours. Greens? Terrible. Bumpy, no grass, poor maintenance. Not worth playin' here again."

"Crazy, whoever orders from this joint. Two so-called famous cheese steaks, took 'em 15 minutes to start makin' 'em. One at a time, like they're savorin' every bite. Sandwiches? Bland, no salt. Mushrooms? Frozen, undercooked. Meat? Skimpy. This place claims Food Network fame, but six months ago it was servin' up catfish. Gino's in Philly? No need to sweat."
"US Airways staff at McCarren Airport were rude. I'd had good experiences with them elsewhere, but no more. Not flying with them out of Vegas again."

"Went back to the salon to get my nails fixed, again. Another epic fail. Jennifer, the lady who did my nails, seemed pissed at me, like it was my fault her employee botched the job. She filed my nails with the machine, hurting me, and didn't ask about shape or color. Just started painting the whole nail without asking. Only get tips done. She threw my hands around and tapped them instead of talking to me like a person. Sat me in a crappy chair to dry the gel. No apology for the terrible job. She even pointed at my nails and talked in some foreign language, probably trashing me. I get my nails done every two weeks and I'll take my business elsewhere. This place sucks. Dusty and poorly maintained too."

"Lookin' for a gym that cares more 'bout their rep than your kid? Sign up! Had a boy and a girl on their team. Daughter's confidence got destroyed, took six months to rebuild. Son got burnt out with the men's coach, he's ten. Luckily, both kids are in good spots now. Don't go here. Other gyms in the valley, facilities might be nice, but not worth the toll on your kids' mental health."

"Ain't no parkin', ain't no respect from management. Drug dealers and scum hangin' 'round the hot tubs. Hannah and that other blonde manager, they don't give a damn. They treat you like you're inconveniencing 'em. Place is goin' downhill fast, the golf course it overlooks is dead and stinkin'. Can't wait to get the hell outta here. Sleep with a golf club by your bed, that's my advice."

"Never going back. Food's good, but too damn pricey. They nickel-and-dime you for everything—refills, to-go boxes. Place is a dump, too. Broken blinds, gross ceiling fans. Then they got the balls to post a 'no plate picking' sign? Give me a break. If they want to be upscale, they should try being clean and decent first."

"O, woe is us, dear friends, for we didst come
Upon a vacation most foul and full of dread,
For at a nightclub dark and full of sin,
My love, mine own dear girl, didst fall prey to a beast within.

A bald black brute, with wickedness in his eyes,
Didst take her by force, and in an elevator didst he lie,
He groped her, and with threats didst seek to make her yield,
But she, a maiden fair and true, didst not his will reveal.

With luck, she had a phone, and straightaway didst call,
And I, her love, didst hear her plea, and didst answer her call.
I took her home, for she was drunk and in disarray,
And tried to reach the club, to make them pay.

But alas, no manager didst reply, nor didst they care,
So I, in anger, didst call the police, and didst prepare
A report, though my love was too drunk to make a claim,
And so, we left, and prayed that justice would be gained.

Beware, dear friends, this club of horrors, shun it thou must,
For safety's sake, stay in groups, and keep a watchful trust.
For who knows how many more, like my love, have fallen prey,
To these predators, lurking, waiting to slay.

Go elsewhere, dear friends, and leave this place to its doom,
For danger lurks within, and evil is its boon."
"Business costs. Dairy Queen's got a restroom policy, 2-4 pm, no high schoolers allowed, paying or not. Vandalism, sex, drugs, they say. Can't afford it, they say. That's just part of the game."

"Awful joint. Service? Forget it. Rude, slow. Gel products? Cheap. Nails? Meh. Polishing? Terrible. Clumpy, wrinkly. Asked Nina to fix. She said she would. Didn't. Got home, gel peeled off. Went back, asked for refund. No dice. Worst experience in 10 years of getting my nails done. Avoid."

"Food was mediocre, too much reliance on spices. Service was slow, took forever to bring out my grub. Tzatziki was too sour, falafel was dry. Rice was the only saving grace. Kids' plate was lacking, few fries and two chicken strips. Not sure if I'll be back."
"Came here with the fam, and we both got sick from the grub. Mom and I, both puking our guts out. Nice Italian joint in the hotel, waited an hour to get in. Worst Vegas trip, left the next day."
"Carly's got a new menu. No more tuna. That was my go-to, now it's gone. Don't think I'll be back. Too bad, liked the place. Less options now, just chicken and beef. New menu's a bust. Shame."

"Bill, the sly one. Gave me a fake address, spun me a web of lies. Called from a different phone, set up another repair. More lies, more stories. Cash discounts, huh? Wife doesn't know about cash, eh? Maybe the IRS should hear about that. Set up a fake appt, served him right. Others, come to the hearing, serve him too. Shut him down, that's the plan."

"Terrible service all around. Waited at host stand for over four minutes, along with another party. Finally seated, waited long time for drinks. Ordered breakfast burrito and spring rolls. Spring rolls were overcooked, burrito had sausage instead of bacon. Hash browns burnt. Server shrugged it off. Told cook, who said it wasn't burnt. Food came back cooked, but not like before remodel. Used to love this place, now won't be back."

"Methought 'twas a fine eve to dine at El Zocalo,
With my fair wife, to savor their culinary show.
I'd been there ere, yet my mem'ry didst fail,
To recall if their victuals were worth the while.

I ordered Tierra y Mar, a dish of steak and shrimp,
With rice and beans, a feast fit for a king's whim.
I asked for medium, but alack! It came well done,
And flavorless, like a tale without fun.

The shrimp, too salty, didst make mine taste buds wail,
I could but eat one, and then didst turn pale.
Our waiter, tardy, didst ask how all didst fare,
I told him, and he offered another dish to share.

But nay, I wouldst not waste mine time, forsooth,
My wife's enchiladas, mediocre, didst prove the truth.
The manager, in apology, didst discount my plate,
Yet why he didst not come, and hear my discontent,
Is beyond me, and doth leave me in dismay.

In conclusion, dear friends, save your coin,
And seek out Rosita's or El Rico's, a better boon.
For El Zocalo's food, alas! doth leave much to desire,
And doth not merit thy visit, nor thy burning fire."

"Fandango's online ticket service stinks. I bought a ticket for the wrong day, thinking it was for today. But no, it's for tomorrow. And guess what? No refunds. None. Zero. Zilch. I tried to change the showtime, but nope. They told me to buy another ticket. What a joke. I attached the chat with the rep for your viewing pleasure. Never seen a theater with such crappy policies. Ruined my experience. Period."

"Worst doc's office ever. Two hours waitin', then some BS about a co-pay and they wouldn't see me. Didn't give a damn 'bout my health, just wanted my money. Awful experience. Never goin' back, spreadin' the word."
"Same driver, different day. Handicapped spot, loading zone. Cop shows up, guy argues. Rude gestures, jerk. Disability hate, had enough. Filed complaint, no more visits."

"Place ain't what it used to be. Last time I was here, it was hoppin'. Now? Dead. Waited over 25 minutes, while others got sat right away. Lady at the front said they only got two servers, but three folks workin' the door. Don't make sense. Disappointed, I am."
"Dirty. Needs a good scrubbing. Kitchen and prep areas? Even dirtier, I reckon. Not going back."
"Food's no good.  Boring, bland.  Regretted it the moment I took a bite.  Sticking with the other joint down the street.  Cheaper, better grub."

"Mamma Mia won't see a dime from me again. My missus and I, along with some pals, walked in last night and got told to beat it. Lights were on, door was open, so we thought they were open for biz. We tried to sort it out, told 'em we're regulars, but the guy wouldn't have it. Said he didn't need our business and to get lost. Plenty other good pizza joints around, so the owner's got his wish. We'll never be back and I reckon others should do the same. Owner's got the right to close up and not serve folks, but if the lights are on and the door's open, there's no excuse for this crap."

"Terrible. Just terrible. You call that Mexican food? I've had better tacos at Taco Bell. Cold meat, no flavor. Watermelon drink was decent, but that's not enough. Overpriced too. Avoid it if you're from LA or SD. Real Mexican food is way better."

"Shopping trip was good, except for the shoe with a hole. No returns, but they exchanged it. Manager was rude, didn't give a damn about making me happy. Accused me of wearing the shoe, which I did, in my own home. Tried to exchange it the next day. Never shopping there again. Customer service means everything to me, and theirs was crap."

"Been waitin' to try this joint for a spell. Building looked swell from the outside, thought it'd be purty inside too. But as soon as I stepped through the door, my peepers started hurtin'. Everything was bright blue, walls, floors, tables, even the damn light bulbs. Turned me right off. Atmosphere's part of the game, and this place was missin' it. Cost us 72 bucks for five people to chow down, and we only ordered one soda. Woulda been okay if the grub was top-notch, but it all came medium well instead of medium rare. Didn't even bother sendin' it back, just wanted to get outta there and leave the blue nightmare behind."
"Terrible joint, Mellow Mushroom. Never wrote a review before, but this place is straight-up racist. Don't wanna go back, ever. Negative 100 stars, easy."

"Tortilla Factory? More like Torture Factory. Service was brutal, food was a 1 out of 5. Drinks? Meh. Atmosphere was the only saving grace, but that ain't enough to make me come back. Had better fish tacos at Rubio's and Baja Fresh for a fraction of the price. Didn't even finish my meal, had to go elsewhere for dinner. Manager got defensive when we tried to give feedback. Don't waste your time or money here."

"Terrible experience with too much repetition."

"Underpromise and overdeliver, that's my motto."

"Deadlines? Who needs 'em? Not these guys."

"Budget? What's that? Just pick some stuff out, we'll figure it out later."

"Insurance allowances? Pffft, who cares? You're still gonna end up paying out of pocket."

"Don't bother with these clowns, do it yourself."

"Aug 5th, 2:30pm. Illegal U-turn on 51st Ave, near the bridge. She cut across two lanes, four cars wide. Two trucks headed straight for us, another big rig on the inside lane. She damn near became a hood ornament. Brakes screeched, tires smoked. Bus full of kids. Driver's a Hispanic woman, glasses perched on her nose. Reading her phone while driving. Gonna kill someone, mark my words. Posted the bus tag and photo on Yelp. Belongs to Laveen School."

"Fie upon this wretched service, full of disdain! In days of yore, when first this establishment did open its doors, the fare was sumptuous and the attendants, kind. Alas, how times have changed! For on my recent visit, 'twas clear that all had altered. The staff, once brimming with warmth and grace, now seemed annoyed by my each request. As if their duties did burden them so, they did not hide their vexation well. The victuals, though still of fair quality, could not make amends for such behavior. Verily, there be many other sushi houses in the east, where one may find equal cuisine and a more pleasant experience. Methinks this place hath fallen from its former glory, a true disappointment indeed."

"Vegas ain't no place for a frugal man with kids. Been there plenty, but never with the little ones. Circus Circus, that's the joint we ended up in. Family-friendly, they said. For under $250, it was a gamble. Front desk said all rooms were swell, but I heard otherwise. Sky Tower, that's where we ended up. $130, and the room was straight outta the 80s. Sheets had holes, decor was rough, and the hallway, well, it was dark and dingy. Lesson learned, don't bring the kiddos. They wanted Six Flags, not some dome adventure."

"Give this place zero stars. Un-fucking-believable. Spent half an hour driving around, then told to park and walk in to rent the damn car. Guy on the phone, searching for some tiny cardboard thing. What the hell?! No sign, no instructions. Avoid this joint, save your time and vacation."

"Listen, I'm okay with a dress code at a nice place. But this joint, they turned us away 'cause one guy didn't have a collar shirt. Now, he did have a mandarin collar, but this bouncer, he didn't know the difference. Said it didn't count. Second time this has happened, too. Brought out-of-towners to the top floor bar, and they get turned away 'cause they don't meet some arbitrary standard. Been there a few times before, no problems. But now? Nah, I ain't gonna gamble on getting in."

"Birthday bash for my daughter at Tao. VIP service, 20 of us. Door guys wouldn't let her in, Halloween costume, a teddy bear, really? Upstairs we waited. Pickpocket paradise, they lifted $2000 from his front pocket, four bottles, water extra. Dangerous joint, can't leave, one staircase, 5000 people. Known issue, still letting them in. Wallet gone, airport encounter, same problem, credit card fraud, no ID, Tao ruined our trip."

"Waste of time, poor restaurant experience. Didn't need fancy, just good Chinese. Had Sarawak salad with burnt duck on top of mixed greens, followed by Ah Sin fried rice and Mongolian beef. Fried rice was bland, unspiced. Waiter said Mongolian beef would be spicy, but it wasn't. Gloopy sauce, sitting on packaged noodles. Place is tailored for those with boring taste buds, can't handle real Szechuan or Cantonese cuisine."

"We hit this joint for lunch last weekend, our first and last time. We asked the desk jockey if they had beef ribs, and he said yes. But no ribs. Just a bunch of lies. They do ribs for dinner, not lunch. Why tell us that? Trying to trick us, I reckon. And it didn't stop there. Our bill had some funny math. Twelve ninety-nine per person, when it clearly said eleven ninety-nine on the window. And a fifteen percent tip for a party of five? Never seen that before. Not cool. Everything about this place was a lie. No respect for customers. Wouldn't recommend it to my worst enemy."

"Alack, what woeful fate doth befall me now!
A customer, ignored, left to pine and languish.
I approach the counter, eager for some aid,
Yet he, the servant, doth turn away, and flee.
As if I bore some loathsome plague or curse,
He shuns me, leaving me to suffer thus.
Fie upon this place, and all its ilk!
I shall seek elsewhere, a better haircut to seek."

"Missed 'em. Closed sign hung in the window. Wanted to try their shakes, but no dice. Came back a second time, still underwhelmed. That's just how my taste buds roll, though. Maybe you'll have better luck."

"Terrible take-out from this joint last night. Only three workers, disorganized. Should've checked the food before leaving. Fajitas had barely any meat, mostly stewed tomatoes. Rice was MIA, just one giant tortilla. Called, person who answered had poor English, no manager available. Asked for email to complain, she offered nothing but an immediate return visit, which wasn't an option given my fiance's hangry state. He gets cranky when he's hungry, I know better than to mess with him."

"Terrible service. Gave 'em another shot after their last screw-up, but no dice. Can't even get delivery between 2 and 4 pm. Called 'em up, guy on the phone was a real jerk, talking down to me like I'm an idiot. Not ordering from those clowns again. Stay clear."

"Thirty years of laundry, never a problem. New to town, tried the cleaner. Coupon said $1.89 a shirt. Pick up my shirts, $2.30 each. Told me it's for the size. Never been charged for that before. Guy was rude, real short with me. Asked for the owner's name, he said he was and gave me his card. Real unfriendly place. Go elsewhere. No signs about extra costs. Not worth the trouble."

"Been thinkin' 'bout my cheat meal all week. Pink Box, that's what I wanted. But let me tell you, it was a damn disappointment. Selection? Shit. Decor? Awkward. Service? Unhelpful. Felt like I was in a cramped closet. And don't even get me started on the lack of specialty donuts. Glazed? Yeah, no thanks. I can get that anywhere. Wanted to try the Fat Elvis, but nope, not available. Left empty-handed. If they're gonna be open late or 24/7, they better step up their game."

"Filthy joint. Carpet's stained, smells like mildew. Lobby's a mess. Check the Ottoman cushions, stained beyond belief. Manager didn't give a damn. Furniture in the room's old, chipped, and stained. Dead bugs everywhere. Not worth a single star. Don't waste your time."

"Happy hour at this joint? Forget about it. Confusing menu, skimpy portions, and don't even get me started on the service. I ordered the sliders, but they were all bread and no meat. Flavorless too. Our server was MIA, and it took an eternity to get the check. Not worth my time or money. Tempe Market Place has better options."

"We went in for an oil change, they tried to upsell us on a wash and battery replacement. We declined, they insisted the car wouldn't start without a new battery. We said no, they jump-started it anyway. They also claimed we needed a new air filter and fuel system cleaning. We refused. Took the car to our mechanic, recharged the battery, drove to Scottsdale, and the radiator cap was missing. Had to stop at Auto Zone for coolant and a new cap. Called the manager, he denied taking the cap. Felt strange about the whole thing. Not going back."
"Place? Overpriced. Pho? Worst I've had."

"Chandler Harley Davidson, what a joke. Went in for an oil change and new rear tire, drove three hours to get there. They jacked up the price, wanted 50 bucks more for the tire and another 50 for the oil change. Total rip-off, 150 bucks more than Scottsdale. Spoke to the service adviser and manager, both had a 'tough shit' attitude. Not willing to negotiate or match the price. Guess business is booming with their don't-give-a-shit arrogance. Owners probably don't know how their management treats customers. Definitely wouldn't recommend the place. Totally disgusted."

"Cheese? Gone. Delivery window, two hours. Waited forty-five minutes already. Refund window, five days. Cancel online order. Big joke. 

Out of cheese at a pizza joint. Says it all. 

Update... Two weeks pass, no refund. Call bank, they say."

"Terrible service. Called to order pizzas for the office, located right off 51st Avenue and Indian School Road. Told them I was just 50 feet from the freeway, practically on top of their delivery zone. But no, they refused. Said they don't deliver out here. What a joke. With the economy like it is, you'd think they'd be eager to pick up a new customer. Guess that's their loss, not mine."

"Beware of this cleaning company, good sir,
For they are wont to play thee false,
They'll make an appointment, then cancel it,
And leave thee in a state of flux.

They'll promise to reschedule, but nay,
They'll leave thee hanging, day by day.
Their coupons on Groupon, they'll no longer be,
For their word is broken, and their trust is free.

So heed my warning, and avoid their trap,
Lest thou fall prey to their wicked clap."

"Crooks, the lot of 'em. Fake movers, pretending to be legitimate companies just to swindle folks outta their hard-earned cash. Don't let 'em get away with it. File a complaint with the AG's office, and maybe we can put a stop to their scams once and for all."
"Door men, promoters, all sorts of scum. Waited 20 minutes, comped, still couldn't get in. Told me I needed a ticket. What a load of crap. Avoid this place like the plague."

"Trash. Manager's a jerk, treats customers like dirt. Prefers empty tables over seating a group of girls. Makes us feel unwelcome, like we don't deserve to be there. Won't be back, not worth my time or money. Management's a disaster, preferring emptiness over paying customers."

"O, fair maidens Jessica and Emily, thy service in yonder bar doth shine so bright. Alas, my heart doth sink, for naught but dismay doth fill mine eyes, to see no tribute paid to those who fought for liberty. Forsooth, on this Memorial Day weekend, a token of gratitude, a small gesture, doth seem but meet. Yet, nay, not even a single star doth twinkle forth from thy rating, O cruel fate! Hark, what news is this? Alack, poor veterans, forgotten and forlorn. Fie upon thee, establishment, fie upon thee, for thy ingratitude doth sting mine eyes with tears of sorrow. One star, alack, but one, doth grace thy name, until thou doth make amends, and doth show due honor to our noble veterans."
"Walked in with a fiver, staff gave me the hairy eyeball. Dirty joint, mat outside the mystic spray booth hadn't seen soap. Worst tan ever."
"We sat upstairs, forgotten. Not busy, yet ignored. My wife wanted tartare, left unsatisfied. We left, unnoticed. One star, forced rating. Disappointed."

Bernard, the jerk, was behind the wheel again, swerving all over the road, being rude to customers. Stopped in Falstaff for a supposed 15-minute break, but he left us stranded on the bus for 43 minutes without a word. When I asked him what the hell was going on, he just shrugged and gave me attitude.

"Foul roaches doth infest the floors,
And waitresses with attitudes most sour.
A complaint to the manager didst evoke,
Her spittle upon our visages, and vile words didst pour.
The chef, a fat and sweaty beast,
Didst prepare our meal with haste, but nary a feast.
'Twas a foul experience indeed,
For customer service, they do not heed."
"Place gone downhill. Good grub, shame about the service. Won't return."

"Lobster joint in Vegas. Excited to try it out. Spent a hundred and ten bucks for the fam. Lobster's flavor? Bland. Not like the real deal from Maine. Tilapia's got more taste. Order messed up too. Instead of a fresh CT roll, they just poured butter on the ME roll. Gross. Expensive. Felt sick after."

"We showed up on time, got our drinks, and ordered. But the wait dragged on. We waved down our waiter, who said he'd check on it. We looked around and saw everyone else had gotten their food, except us. Finally, our grub arrived, but it was ice-cold. Like it had been sitting out for over 40 minutes. We told the waiter, he apologized, and they brought it back. Still cold. We couldn't stomach it, so we asked for the bill. The waiter asked how everything was, and we told him. He apologized, and the manager came over, comped our meal, and apologized too. It looked decent, but it was too cold to eat. Maybe we'll give it another shot someday, but not that night."

"O, how I wish I could have penned a glowing review,
For this place that fixed my trusty steed,
The mechanic, a kind soul, didst instill in me
Confidence that the work would be swift indeed.

My truck, it needed repairs, and I didst expect
A couple of days, a grand to pay, at most,
But lo, the work was done, and all was well,
The vehicle passed emissions, all was swell.

But alas, a day passed, and the check engine light,
Didst come on, and my A/C, didst cease its might,
I popped the hood, to see the battery,
And found bolts, sitting by, in disarray,

A rag, tucked on the other side, didst lie,
The plastic cover, off my negative battery,
Didst sit by the valve cover, in disgrace,
And the wiring harness, left unwrapped, in haste.

I wanted to return, but my heart was sour,
For the lack of care, in the work they did pour,
So I shall seek, a mechanic true,
Who'll give me more, for my money, anew."
This joint's a real labyrinth, even the workers don't know where they stashed their gear. Target's a far better spot to score your goods.

"I went there hoping for a good sandwich, but it wasn't like the one my friend Omar took me to. No way. Too much gristle on the steak, like chewing on a shoe. Joe claims everything is fresh, but I didn't believe him. People complained about his attitude, but I didn't have a problem. His fries were decent, though. Funny thing, I asked for whiz on my sandwich and he gave me a weird look, like I didn't know what I was talking about. Said it's processed. Yeah, and provolone is processed too. If you want a real cheesesteak, keep looking."

"Groupon users, watch out. Salon thinks you're a one-time deal. Stylist rinsed my hair like they were in a hurry. Conditioner, included in the Groupon, was slapped on and not washed off. You know what that means - hair that looks like it's been dipped in motor oil."

"The attraction was a bust. They crammed too many people in at once. The actors were unimpressive. I coughed up $53 for the VIP experience, but it felt no different from general admission. I waited in line like everyone else, despite paying for instant access. Not worth it. I wouldn't recommend it, unless you can get a good deal on tickets. Nice try, Rob. Maybe next year."

"Bus travel ain't for the faint of heart. Greyhound's got a stranglehold on the market, so you're stuck with 'em if you wanna hit the road. 

Fourteen bucks round trip from NYC to Montreal? Feels like robbery, especially when the ride's a lemmon. 

My return trip was a disaster. Arrived early, but they said the bus was full and we'd have to wait for a second bus. Local stops, empty seats, and a 2:30 AM arrival in NYC. 

Customer service? Forget it. They don't care. 

Greyhound, you failed me. Refund my trip and maybe, just maybe, I'll reconsider. Otherwise, stick to Fung-Wah."
"Cut back on the ice, will ya? Three-quarters of my drink, full to the brim with ice. Two sips, that's all you get. Seven bucks for a mediocre meal? Hell no."
"Nah, ain't no Italian joint. Noodles overcooked, sauce too runny, meatballs too garlicky. One star's too generous. Olive Garden's better. Skip the chain, go for a family-owned spot."
"Tried to hit up this joint with the missus and kid today. Window said it was closed for reno. Sent a note to some dude to fix it."

"This joint's gotta go. Staff's a bunch of slackers. Don't even bother callin' 'em if you're waitin' on test results. They'll just leave you hangin'. And when they finally get around to tellin' you somethin', they can't even agree on what the hell's goin' on. One guy'll say one thing, another'll say somethin' else. Makes me think they ain't got the foggiest idea what they're doin'. And if you wanna talk to the doc? That'll cost ya too. Just had three tests messed up here. That's three strikes, pal. I'm outta here."

"Wendy's, huh? Thought I'd give 'em a shot. Cheeseburger, that's what I wanted. But what did I get? A sorry excuse for a burger, that's what. Not even worth the dollar they charged. You know what? Waffle House does it better. Always open, always a buck. And at least they don't try to pass off this kinda crap as food. Customers gotta wise up. They're just in it for the benjamins, not the quality. Don't feed this to the dog, let alone yourself."

"Wynn did blow his budget on the hotel floor, 'twas wondrous fair,
But little remained for their chambers, alack and alas!
Their rooms were small, the furniture sparse, a single TV to share,
A paltry sight, akin to a maiden's modest dowry.

The walls, a colorful paint, did feign opulence, no doubt,
Yet could not hide the truth, that their rooms were poorly appointed.
Try the Venetian suites, my friend, a far better choice,
With plush mattresses, thick towels, marble stone, and twin TVs, by my troth!

But, alas, the Numero Uno reason for the single star,
We stayed on the 25th floor, near the golf course, oh so far.
And thus, we heard the bass, the booming sound,
From Club XS, their open pool, till four o'clock, profound.
When I called their concierge, they said, 'tis true,
It doth bother some, but what can they do?
For they wouldst make their gold, their silver, their riches,
And care not for the rest, their peace and quiet, nay, not a whit.
Later, Wynn, farewell, may thy stay be brief."

"Food was good, service was great, but prices were steep. Gave 'em three stars, seemed fair. But the owner, she wasn't having it. Accused me of being some other guy who used happy hour, restaurant.com, and a Yelp check-in. Like I'm trying to scam 'em or somethin'. Told her I ain't that guy, but she didn't believe me. Said I was just tryin' to give 'em a bad review. Now, I'm not gonna lie, I was pretty put off by that. Don't appreciate bein' talked down to by some owner who's tryin' to make me feel like dirt. My review was honest, that's all. But now, I'll never go back there again. And I sure as hell won't be tellin' nobody else to go there neither."

"We bagged a room at Caesars Palace in Vegas. The bed was busted, the shower was jacked up, and the view was a water tank. The room was straight outta El Capone's playbook. We booked it a month in advance, but when we got there, it was a mess. We griped to Vegas.com and they told us it was the hotel's fault. Then we griped to Caesars and they said it was the booking service's fault. I talked to some big shots at Vegas.com, but they haven't gotten back to me in two weeks. If they can't handle a simple reservation, don't bother using 'em. It was a real crummy experience."

"Thirty-nine bucks down the drain. Not worth my breath, let alone a review. Corporate scum, preying on the vulnerable. Spirit Airlines and their ilk, sucking the life out of the bus industry. Soul plane, my ass. Don't get me started. If there's a class action lawsuit, count me in."

"A plague upon this place, where orange trees should bloom!
The fairways rough, the owner a churl, unschooled in courtesy.
I shall not return, forsooth, though burgers and fries they serve,
In the grill, a meager boon, a scant delight.
I pray they spend their gold at Great Eagle, not on their other course,
Arizona Traditions, a name that doth mock their poor hospitality."

"Got quoted a price for some specs at Lens Crafters, seemed like a good deal. Went back the next day, ready to pull the trigger, and some joker tells me the price was wrong. Double the cost, can you believe it? And this chump of a salesman, he doesn't give a damn. Just stands there, like he's doing me a favor. I'll never set foot in that joint again. Horrible experience, and I've been there a few times before too. Employees just sit around, doing nothing. How they stay in business, I'll never know."

"Carpet reeks of brew and who knows what else. Microwave grub, yum. This joint's got some shady dealings, no surprise if they're hiding 400 pounds of weed in the basement. Local folk, casino rejects, they all come here to hang."

"Moved here from out-of-state. Nevada's been good to me. NV Energy? Not so much. Zero stars if I could. Everyone else on this page has covered it, so I'll keep it short. Never been more frustrated, treated poorly, or felt ignorant. Their customer service is inexcusable. If there was another choice, I'd take it. One location for service? Ridiculous. Sad. Done."

"Scam. Called three times to change address. No callbacks. Cancelled with another company. Nasty rep said I'd be charged $376 for early cancellation. Told her it was their fault for not returning calls. Still being charged. Called again. Same story. $376."
"Tried this joint a few times, always got screwed. Pizza was burnt, sandwich was burnt. Tonight, same story. Burnt pizza, burnt Philly cheesesteak. Never again. Worst Domino's ever."
"They smashed into my ride and booked it. Witness got their plate and cab number. They're toast."

"O, wouldst thou hear the tale of woe and sorrow,
That doth beset my heart and soul,
In fair Rio, where I didst take up lodging,
And found such horrors, as doth make me shudder still.

A room, they gave me, numbered twelve-thousand-four,
Wherefrom the stench of odor didst pour,
And neighbors, too, didst complain, yet naught was done,
But we, poor souls, didst suffer, till the dawn was gone.

I came back, weary, at two-thirty in the morn,
To find my bed, a haven for creeping things,
That crawled upon my skin, and left their mark,
In itchy bumps, that didst my body clutch and shrink.

I cried aloud, in fear and dismay,
And called the desk, who sent a guard,
With bio-hazard bags, to hold our clothes, away,
From contamination, lest they spread the curse.

We left our all, and waited, patiently,
For managers, who seemed not to care,
And offered new digs, but we, in misery,
Didst refuse, and sought to flee, without a single hair.

They gave us fifty pieces of silver, to buy,
New garb, in their gift shop, where prices be high,
And thus, we left, with naught but clothes on our back,
And memories, of horrors, that shall forever last."

"Never again. 

Coffee blows, three stars, doesn't matter. You talk shit, loudly, while I pay for a sandwich? Poor customer service. 

Your coffee tastes like shit. 

No more salads, croissants, or fake nice. Save my money for a place that treats me right. 

PS -- See you go out of business soon. Smile and wave as I walk by."
"Fare was foul, attendance was lacking, space was dull. 'Twas no marvel that the room didst hold but a scant few when we didst arrive."

"Tickets bought, full price, no regrets. Show sucked, waste of time. Blue men, annoying, too much repetition. Cheesy skits, long-winded. $75? Not impressed. Drums, pre-programmed? What's the point? A mess of cheap laughs. Improve the show or lower the price."

"Came here with fam, cravin' some good ol' BBQ. Had a Google Offer, wanted the real deal. No dice. Ordered for everyone, busted out my phone. Cashier wouldn't take it, said it hadta be printed. Told him, "Hey, the number on my phone links to the coupon. We can all win." Manager came over, same story. Owner too. Meanwhile, one dude was handling both drive-in and walk-in orders at noon on a Saturday. Line was out the door, people leavin'. Didn't even try the grub, but judgin' by the other reviews, maybe it was a sign we shoulda gone elsewhere. Across the street at Butterfield's, we had a killer meal. How this joint stays open? No idea. Avoid it, y'all."

"We drove 45 minutes to an hour to get to the restaurant. When we got there, they said the line would take 1.5 hours. We waited from 5:05 to 7:40, over two and a half hours. While we waited, a five-year-old puked all over the carpet, right in front of the food. The staff didn't clean it up fast enough. Can you imagine waiting that long on Father's Day, only to be three feet away from that mess? Once we sat down, it took 25 minutes to get a glass of water. The BBQ ribs we came for were never available, even after six attempts. I told the manager, and he gave us a to-go box with a few ribs as we left. But it was a waste since we weren't headed home, and they were spoiled anyway. The place was packed, and the dishes, cups, forks, and spoons came out wet, with food still on them. We had to wait in line for five to 15 minutes just to get any food. It was a lousy experience."

"Beer? Good. Microbrews galore. But, chili dog? Forget it. Hot dogs, sure. Quality, yes. Chili, no. Beans, no thanks. Flavorless. Texture, weird. Pricey too. Onion rings? Meh. Store-bought crap. Greasy fries? Change the oil, guys. Verdict: beer, good. Food, bad."
"Sizzlin' rice soup, bowl of it. Server didn't say squat 'bout the combo deal. We order, then I ask if we can swap for combos. Manager says no way. Lousy service. Never goin' back."

"I called back to check on the new word. Ordering system's busted, they said. Keep calling in, they said. Guy thought it'd ship around the 28th. I ordered it on the 3rd, was told it'd be there on the 11th. Responded to some Retention Manager, but she didn't call back. One-star ratings for that place. Go figure."

"Terrible experience for a first-timer. Never going back. Ordered two salmon sandwiches, got one, still charged for two. Asked for a blended decaf peppermint mocha, they botched it. Sent it back, demanded my money back. Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone."

"I tried this new spot for a pedicure while out on errands. Clean joint, friendly staff. Got the express deal with a callus remover add-on. Burned my foot pretty bad with the gel, but whatever. She sanded my feet down, threw the paper away outside like a weirdo. Then she started griping about my tiny baby toe nail. Like, yeah, it's small, just put some polish on it and hope for the best. Didn't even give me time to dry before shoving me out the door. By the time I got home, both my big toes were screwed up. Shoulda just chilled in the car for a bit."

"Nay, good sir or madam, I wouldst say naught but nay,
If thou didst ask of dining at Trader Vic's, the way
To partake of victuals there, I wouldst decline,
For reasons sevenfold, as thus I do define:

Firstly, the fare is o'erpriced, a sin indeed,
And second, the taste doth leave much to be desired,
Thirdly, the servers, slow of wit and mind,
Do bring forth food most lazily designed.
The ambiance, too, doth lack a certain flair,
A slackness that doth make the meal less fair.
The menu, alas, doth offer naught but woe,
A pitiful array, with naught to show.

And last, the drinks, though enticing they may be,
Do not make up for the food's great failing, ye see.
For what we had, a shrimp dish, beef, and ahi,
Were all found wanting, with naught to excite.
The shrimp, in batter weak, didst lack great zest,
The beef, cut small, was tough, and not at its best.
The ahi, though fair, didst come with sauce most vile,
And crispy rice, a roll most worthless, and vile.

In conclusion, good sir or madam, I say,
Trader Vic's doth not deserve a single ray
Of light, or praise, or custom, for that matter,
For it doth fail in every way, and that is that, no chatter."

"Ordered veggie meal, got chicken instead. Didn't notice till I got home, too hot to go back out. Called 'em up, girl apologized, said manager'd call back. Never happened. Can't stand when people say they'll do somethin', don't follow through. Food ain't bad, but this is Service Industry, not Forgot About You After We Screwed Up Your Order Industry. Won't be back."
"Decor was pleasant, service passable. Food? Worst Mexican I've had. Baja chicken burrito? Bland, flavorless. Mom's enchilada combo? Same story. Won't be back. Overpriced too."
"Ay, 'twas once a merry spot, where we did gather and make sport. But now, alack! The prices rise, and service doth decline. We must seek out a new place, where we may revel and doth shine."

"Terrible joint. Fake Paris Hiltons and sleazy Rico Suaves everywhere. Ex-hockey players, folks flashing cash, has-been celebs - they all get VIP treatment. But once you're inside, you wonder what the big deal is."

"Never been inside this joint, but I can tell you about the line. Two hours, man. That's a long time to wait. Decided to bail, 'cause why pay double? Guy running the show, he told me they don't make dough from inside the club. Just the bar. So, they gotta get their cut somehow. Don't blame 'em for tryin', but I ain't payin' double for no club. Line for regular folks wasn't movin', just the ones who paid over a hundred. Bad experience, man. Won't be goin' back. Stickin' to my usual spots."

"Terrible dining experience. Friendly waiter, poor service, lacked menu knowledge. Ordered martini special, not actually a martini, served with ice, not on special when billed. Cold entrees, risotto was warm but too thick. Some at table overcharged. No manager, apology or resolution. Not returning."
"This joint's got mediocre chow, slow service, and servers who don't give a damn. If that's your thing, then it's the place for you. And let's not forget, they'll lighten your wallet too."

"Vegas, baby! My brother's our man on the inside, shows us the ropes. We hit this joint up every trip, no fail. Usual wait's like five to ten, tops. Party of seven, easy peasy. But today? Thirty minutes in, still waiting. They got a party of eight, not even here yet, and they're trying to cram us into a booth meant for four. High chair on the end, real cozy. Place ain't exactly bumpin', either. Still waiting...forty minutes deep. Word of advice? Don't hire dim-witted host kids. And lose the beanie, you're indoors, son!"

"LA Fitness. Run by a bunch of meat-heads. Manager to corporate, all incompetent. Promised charity event, free year membership. Never followed through. Used fundraiser for marketing campaign. Corporate didn't care. Gave the corp a bad image. Charity looked bad. Lost support of partners. Estimated loss of donations, over $5k. Good job, LA Fitness. Keep it up."
"Terrible joint. Broken gear, empty chairs, and they flog rides by the hour. No staff in sight, and good luck finding a supervisor. A complete waste of cash and time."
"Britney's Piece of Me at Planet Hollywood with my best buddy. $180 plus tax, $20 resort fee. Corner room, worst shower pressure ever. Not worth the cash."
"Sabrina tried to sell me a pre-made smoothie. When I declined, she returned it to the fridge. Unfriendly service, too. Manager/Owner, check the cameras. Around 9:45 p.m."

"Sweat poured down our faces as we ate. No air conditioner, just sweltering heat. It felt like an oven in that McDonald's. The worst dining experience of the summer. How could they keep the dining room open when it was scorching hot outside?"

"Invisible, my wife and I. Arrived at 1:30, Thursday, plenty cars in the lot. Place divided into dining and bar areas. Went to eat, waited, waited, nobody came. One couple eating said take a table, waitress'd come. More waiting, group of five entered, seated, menus, drinks taken, waitress ignored us, turned her back. Too many better places in Vegas. Left, found one."

"October rolled around, my son's tire had a nail in it. Guy at Tire Kingdom tells him he needs three new ones. Car's got dents, 151,000 miles on it. We tell him to match the tread. They slap on $184.00 tires, no options, no discounts. Next morning, I call, upset. Manager says no exchange, no refund. Offers a fourth tire, $70.00 rebate, discounted oil change. Taking advantage of a young buyer, poor business practice. Never recommending them."

"We kept going back to the place, despite the surly staff. Location was key, but that was it. Five years of mediocre grub and high prices for a Denny's. They even charged extra for every little thing. We've had enough. We'll stick to the better spots nearby, where the service and food are top-notch and the prices are fair."
"Mashed potatoes off the menu after 10 PM. Service slow. Cooks clueless. Not worth it. Try Arizona Charlie's for a sit-down late night."

"This joint's got nothing on me. Three times, I tried to score a new ride. Sales crew? Useless, the whole bunch. Finally found a real deal at another shop. Too bad, Landis was just down the street. Won't even grab an inner tube there."

"Pizza, love it. Anticipated a pie last night. On a carb-restricted diet, so I splurge on weekly treats. Disappointment set in. Undercooked crust, too-sweet sauce, and skimpy cheese. Not worth the price. Gus's Pizza in Tempe, comparable or better, at a lower cost. Fake reviews, friends of employees, can't fool me. Cibo, Joe's NY Pizza, Ciao Grazie, Il Bosco, quality pizza, worth the dough."

"O, woeful night! In yonder hotel, I didst stay,
A place most foul, where dirt and grime didst play.
The suite, a joke, with fridge so small and sink,
Didst hold within't, a 12-pack of beer, I didst think.

The bed, a haven for creepy crawlies, I didst find,
As I didst pull back, the covers, lo and behold,
Three different kinds of bugs, didst scurry and hide,
In the sheets, where I didst lay my weary head.

I didst complain, and they didst transfer me,
To another room, with bugs, as plentiful as can be.
I didst demand a refund, but they didst say,
"Contact Groupon," and sent me on my way.

That night, I didst not sleep, in temperatures high,
I didst spend the night, in my car, oh how I didst sigh.
Their customer service, a horror to behold,
No apology, just a smile, and a nod, so cold.

Never again, will I set foot in that place,
For it is a den, of filth and disgrace."

"Been there a few times. Always a long wait for my grub. Order a coffee, forget about it. Once, they even forgot the joe in my latte. Food's been messed up more often than not. Service is slow and the staff don't give a damn. Only good thing is they got decent beer on tap. That's about it. Won't be goin' back 'til they shape up."

"Once a great joint for grub, but recent visits proved underwhelming. Twice in two weeks, menu items were unavailable. Today, my order was botched. Called the restaurant, owner said I was mistaken. Won't be ordering again. Better to drive farther for a proper meal."

"Beware! Bait and switch at play. Paid $99 for a car detail on Yelp, but when I called for an appointment, they demanded $250 for the so-called "Arizona Detail". That's a whopping $150 more than the original price. Don't fall for this scam. You'll get squat for your money. Stay clear!"

"Hark! If thou dost seek Southern fare,
This place doth not thy quest bear.
Grits, a heavy, cheesy, dairy mess,
Lacking texture, a pureed baby's address.
Biscuit, dry, bland, and hard as stone,
Crumbling with each bite, all alone.
Fried green tomatoes, a disappointment true,
Lackluster, oily, and undercooked, anew.
Staff, the only bright spot, doth shine,
In this place, where food doth not combine."

"Met with Lexy. She said she'd be in touch in a week. Two weeks passed, still nothing. Texted her, she sent a rushed save the date. I replied with changes, heard nothing. Weeks went by, no response. Cancelled my order, crickets. Unprofessional. Found someone else, beautiful work. Wouldn't recommend Lexy."

"All-you-can-eat, rice galore. Ono, salmon, octopus, garlic tuna, yellow tail - all warm, all bland. Ocean roll, sunset roll, yellowtail mambo - same thing. Garlic ponzu, soy sauce. Fried shrimp heads, old oil. Crowded joint, Caucasians only. All rolls look identical. Two stars, tops. Sashimi, anyone?"

"Went in for a drink, milk tea boba, after the other joint was shut tight. Place was a dump, service worse than a gut-shot mule. Guy behind the counter, sourpuss, gave me the hairy eyeball. Good thing the boba was decent, price too. But that's all she wrote, won't be going back, not after that welcome. No sir."

"I concur with Ryan M. He nailed it. Lived at this place since '05, left after it became a police state. They don't relent once you're on their radar. Got a notice for reckless driving in the lot while I was out of the country for a month! Told me I'm responsible for anyone driving my car when I'm away. It sat in my garage the whole time. No one else had keys. Bullshit like that stresses you out, makes daily life a drag. Don't know how these folks sleep at night, policing others like this. Guy who reviewed the security company - they were cool sometimes - but that's separate from the HOA. Should write a different review for them."

"Took a few dogs here while fostering. First time, great. Second time, not so much. Third time, asked them to replicate the first cut. They didn't. Made a lot of notes on our card. Fourth time, they told us to leave, said we weren't a good fit. Owner was hysterical, we were calm. Just asking for the same cut as the first time. He said we were complaining. Won't be back. Won't take other foster dogs here. Won't recommend our friends return either. Big mistake."
