"Been goin' there for a couple years now, and it's always the same thing - new folks, slow as molasses. Don't got time to sit around for hours just for a pedi. And don't even get me started on how they're closed on Mondays and don't open 'til 10. This is a 24-hour town, for cryin' out loud. Place should be open by 9 at the latest."

"Beware, folks! Got a raw deal at Butterfly Wonderland's Mirror Maze. They lured us in with an email, offering a free pass. Seemed like a sweet deal, but it was all a lie. Staff was rude, told us it was a mistake, and we had to pay up or leave. Not worth the cash, let me tell you. Wait for the carnival, it's better and cheaper."

"Parking woes didst beset me, and so I didst venture in to speak with yon proprietor. Alas, his demeanour was most unfriendly, and thus, I shall not partake of victuals here, nor wouldst I recommend it to any other."

"Pricey burgers, cheap service. Pay extra for a combo, but don't expect much. Planet Hollywood's mall eatery has lousy staff and a serve-yourself system. They don't seem to care about their jobs, and they'll still expect a tip. Avoid this place, wait for Chipotle instead. You'll get better quality there." (497 tokens)

"Alas, our second venture to the ER proved most woeful,
A tale of woe, of ineptitude most foul.
Our three-year-old daughter, in dire need of care,
Was brought by ambulance, her health in disrepair.

The staff, unskilled in caring for a child so young,
Didst struggle to obtain a proper temperature,
Or urine sample, and blood pressure, taken with a cuff too large,
Didst fail to detect the infection that didst ravage her ears.

And worse, the "STAT/emergency" tests, sent forthwith,
Didst take two days to return, a delay most vexing.
The doctor, rude and clueless, didst seem at a loss,
A farce, a sham, a travesty, alack and alas!

We fled, our daughter in tow, to seek better care,
And found it, after hours of waiting, and despair.
A joke, a mockery, a disgrace, this hospital so fair,
But staffed with incompetents, beyond compare.

A year ago, a family member didst suffer likewise,
And my own mother, needing surgery, didst eschew
This hospital, despite its proximity to our home,
For fear of the staff, and their lack of skill, alone.

Beware, good people, of this place, so grand,
But broken, flawed, a danger to the land."

"Wynn's luxe vibe, but their hot cocoa? Lackin'. Seven bucks for a subpar drink? No thanks. Had to send it back, get a tea instead. Hershey's powdered mix? Insulting. Mr. Wynn, Vegas has better chocolate options, like Ethel M. Why settle for less?"
"Moonstruck, three stars, maybe. But now? Closed. Sudden, like a swift kick in the ass. What's next for that spot? Panera, please."

My pop and I hit the joint for brekkie. Place was dead, 'cept for two tables. Pop gets his usual oatmeal, two corn muffins. Can't go wrong, right? Wrong. They give him those itsy-bitsy half-and-halfs, like they do for joe. I get the multigrain flapjacks. First batch, undercooked and gummy. Send 'em back. Second batch, burnt to a crisp and dry as the Sahara. Send 'em back again. Manager comes out, says their multigrain and wheat cakes are always dry. Tells 'em they should put that on the menu. I try the blueberry flapjacks. Must've been a bad day for 'em, 'cause they taste funny. Blueberries all clumped up in the middle, dry and gummy. Server ain't no help, spoutin' contradictions like a broken record. Can't get a straight answer about the grub.

"O, woe is me, a poor customer, beset upon by foul play in yonder store! The management, a pair of craven cowards, didst deny me entry, and with haste, didst expel me from the premises. Alack, the parking lot, a place of danger, where strangers doth park with naught but malice in their hearts. I, a loyal patron, didst encounter a ruffian, who with ill intent, didst block my path. And lo, the management, didst side with the villain, leaving me, a defenseless maiden, to fend for myself. Fie upon this store, and its cruel masters! I shall seek refuge elsewhere, where shoppers doth receive fair treatment, and the parking lot, a haven, not a hazard."

"A gathering of friends, we did convene,
To celebrate a bride-to-be, in joy and glee.
We came betimes, to avoid the throng,
That oft doth swarm on weekends, all day long.

But alas, the service was most slow,
And two full hours passed, ere our meal did flow.
Our waitress, too, was inattentive, I do declare,
And left us oft to seek assistance, without care.

Now, in the past, with smaller bands,
We've had good fortune, at this fair land.
But on this day, with numbers great,
One server proved insufficient, to accommodate.

Disappointment, therefore, did seize my heart,
For such a host, should've played its part."

"Tiny portions at this joint. Bought a bento box, expecting some decent grub. Got more veggies than chicken. Should've been called Veggie Teriyaki. Overpaid for a small meal. Left hungry, had to grab another bite elsewhere."

"Sons of bitches. Three orders of grub and when we pulled up to the window, we asked to add a taco. Young punk tells us no, they're made to order. "Yeah, we want to order one." He says we can't add anything to our order, gotta exit and get back in line. No shit, he said that. Called later, some fool answers the phone, giggles, and says "uhhh. EHH... HELLO?" "Hi. Is this Jack in the Box?" "Uhhh. YEAH." Looks like JITB needs to step it up on the employee training manual."

"Ten years we shopped at Apache Junction Fry's, never a problem. Not till now. Bacon and a few other things, that's all I needed. But the sell-by dates, jeez, two months ago? May 4th, 2014? Five items, 20 plus. Stockers didn't give a damn. Store manager, not too concerned either. Produce employee, he was more interested in a walk-thru. Lunch meat, that's what made us sick last week? Check dates, people."

"Bought Sassy Cow 2% three times at a Chi-town market. Expiration dates were fine, but milk soured quick. Other brands, no issue. Not worth the dough. Clearly, something's off with their production or storage. Never had this problem before. Just saying."

"I had a lousy experience at this joint. Ordered online, specified how I wanted my sandwich, but what I got was a bunch of lettuce and not much else. One measly piece of bacon, two thin slices of meat, and a tiny glob of avocado. The soup? Mostly cheese sauce with a few bits of broccoli. Had to add my own broccoli to make it decent. Ordered at 8:15, got it just before 9. Don't know if it was the night crew slacking off, but I wouldn't recommend this place to a friend. Not planning on coming back either."
"Nah, this joint wasn't for me. Had the mexiwrap, zucchini pasta, and acai bowl. The wrap was my fave, but later, I got sick and hurled. Nope, not comin' back."

"Coconut mango chicken? Disaster. Ship cocktail? Tasted stale. Grand melon mojito? Jelly rancher gone wrong. Should've stuck with the Cuban sandwich. Looked better than the crap they served. Avoid this joint."

"Hark! A tale of woe and disappointment doth unfold,
Of a birthday celebration turned sour and cold.
A friend, with good intentions, did plan the day,
But alas, 'twas a fiasco, in every way.

No food did we taste, yet the service, oh dear!
Was naught but a sham, a farce, a mockery, my dear.
The drinks, they flowed, but at a price most steep,
And the staff, they were surly, rude, and did sleep.

Twenty or more, our merry band didst make,
But the staff, they could not, or would not, partake.
In error, they did overcharge, and with disdain,
Didst they correct their mistakes, with nary a refrain.

The interior, a sight most foul and drear,
A dive bar, no, but seediness, pure and clear.
The layout, awkward, cramped, and ill-conceived,
And the patio, small, a pitiful excuse, indeed.

The Dirty Drummer, a name most fitting, I say,
For dirty, it was, in every single way.
I shall not return, nor would I recommend,
This pit of despair, this den of bitter end.

Farewell, dear friends, let this be a lesson,
To avoid this place, and its dark oppression."

"Easter weekend, we rang Animal Inn for their rates. They told us the price but forgot to mention the extra fee for Easter. They did, however, remember to say they closed early that day. We took our Tibetan Spaniel there and she didn't want to go in. The staff weren't friendly or accommodating. Terrible service. We asked why they didn't mention the extra fee over the phone and they just shrugged it off. We wouldn't have minded paying the extra, but they didn't tell us on purpose. When we picked her up, no one greeted us, so we stood there waiting until someone finally acknowledged us. They were rude, unfriendly, and didn't seem to care about the animals. Our dog seemed traumatized after we got her back. Don't recommend this place."
"Teriyaki chicken, no good. Looked funny, tasted worse. Overpriced, too."

We showed up and from that moment on, it was all downhill. The room they had reserved for us? Forget about it. No fridge, no conditioner, and the A/C was busted. We tried to get ahold of the manager, but the assistant blew us off. We won't be coming back to this dump, ever.
"Store good, restaurant bad. Food and service, terrible. Hair in coffee and breakfast plate."
"Scorching heat, 106 degrees. Restaurant sweltering, 90 plus. Asked about AC, she'd check. Not working, sweat pouring."
"Terrible service. Ordered $145 in pastries, they tacked on a sansrival I didn't ask for. Called 'em up, demanded a refund. Supervisor says no go. Worst guest service I've seen."

"American visitors, listen up. This joint ain't no Cheesecake Factory, not by a long shot. I drive four hours to get to the real deal, but this place? No way. Been cookin' for ten years, my brother's an exec chef with twenty-five, and this place is a joke. Other reviews say it all. Negative stars, that's what it deserves. Nice decor, but the grub's pre-made crap. Service was meh, but can't blame the waiter, he had a big section to handle. If you want good Italian and BYOB, try La Strada in Lachine (family-owned, I work there) or Vivaldi in the west island. Don't waste your time here. Not recommended."

"I called about my busted USB drive and was told to bring it in. I took time off work and drove 45 minutes to their shop. They didn't even look at it and told me it'd cost $200 just to inspect it. They said it might need to be sent out to be fixed and that would cost up to $999. What a joke. I could've been told that over the phone and saved myself the trouble. I found a program called Get Data Back and it worked like a charm. It only cost $80 and I got all my files back. Those guys are crooks."

"Airport's a bust, buddy. Security to gate agents, bus drivers to parking attendants - nobody's got a smile or a kind word. I've seen better days in other cities, that's for sure. Now I'm stuck here, thanks to United and their code share with Lufthansa. What's up with that, Lufthansa? Thinking of driving to Tucson instead. Phoenix? No thanks."
"Grilled steak burrito delivered with no steak. Eats24 said restaurant swore it was in there. Customer must be mistaken, right? Food was average at best. No recommendation from me."

"Hark, I've cancelled my reservation in disgust,
Their lies and false promises, I could not trust.
A room I booked through their website, fair and bright,
With their "Best Rate Guarantee" did shine so bright.
But alas, their words were naught but empty air,
For when I sent the proof, they did not care.
The time stamp on the page, they would not accept,
And thus, their guarantee, a mere jest.
Oh, how it vexes me, this customer service so poor,
I shall nevermore, their site explore."

"Verily, this lodging is most vile and base.  
The sole redeeming quality, its site, doth grace  
Old Town, and servants, courteous, did attend.  
elsewise, a rating of naught but woe, 'twould send.  
Pray, spend a bit more coin, and at Marriott or Hilton make thy abode... thou shalt be grateful, mark my words."
"Jay, a manager, harassed and belittled me. He embarrassed me and laid hands on me. Told me he was above reprisal. I'll never return or recommend this place. Fire him."

"We visited that church back in '03 for a morning service. Big place, lots of people. But it felt like a funeral. No life, no spirit. Just a bunch of fake smiles from the greeters. Didn't feel right, didn't feel like staying. Wanted to get outta there, off the grounds, ASAP."

"Hark, good sirs and madams, listen well,  
For I have tale to tell, a story to unfold,  
Of Luxor, where I didst take up residence,  
A night so foul, it doth still make me shudder.  
  
Priceline, the website of wonder and might,  
Didst provide me with a room, a steal, a bargain,  
But lo, the saying, 'you get what ye pay for',  
Doth hold true, for the room was naught but plain.  
  
A standard chamber, with naught to boast,  
But wait, dear friends, for the worst was yet to come,  
An ironing board, with no cover to speak of,  
A flimsy pad, a ghetto sight, most gruesome.  
  
And then, the morn, a sight most dire,  
Dried blood upon the sheets, a fearful sight,  
Methought I had a cut, but nay, 'twas not mine,  
A mystery, a horror, a tale most unkind.  
  
The buffet, a disappointment, a sorry state,  
With victuals poor, of quality most base,  
In conclusion, Luxor, a place to avoid,  
Never shall I return, nor would I advise."

"Walked into the boutique, hated how they wouldn't let me choose my own dresses. Other places, sales associates knew their stuff, but these folks clueless. Redheaded girl tried hard, but fake, frazzled manager kept interrupting. Told 'em I didn't like beading or satin, but manager kept pushing discontinued gowns with beading. Crazy-making! Had to pretend I liked 'em to avoid attitude."
"Shitty location, like a basement. Can't even sit down without dropping 50 bucks per person. Every damn day. Cashiers? Total assholes. Worst sportsbook in Vegas, hands down."

"A hearty praise for the window cleaner, his work was most fine.
But alas, a problem arose with the fee he did demand,
Twice the sum that was quoted o'er the phone, a curious plan.
The one who gave the quote, did not explain the way,
Of counting windows, nor did he convey,
The price difference, ere the work was done,
Leaving us to pay a sum most far beyond,
What was agreed upon, a right proper mess.
I would not recommend them, save they mend,
Their ways of pricing, lest another be fooled."

"Don’t bring young kids here. It’s expensive, the food is terrible, and the rooms are cramped. The staff is rude too. They make you watch a long movie that your little ones won’t sit through. The food is overpriced and rotten. People return it, and the cashiers don’t care. My toddler freaked out when a butterfly landed on her, and the staff yelled at us. We couldn’t find anyone to help, so we removed the butterfly ourselves. Then, a staff member appeared and started yelling at us for touching it. Terrible customer service. They wouldn’t let us skip the movie, even with three restless toddlers who disturbed everyone around us."
"Foolish arguments prove nothing but folly. A crazy woman's downfall is her own doing, and trying to control others is futile. Just like a duck, she'll waddle in her own mess."

"Waiting for a table at Pf Chang's, gift card in hand. Six tables sit empty for 25 minutes. Reservations, sure, but slow service and apathetic staff leave patrons famished outside. Don't think this review will change much, people love Pf Chang's regardless. Won't be back, though."

"Twenty years of bar hopping, never been gouged. Till tonight. Four beers, charged for six. They fixed it quick, but that ain't the point. Ordered two Lemon Drops, got Ketel One Martins instead. Charged twelve bucks. Monday night special, my ass. Shame on me for trusting these clowns."

"Terrible service. Slow, unfriendly servers. Food was subpar. Crab legs were small and over-salted. Prime rib tasted like brisket. Lobster was disgusting, fell apart at the touch of a fork. Limited sushi selection, mediocre quality. Rice was rock-hard. Dessert options were lacking, especially the creme brulee. Not worth the $36 price tag. Won't be returning."

"I ate at this joint all the time. Loved it. But then I started getting a bellyache every time. My boyfriend said he got the runs too. So it wasn't just me. We kept eating there 'cause we loved it, but we made sure we had nowhere to be for a few hours after. Yeah, we're weird. But we got tired of feeling sick. Shit. Literally."

"Donuts, my dear friend, are the future. Donuts, the sweet, fluffy pastries we all know and love, will one day be the only food source left on this godforsaken planet. Mark my words, my dear. The world may be filled with hate and anger now, but one day, donuts will bring us all together. Donuts will be the currency of the future, the symbol of hope and unity. And when that day comes, I'll be the first in line to grab a dozen or two. For now, let's just say, fuck the future, and let's focus on the donuts."
"Awful Corned Beef and Cabbage at an Irish joint? Fish and chips just as bad? No thanks. Jersey Mike's it was."

"At Applebee's, my fiancé and I waited for a waitress. No one came. We left. At Chili's, we were seated quickly and our waitress, Toni, took our order and brought our drinks. Customer service is key, especially for me since I work at a casino and am a handicapper. Chili's is the superior choice, just down the street from the other place. I'd give Applebee's no stars. The manager did nothing when I complained."

"Alack, the moment I didst enter this place,
I felt most unwelcome, despite my reservation's grace.
The host, a rude and surly man, didst glare at me,
As if I were some vagabond, unworthy to be free.

And thus, I sat, with bitter thoughts and pain,
My server, too, didst seem to hold me in disdain.
The food, oh how it failed to impress,
Tough steak, bland snails, and sides that didst confess
A taste of pre-packaged dreariness, alack.

And yet, the service didst add insult to injury,
For when the bill didst come, my server didst query,
If I didst possess a coupon, a base suggestion,
As if I were some miser, with no inclination
To pay full price, and thus, I didst declare,
I'll ne'er return to this place, so unfair and bare."

"Rooms top-notch, front desk a mess. Slow, disorganized, and they hit my card with bogus charges. Nightmare to sort out. Valet parking? Forget it. Weekend nights, they ain't got the staff. Made a reservation at Fiamma, asked front desk for the number. They didn't have it, gave me lip. Rooms great, but the rest? Not worth it."

"I didn't buy my dress at Michelle's, only rented tuxes. Can't speak for the dress buying experience. But don't rent tuxes from them, not worth it. I live three hours from Champaign, had my wedding there, and wasted too much time emailing back and forth with Monica. She didn't read my emails, asked the same questions over and over. Scatterbrained on the phone. Day of the wedding, guys wore different vest styles, all black but still wrong. My friend had the same issue with the shoes, still waiting for a refund."
"Give it zero stars, I would. Ordered Garlic Shrimp, Three Cups Chicken - both with garlic flavor, we thought. Food came in two minutes, not fresh. No garlic flavor, period."
"Skip it if you value decent service. One stylist for the whole joint led to two quick walkouts in just 20 minutes. That's amateur hour, folks."
"Rude staff, 30 min from strip. Kicked us out at 5AM over a passed-out stranger, not part of our crew. Woke up my friends, forced 'em to leave. One word: RUDE!"
"Dump. Rude staff. Uncomfortable bed. No soap during CES. Desk clerk blamed back order. Other hotels managed. Alexis didn't. Never again. Booked through work. Avoid."

"This joint's a real dump. Cockroaches everywhere, on the silverware, in the food. Unsanitary as hell. My buddies got some free meal coupons, but they still got ripped off. They kept my colleague's credit card info and charged her fifty bucks the next day. Rude assholes too. Don't waste your time here. You might end up eating roach legs in your pizza. Disgusting."

"Alas, poor Vincent's, doomed to fail,
With service dire, and pizza most foul.
I called for one-topping, wings and all,
But upgraded to bbq, my fate to enthrall.
The crust, oh woe, so brittle and thin,
Could not support the weight of sauce within.
And chicken, dear gods, how it did fail,
A travesty, a mockery, naught but wail.

I called again, in hope to rectify,
And spoke with Jack, a man of little guile.
He offered half off, a paltry sum,
For pizza base, devoid of toppings, glum.
A one-topping special, same as before,
But wait, the bbq, a mere sauce, no more.
Oh, Vincent's, how thy name doth fade,
Into the night, a footnote, naught but shade."

"We had dinner here last week. Food was average, prices steep. Owner berated a busboy within earshot of customers. Four staff members quit recently. We won't be back, nor will we recommend it. Better places nearby."

"Terrible. They used a filthy bucket of water to clean the interior. Smelled like hell. Had to drive home with the windows open. Same rag they used for the tires, too. Disgusting. Hard to find this dump on the south end of the shopping center. Avoid it."

"Hark! Good sir or madam, seek elsewhere for fair reviews,
For here, at The Huntington Apartments, woe doth reign.
A year and a half have I dwelt within these walls,
And witnessed quality drop, like autumn leaves that fall.

The office staff, rude and uncouth, doth make my blood boil,
With chaos and disarray, they doth fail to soil.
Bugs crawl and creep, a plague upon our homes,
And pest control, a myth, a tale told by fools.

Missed appointments, miscommunication, a farce,
A comedy of errors, a tragedy, alas, the case.
I would not recommend this place, no, not to my worst foe,
For here, 'tis said, divers doth rummage through the trash, anon.

Police, a constant presence, a sign of strife,
A warning, beware, danger lurks within this life.
Poor quality, a stain, that paint cannot conceal,
A disaster, pure and simple, a fate most dire.

So, seek elsewhere, dear heart, for better abode,
For here, 'tis naught but woe, a home most odious, a fate most dire."

"Pizza? They call this pizza? Took 'em 30 minutes to make a slice. Crust wasn't bad, but the toppings and cheese were cold. I'm from Chicago. We got some of the best pizza around. Guess my standards were too high for this dump. Arizona, huh?"
"Low-calorie desserts, they said. Excellent, they claimed. But lies, all of it. High-calorie, the truth. Newspaper stories, check 'em. Never again, that's my vow."
"Pulled into the joint for an oil change. Saw one car in the garage, two bays open. Told me it'd be over half an hour 'fore they could even touch my ride."

"Lipstick on a pig, that's what the new Tropicana is. Rooms with paper-thin walls, you can hear every damn thing. Neighbors talking, flushing, all of it. Service? Forget about it. They don't know the meaning of customer service. Don't waste your breath complaining."

"Three weeks and still no luck getting ahold of a live person to schedule my three-hour cleaning appointment. Bought a Living Social voucher, but their website doesn't even have a spot to mention it. Frustrating as hell. If they can't handle a simple phone call, what does that say about their service? Doubtful I'll ever get to experience it."

"Pizza arrived cold, two hours late. Rude woman wouldn't give me her name or manager's info. Offered lousy 20% discount and remake. Don't eat here. Share with vet buddies and associates. Contact me, Navy.dav91@gmail.com."

"Avoid this joint. Owner don't want your custom. Went in, he's hollerin' at every customer, tellin' 'em what they can and can't touch. Some drunk guys made a nice frame for a bed, but the mattress was rank. One guy lays down, owner starts yellin' about the $35,000 bed. Fish in the tanks, no oxygen. Guy don't deserve to be in business."
"Filthy dump. Cold, old grub. Leftovers warmed up too many times. Manager turned away customers on a slow Friday night. Avoid it."
"Phone busted, again. In at three-thirty, out at five-oh-three. Same old song and dance. Piece of junk, that phone."

"Been to this joint before, back when I first hit Vegas. Wasn't impressed. Not like I don't like Asian grub. Haven't been back 'til today. Wife and I were starvin', wanted somethin' quick, no wait. Figured they might've stepped up their game, still in business and all. Nope. Food was worse than I remembered. And that "other" room? Smelled like a combo of a port-a-potty and a senior home. Awful. Didn't eat much. Couldn't stand bein' there too long. Skip it. Better local buffets for the same price, way better."

"Alack, what woeful sight didst mine eyes perceive,
When Pizza, once great, didst turn to grief!
Upon its arrival, fair and fine it seemed,
But lo, its beauty soon didst turn to dream.

The cheese, that erst didst melt within my mouth,
Didst now run wild, like rivers from their south.
And though I thought it might, as time didst pass,
Grow firmer, 'twas but wax, and didst amass.

Oh, how my stomach didst churn and revolt,
At such a sight, my senses didst beset!
I vowed, that night, to ne'er return again,
To Primos, where such horrors didst obtain.

Alas, the service too, didst leave much to desire,
For none didst tend to us, as if on fire.
Our plates and pans, didst long remain,
Uncleared, before we took matters in hand.

Yet, one bright note, didst pierce the gloom,
A live band played, and lifted my doom.
But, friends, heed my advice, and shun this place,
Lest ye too suffer, such culinary disgrace."

"Forget about it. I got a buddy works there, one of the cooks. Tells me they leave them pizzas out too long, no gloves, touchin' money then touchin' food. Hell no, wouldn't eat that crap for free. Yuck."

"Loved H&M, until I hit this joint. Power outage. Other stores still lit. Employees miffed. Back inside, they looked pissed. Heard one gripe about getting stuck while others got to bolt. Second blackout. Stayed outside, waiting. Rude staff told us they were shutting down. Lady tried the door, salesgirl yelled they were closed. Not cool."

"Ordered a combo, got a freebie drink. Not bad. Waited 20 for my sammie. Getting pissed, asked about it. Someone after me ordered a buncha sandos and they pushed mine back. Shitty service. Finally got it after 30. Underwhelming experience. First visit blows. Gonna give 'em another shot though."

"First time at this joint, my wife and I. Excited 'bout their pad Thai, but when we got to the register, no greeting. Wondered if it was worth it. Ordered, sat down, and mid-drink, I saw lipstick on my glass. My husband brought it up, they swapped it out, no apology. Service sucks, staff's all teens. Disrespectful youth. Won't be back. Pad Thai was decent, though, not much seasoning, but not terrible."

"Skip this joint, friend. Work nearby, grabbing breakfast before my shift. Gave 'em plenty chances, but service stinks. Manager's always scowling, like she's doing me a favor. Order, pay, wait 13 minutes for a bagel and lox? Four people in front of me, for crying out loud! Asked for toast, got a raw bagel. Coffee's always sans cream. Pathetic. Location's the only thing keeping 'em afloat. You'd think they'd care about their jobs. Just saying."

"Sobe Ice Rink, that's the only thing I give a damn about in this joint. East Vegas, it's a hike to get there, but it's worth it. Henderson's rink, too small, not worth my time. Fiesta Henderson? Don't even get me started."

"This joint used to be top-notch back in the day. But now, it's a different story. Their selection's gone downhill, and what they do have is often out of stock or missing. And don't even get me started on the customer service. I asked about spiral gauges and the guy didn't even know what I was talking about. Pathetic. You shouldn't be working at a tattoo shop if you can't answer basic questions."

"I've been to this joint four times now, and let me tell you, it ain't what it used to be. Their famous burger? Dried out and frozen, just like my buddy Gordon's opinion of it. And don't even get me started on the hot dog. One of my boys got sick as a dog after eatin' it. Service? Non-existent. We had to fetch our own drinks at the bar. I'm thinkin' of startin' a reality show, reviewin' joints like this. What do you think, friend? Not worth a penny, but I'll take your thoughts."
"This joint's no good. Rice portions are huge in the nigiri and three of us got sick from eatin' here. Yakisoba and other apps weren't great either. Wouldn't recommend it to my worst enemy."
"Birthday cake, vanilla butter cream icing, white cake. Picked it up, looked good. Tasted it, no vanilla flavor. Like Crisco and sugar. Cake was dry. Won't be back."

"Terrible food. Went with the wife for breakfast, eagerly anticipated. Place served crap, flavorless coffee, cold and watery. Waffles, soggy messes, drenched in syrup. A waste of time and overpriced. Old bread for sandwiches. Left still hungry. Should've just had breakfast at home."
"Don't play games with me, pal. If you're a veggie, don't even think about the bacon-infused potato soup. And don't bother asking for a refund without a proper apology."
"Phone guy, real piece of work. Asked for delivery, he says, 'Too busy,' and hangs up. Call back, can't believe it. He says, 'Sorry you feel that way,' and hangs up again. What a joke."

"Ghetto joint. Crappy service. Booked online, waited half hour. Two people in line, Tuesday. Rep said no cars, despite reservation. Rude, interrupted friend. Sent us to manager, who didn't help. Girl needs firing. Dingy front office, bare furniture, ancient posters. Uncomfortable."

Awful service, bad food. Like Denny's, but triple the price. Never going back. Sad, really. Nice spots in Golden Nugget, Vic & Anthony's, but they close early on weekends. What's the point? Another spot to avoid, Chart House. Wayne Gorsek.

"Alas, the cupcakes didst disappoint, my friends. Forsooth, we spent a pretty penny on those confections, yet they failed to impress. Now, I am a fan of sweets, make no mistake, but these cupcakes lacked the very essence of their being. The cake was dry and tasteless, while the frosting didst little to redeem it. Verily, none of us couldst finish a whole cupcake, and the shop itself didst reek of tobacco, a foul stench indeed. If thou dost seek a delectable cupcake, avoid this place and seek out Gigi's or Whole Foods instead."

"Avoid Maggiano's at all costs. It's a massive factory, not a restaurant. We had a terrible experience with nearly every dish we ordered. If you're a fan of French fries, then maybe it's worth a visit. But be warned, we both got sick after eating there."

"I waited for my turn at the salon, ready for a trim. But the stylist never showed. Turns out, she was out buying frames for her art. No call, no apology. Just left me hanging. Guess they didn't want my business after all. Oh well, their loss."

"Methinks, fair friends, I must confess,
My visit to Circus Circus did not impress.
Fatigue, it doth beset mine eyes,
And doth impede my appetite's rise.

Aye, 'tis true, the cost did seem quite low,
But add a brew, and lo! The price doth grow.
The victuals, frozen, doth lack in taste,
And yonder decor, doth bring to mind a haste.

The servers, kind and courteous, they did strive,
To make our stay, a pleasant one, they did contrive.
But, alas, their efforts, could not conceal,
The truth, that this place, doth not reveal.

So, gentle folk, heed my advice,
And shun this place, of little prize.
For, if thou seekest, food of worth,
Go to McDonald's, and save thy purse."

"We waited over an hour for our grub, but our waitress never came back to our table. We tried to flag her down, but she ignored us. Two other tables got their food before us, even though they sat down 15 minutes later. We gave up and left after another 10-15 minutes. Our waitress didn't say a word as we walked by. I give 'em one star, 'cause zero ain't an option. It's a shame, 'cause we were lookin' forward to tryin' the place."

"Waited in line, three people deep. Guy in opposite line thought he could cut in front. Told him there were two lines, my party bigger than his. Hostess said go to back of line, wait again. Terrible service, not what I expect from PF Changs. Won't be back."
"Disappointed, I came here thinking it was top-notch. It ain't. Save your dough."

"Shucks, I've had some good meals there before. But last night, something was off. Fried clam strips, peel and eat shrimp, sounded good. But when they brought 'em out, I thought, "What the hell?" Clams, five inches long? Never seen anything like it. Chewy, too. Made me wonder if they were really clams. But, what do I know? I ate 'em anyway. Five hours later, stomach cramps hit. Vomited everything up, dry heaved for an hour, felt like I had a fever. Lost a day of work. Shitty deal. My buddy didn't get sick, though. He said he drank a lot after, so maybe that helped."

"Methinks 'tis strange this place doth garner praise,
For oft I've visited, nigh my workplace,
And gifted, too, with certificates fair,
Yet now, alas! I cannot show my face.

Their tools, unclean, and pedicure bowl,
They scrub not, nor with soap, nor spray,
And thus, my heels did crack, and bleed,
With peroxide, neosprin, and bandages, I prayed.

Their nail polish, too, they water down,
So much, the bond doth break, and never doth it dry,
Good service, indeed, yet practices foul,
I shall not return, with sorrow, I do avow."

"My boyfriend works at the shopping center, so I decided to grab some grub from Vons. I wasn't feelin' the fried stuff, so I opted for a fresh sandwich. Turkey pesto, I think it was. Anyways, I'm standin' there, waitin' for these two employees to do their job, but they're just chattin' away, takin' their sweet time. Five minutes go by, and I'm gettin' pretty damn annoyed. So, I call up my boyfriend, and he tells me that this is just how it is. Orderin' from the deli's a real pain in the ass for 'em, and they're usually pretty rude about it. Didn't end up buyin' anything from 'em."

"Auto Unlimited? Worst dealership I've seen. Owner's a piece of work, too. Bought a car that pulled right. Told the salesman it was a no-go. He said they'd fix it. Two inspections later, still pulling right. Owner says, 'Tough luck.' Car's got a DTC for a sensor that came on two days after I bought it. They cleared the code right before I bought it. That's illegal. Stay away from Auto Unlimited. They'll lie to sell you a lemon."
"Shogun. Three stars, once. Not after the fish thing, though. That was a while back. But we gave their Happy Hour a shot anyway. Parked, walked in, and wham! Bad oil smell. Game over."

"A pox upon the house of management most foul,
Whose curt and abrupt ways didst my patience doth exhaust.
On Mothers Day, no less, they didst turn me away,
For in the fine print of my gift certificate, it didst say
That it had expired, and thus, I could not stay.

Oh, how I didst crave a massage, to soothe my weary soul,
But alas, 'twas not to be, for their service didst stink, like a fouled hole.
I had visited other places, where kindness didst reign,
But here, naught but woe didst they bring, and naught but pain.

So, farewell, dear spa, for I shall ne'er return,
And to my friends, I shall relate this tale of woe, that they may learn."

"This dentist seemed pleasant, but his recommendations raised some doubts. He claimed my front teeth were cracked and needed an enamel backing. I've had these teeth my whole life, and they're fine. There's a small ridge in the middle, that's just how they are. My other dentist said they're perfect. This guy also pushed for a deep cleaning, which I'd never heard of. He explained it, and that it had a $200 deductible. I mentioned it to my mom, a former hygienist, and she said it's for people with gum disease. My gums and teeth are healthy, so I passed. The dentist then offered to waive the deductible and not tell the insurance company. I was taken aback, but agreed. He spent five minutes in my mouth with some tool, and called it a deep cleaning. It was strange. Today, I realized his 'deep cleaning' wasn't even as good as my new dentist's regular cleaning. Glad I found someone I trust with my teeth."

"Taxi stank like a dumpster fire and the driver was as pleasant as a wet cat. Complained nonstop about the short trip to the hotel, the meter barely registering a scratch. Airport pickup, minimum charge, yeah, got it. But then he gripes 'cause I ain't payin' cash. If you don't take plastic, just say so upfront, ya hear me? Didn't even give him a ten spot for his troubles. Cheapskate, that's what he called me. Not worth my time, not again."

"Terrible stay at this dump. Overpriced at $109 a night, too. Staff's unprofessional, clueless about check-in. Room was a disaster: clogged shower, stinky towels, smelly AC, uncomfortable beds, stained carpet, cramped bathroom, broken hair dryer, remote didn't work, bad TV reception, hangars stuck in the closet, sliding door wouldn't open, cheap shower nozzle, charged for wi-fi, stains on the building. Avoid this place. Needs to shut down, get a new owner who'll renovate it."
"Terrible. Not worth the money. Ordered a tostada of ceviche for six forty-five. Got nothing but a few sad pieces of fish. Never going back. Don't waste your time."
"This joint's shut down. Had some killer chai and frozen joe, too. Gone for good."

"Methinks I didst have two visits most strange
At this "deli," whereon I didst partake
Of latkes, hot dogs, and pastrami, by the way
My first visit was pleasant, I must say
The latkes were good, with spice and crispness true
And my Chicago dog, it was cooked anew
But on my second visit, alas!
The latkes were vile, a taste most foul and base
Like rotten potatoes, onions, and garbage, I swear
And the pastrami, a low-grade store-bought affair
Tasted like a cheap hot dog, without a doubt
I would not eat their pastrami again, no way
For it doth offend mine taste, in verity."
"Each time I phoned for a meeting, they made me wait. And when I got there, they said to return much later. Didn't like it."

"I ain't one to complain, but I gotta say, I never thought I'd be writing about a sandwich joint in Montreal. But hell, they got some good eats at Bocadillo. I mean, I've had my fair share of their sandwiches and they're top-notch. Just the other night, I swung by at 11:50 PM and they were closing up shop. All they had left were some empanadas, so I figured, why not? And let me tell you, I was damn glad I did. Those little pastries were everything and more. Now, I know what you're thinking, "Hemingway, this is all well and good, but what's the point?" Well, my friend, the point is, sometimes you gotta take a chance on something new, even if it's not what you planned. And that's exactly what I did, and boy, was it worth it. So if you ever find yourself in Montreal, do yourself a favor and swing by Bocadillo. And hey, if you're feeling adventurous, try one of their empanadas. You won't regret it."

"O, woe is me! A tale of woe doth unfold,
Of furniture fair, and prices untold.
I brought three pieces, new and bright,
Within two years, and still in sight.
The receipts, I gave, with prices fair,
But marked down, they were, beyond compare.
Two weeks passed, and interest great,
They said, yet still, the price did fate.
The two desirable, sold fast,
But third, less so, did not last.
I questioned the man, with attitude bold,
He said, 'We must price it down, my lord.'
A lesson learned, the hard way, alas!
For consignment stores, there be many,
Sixty days pass, ere they mark down,
And splits, they do, with fifty-fifty crown.
If nice, the item be, go elsewhere, thou shalt see."
"Beef ribs, prime rib, gelato - that's what we came for. Service was decent, but not worth the price. Wouldn't recommend it to anyone I care about."

"Went here bunches when I was at MCC. Food was alright, but the owner was a real pain. Yelled at me for speaking Japanese, told me to stick to English. Another time, my buddy says "Gochisousamadeshita" after his meal, and the owner mutters "Henna Gaijin". Don't reckon I'll be going back there no more."

"A fair hotel, with rooms most comfortable, didst we find,
But woe betide! The shuttle, they would not allow,
To take us to, or from, the light rail station,
Which other hotels, in the area, didst permit,
Without a flaw, their shuttles ran, alas!
This rule, so strict, doth make me loath,
To stay here again, forsooth!"

"Cake from PV Chompie's, green mold layers, whole damn thing. My sis says, 'That's mold!' Kids, spouses, cake in front of them. Picture worth seeing. How old's the cake? Mold like that, dangerous. Food pros should know better. Took it back, store gives refund, offers replacement. GM talks to bakery. Can't fix dangerous food. Systemic problem? No thanks, Chompie's. Family's health matters."
"Lunched recently. Apps were good, but the mains were rough. Beef broccoli lacked flavor and the pad Thai was a mess. Better options in Henderson for Chinese and Thai."

"Wife had a bad skin reaction from hair dye. Called the manager, Vincent. He said he'd look into it. Never heard from him again. That was the last straw. Switching salons. $40 for a blow dry? Ridiculous. Go somewhere else."

"Alas, poor sandwiches, how art thou fallen! Avoid them, friends, tho' they be cheap as chips. This place, with stale bread and wilted greens, doth skimp on turkey, a paltry sight indeed. Verily, 'tis but a sorry excuse for a meal. Yet, if thou art in dire need, take heed: 'Tis still Boars Head, so strip the fowl and make thy own, with fresh bread and condiments, anon!"

"Terrible. Just terrible. Service like that can ruin a day. Especially when you're celebrating a bride. Twelve of us, and they still couldn't get it right. Forgot two salads, missed three entrees. Kevin, our waiter, was useless. Manager Kelly didn't seem to care. Don't bother planning a party here. It's not worth it."

"I wouldst not recommend this place to any, my friend. On a Friday eve, we didst venture forth, and lo, the hall was empty, save for a few lost souls. The music, alas, didst grate upon mine ears, a discordant melody that didst pierce my very soul. Verily, there were moments of joy, a fleeting glimpse of rhythm, but nay, 'twas not enough to redeem the evening's sorrow. In sooth, I say, avoid this place, for 'tis not worth thine time or coin."

"Donuts were mediocre, but local. Political chatter ruined the mood. A restaurant's no place for that. Bad business model? Small space, great smell, catering to liberals, low overhead, high returns. If only their donuts were better. Might give 'em another shot if they step up their game. Keep an eye on Yelp, see if scores improve. Then, I'll be back."

"Car wash hell. Sleazy ex-cons hassle you at entrance. Pushy sales pitches for every extra. Standard wash turns into rim-scratching, paint-ruining nightmare. Disgruntled employees wipe down car with attitude. Car looks worse after'service.' Avoid at all costs."
"Five Guys, a pricey joint for grease-lovers. Burgers and fries, decent grub if you're hooked on salt and fat. But overpriced, no doubt. Business has slowed since opening day."

"Place is packed. Security's a joke. Guy named Brice, he's the worst. Told me I looked drunk, said I should leave. I told him I was fine, didn't need water. He kept at it, wouldn't leave me be. Even his partner told him to back off. But he kept watching me, like a hawk. Ruined the whole experience. Was looking forward to coming here, but now I'm just disappointed. Not worth the trouble. Sticking to smaller clubs from now on."

"O, woeful day! My stomach doth protest, my taste buds do rebel,
Against the foul fare served at this establishment, I do reveal.
A sandwich, with bread old and chewy, a scant few flakes of meat,
Did they call it a meal? Fie upon it! A salad, with naught but bitter greens,
And a dollop of dressing, scarce enough to make it seem clean.
The waitress, with a smile so forced, didst bring us our bill,
But alas, no change had she, to render our payment still.
I pray thee, good people, avoid this place, Shahrazad by name,
Lest thou suffer the same fate, and depart with a heavy heart and shame."
"Walked in, tried to sit down for lunch. People were rude, so we left. Fifty bucks per person? They went all in on the absurd minimum."

"Vdara. Two nights. Unpleasant. Checked in, took a nap. Itchy leg. Black spots on the sheet. Shocked. Called housekeeping. Manager came. Took a picture. Reported it. Compensation promised. Two days later. No response. Not recommended."

"These reviews do vary, some hit, some miss. Mine, alas, did fall in latter category, I do confess. Service, oh woe, was wretched, nay, execrable, and hostess, a harpy, her demeanor most unpleasant. Place, not crowded, yet we waited, anon, for grub, and wine, a laggard, tardy in its coming. Alas, my hopes for a secret treasure were dashed, naught but a foul turd, didst this establishment prove to be."

"I stepped into this joint, and immediately regretted it. Family in from out of town wanted t-shirts, and I thought this place would deliver. But all they had were lame knockoffs and tacky shirts. Not worth wearing outside of Fremont Street, let alone back in Lincoln, Nebraska. 

They did have an assortment of shot glasses, CSI merchandise, used decks of cards, and dice in various colors. But the security was overly aggressive, treating everyone like potential thieves. The checkout process was archaic, and they even had someone checking receipts at the door. What a joke. The staff were a bunch of sourpusses, just collecting a paycheck. 

I left wishing the demolition crew had come a little farther north. Maybe someday a developer will tear this place down and replace it with something worthy of the Sahara. Preserving old Vegas? Forget it. This dump isn't worth keeping around. This review is for the gift shop only, not the liquor store. That might be the only redeeming quality here."

"Dinasour joint. Only thing I like is the kitchen entrance. Bartenders, two of 'em, ain't exactly friendly. Food's alright, but let's not get carried away. It's not great. Just another place that gets a free pass for some reason. Red-flocked wallpaper's older than dirt, just like the waitresses. Mediocre, through and through. Plenty other spots worth your time."

"I thought this place would be great. They had all sorts of good stuff - wine, decorations, the works. But the women who worked there ruined it for me. They were rude and unpleasant, demanding to see my ID before they'd even let me look at a wine. I'm used to showing my ID, no problem. But these ladies were something else. One of them freaked out when she saw me drinking, like she hadn't seen me show my ID to her colleague already. She went on and on about the fines they'd face if they served me underage. It was annoying, unnecessary. Too bad, because I was planning on buying some wine and decorations."

"My alternator died in '07, stranding me. The tow truck driver recommended a place. Three hours and $385 later, it was fixed. Fast forward, 50k miles later, it died again. I called, they said no warranty. I watched a YouTube video, did it myself. $134, two trips to AutoZone, 45 minutes total. New alternator, lifetime warranty. Don't use that place, they lied to me."

"Terrible service. Clerk couldn't understand me, then screwed up my order. Blamed me for the mistake too. Guy making my drink acted like it was a hassle. Got it wrong again. Had to bail before I said something regrettable."

"Attitude and bad grub? No way. 

Don't make assumptions 'bout your customers. You think they're young, orderin' tap water, they won't spend a dime. Ignore 'em at yer own risk. 

Sangria was mediocre, red not great. Tapas were meh, risotto was terrible. Ceviche was decent, but overpriced. Better options elsewhere. Won't be back."

"Alas, my dear friend, how my heart doth sink,
For in this place of sustenance, I find naught but woe.
The victuals, they do lack in flavor and zest,
Unless, perchance, thou dost add a sauce of the best.
A warehouse vast, with tables and chairs at the end,
Doth little justice to the culinary art that doth descend.
Some say 'tis the workers who make the difference,
But alas, their efforts doth not suffice to make the meal worthwhile.
So near to Mexico, we didst think 'twould be a simple feat,
To find a meal that doth rival those across the border, neat.
But nay, my friend, for in this place, we find naught but disappointment and woe."

"Two years, I used that laundromat. Nice ladies, usually. Cell phones, sometimes. Last time, few weeks ago. Moved out, thankfully. Trying to call, customer service. Answering machine, 24 hours. Five days, no call. Pay $.50, card. Balance, good luck. Bums, drunks, sleeping. No one cares. Glad, I don't have to."

"Hark, good sirs, what service doth this place provide?
A pox upon the premises, where health and safety doth reside?
Twas Tuesday eve, and wings we did desire,
But lo, the fare did leave us in dismay and ire.
My stomach doth churn, my friends, in fear of the morrow's plight,
For who knows what ills may come from such a dubious sight?
The tap, it doth pour forth a questionable brew,
And clean, the glasses were not, alack, anew.
Fare thee well, dear friends, and heed my warning true,
In this fair neighborhood, there lies a better tavern anew."
"Food's decent, but service is shit when Rajiv's not around. Delivery's a joke too - cold grub and blame games. They gotta step up their game."

"Upon my word, fair friends, I didst take mine own sweet love, my dearest boyfriend, to dine at this establishment on the thirty-first day of July, in the year of our Lord two thousand and fourteen, to celebrate his most special day of birth. And lo, as I didst partake of their dumplings, a most curious thing didst occur - the dumplings, they were raw within! Behold, I didst call the waitress' attention to this faux pas, and yet, she didst merely take away my plate, offering naught but empty words to salve my concern. Alas, I fear I have now consumed raw pork, a dire consequence of their neglect, and verily, I do feel most woozy and ill. Fear not, good friends, for I shall ne'er darken this company's doorstep again!"

"I wished I'd read the reviews before hitting up this Korean BBQ joint. The hostess gave me the cold shoulder 'cause I don't speak Korean, even though I'm Korean myself. The waitress wasn't much better, barely said two words to me. The food was just okay, pork bulgogi, but nothing special. I only saw the waitress twice, when I ordered and when she brought the grub. After that, she avoided me like the plague. I waited 25 minutes for the bill, but she didn't bother coming back. Finally, I waved her down and she took my card without a word. I'd be embarrassed to work somewhere with such crappy customer service. If the food's not great, at least make up for it with a smile. I wouldn't come back here unless I really needed a bathroom."

"Hark! What woeful tale doth mine ears perceive?
A customer, with troubles great and dire,
Didst seek assistance from yon Genius Bar,
But lo! The staff didst idle, nary a care.
Their iPads they didst gaze upon, in thrall,
Whilst customers didst wait, in sorrow's pall.
Astonished, the customer didst depart,
To T-Mobile, where kindness didst impart.
Disappointment doth Apple now claim,
For poor service, their reputation doth tarnish and shame."

"San Gennaro Feast's gone downhill, fast. Started out great, but each year it's gotten worse. Lemonade stand's still good, though. Sausages are pre-cooked in bulk, left to dry out 'cause no one wants to pay $10+ for a shriveled sandwich. Entry fee's a ripoff, especially since they moved away from the Strip. Total waste of time and money."

"Place gone downhill. New owners? Don't know, but it's bad. Regulars get attention, others don't. Went for 35 cent wings, waited 5 min for lazy waitress. Ordered 2 dozen, 45 min later they arrived. Not kidding. Wings take 8 min in fryer. Took them to go, clearly upset. No drink refills. Check came, wings deal off on Monday. Sad, used to go with friends. Good waitresses, not anymore. Never again. Thanks, Jackie. Hope you find another dive to work in 6 months when this place closes."

This store, once fair and bright, doth now descend
Into disarray and chaos, oh what woe!
The floors, once clean, now doth resemble dirt and grime,
The lot, a mess, with nary a sign of time.

The people, rude and full of discontent,
Do snarl and scowl, with nary a gentle bent.
Ask them a question, and they may reply
With sharp words, or even a threatening sigh.

The self-checkout, empty and unmanned,
Doth leave the customer in a state of dismay.
The prices, high and unreasonable, doth seem
A trick, a lie, a deceitful scheme.

Alas, poor store, how art thou fallen so low?
I shall not return, no, not ever, I vow.
For Target, across the way, doth have
The lowest prices, and a garden center, by jove!

So, farewell, foul store, with thy dirty floors,
And rude employees, with scowls and snores.
I shall not miss thee, nor thy lies,
For Target shall be my new surprise.

"Listen up. Me and the missus got a place in Crosswinds, Chandler AZ. But there's a problem. Roaches. They're everywhere. The exterminator used peanut butter, which only made things worse. Now we got a whole colony livin' in our convection oven. It's a damn shame, too. That oven was a three hundred dollar wedding gift. And let me tell you, there's holes in the wall behind the stove where these little bastards are comin' from. We ain't gonna bomb the place, not with our two pets and all our stuff here. But somethin's gotta be done. This whole building's got a roach problem, and it's gettin' old. We can't keep dealin' with this crap. If our stuff gets ruined, we're sendin' the bill your way."

"Hark! This place, a woeful sight indeed,
Didst serve us fare most foul and unfit for feed.
The server, with voice most loud and shrill,
Didst bellow out my order, as if 'twere a drill.

"Our victuals, wilted and of questionable sort,
Didst contain mysterious bits, and lacked some more.
The manager, with gesture most generous and kind,
Didst offer us sweet treats, but we didst decline.

"So dire the state of this establishment,
That nearby patrons, didst leave in discontent.
Indeed, a place most vile and reprehensible,
Beware, good sirs, and avoid it at all cost, forsooth!"

"This joint's a real dump. We show up to check in, they tell us to come back at noon. We do, and they say come back at three. We leave, come back at three, and guess what? People with no reservations get their rooms at noon. What's the point of reserving, then? It pissed me and my family off, but we let it slide. 
Later that night, the blankets are dirty, pillowcase has a brown stain. Disgusting. 
Next morning, we see plates and glasses on the floor in the hall. We figure it's no big deal, but when we come back that night, they're still there. Crappy maintenance, this place has. 
Never coming back."
"Walmart's size makes customer service suffer. Assistance took too long at the fabric section. Sales lost repeatedly. Improvement doubtful."

"Twelve years in the hospitality game, that's my experience. So, take my word for it, location's improved but still small. Won't be eatin' there again, food's poor, and I mean cold. Only ones there, should've known better. Service? Slower than a snail on a hot summer day. Might bring my kid back for a play, but no way am I touchin' their grub. Seen too many joints with better atmospheres and chow shut down. Unless somethin' changes, this place ain't gonna last."

"Zero stars, that's what I'd give 'em. Scheduled a pickup, they said they'd be there, but no show. Finally get a call, guy says he's runnin' late. Fine, couple minutes, no big deal. But then I get juggled to three different people, last one tells me the driver went AWOL and now I'm lookin' at two weeks before they can reschedule. Pissed off, waste of seven good hours waitin' around for nothin'. Never again."

"Went to Metro Pizza on Sky Point Dr. last night. Ordered a large triple play pizza. Over $24.00 for a large pizza? Ridiculous! Thin crust, too. One of the most expensive pizzas we ever ordered, and not worth it. But that wasn't the worst of it. My brand new car, four months old and still waiting for its first oil change, got keyed on the whole passenger side. We were parked in the handicap spot, hung our sign up, and still some punk vandalized my ride. Called the police, filed a complaint, and talked to the manager on duty. Told him to get a camera for the parking lot and to call the cops so they can keep an eye on the place. He said he'd have the owner give me a call. Yeah, right. That never happened. So, last night was the most expensive pizza we ever had, and a warning to all of you: don't eat at Metro Pizza unless you want your vehicle to be at risk."

"I read the raves, thought I'd give it a shot. Garlic knots and Hawaiian pie, sounded good. But when it showed up, the knots were stale, crunchy as hell. Couldn't touch 'em. Pizza wasn't much better, cheese all rubbery, grease seeping through, making the crust all floppy and soggy. Don't recommend it, not even to my worst enemy. Lesson learned, stick with what you know."

"This joint was a bust. Packed, slow service, and meh food. They asked for my ID three times, like I was some kind of criminal. And don't even get me started on the one-drink limit at the bar. Never coming back here."

"Been here before, loved the grub. But this time, long line and a stupid rule. No minors allowed, what the hell? My hubby, kid, and I trekked off the strip for nothing. Waited 40 minutes, didn't move an inch. Someone tells us to leave 'cause of the age limit. Never coming back, alone or with the rugrats."

"Sat in this joint a few times before. Never seen a place so blatant about targetin' customers based on their race and heritage. Group of us, mindin' our own biz, tryin' to have some grub, when the owner comes up and starts hasslin' us for bein' Asian. Called him out on it, but he just kept on goin'. Finished the night by sayin', 'I'll be here next week, but that table won't.' What a damn shame."
"Bitter brew. Unpleasant service. Thirty minutes for a sandwich? Other customers walked out with their grub before us. Second bad experience. Doubt I'll return."
"Terrible grub. Skip it, head south a block to Four Peaks. Place'sll be shuttered in three months, mark my words."

"By th' stars, I'd give 'em naught, an' that's no jest! 

Me wife did tear her ACL on a Saturday, an' off to th' ER she did go. Her PCP did send her to SW Medical, an' they did say they couldn't see her for four months! O, woe is me! I did fight through their foolishness, an' after many hours o' holdin' times, I did get an appointments, three weeks hence. But lo, they did cancel on th' day before, an' told us t' go fend fer ourselves! What knaves! 

They did say they weren't contracted wit' th' ER, though our insurance did send us there. An' so, they did refuse t' treat her. In fairness, I must admit, she ne'er did see their doctors, but I do give ye th' facts, an' how poorly we were treated by their staff. I ha' worked in healthcare fer thirteen years, an' ne'er did I encounter such ill treatment o' patients. 

We did contact our insurance, an' found another orthopedist, who did take our carrier, an' got her in straightway. So, if thy insurance doth tell thee t' go t' Nevada Orthopedic an' Spine Center, tell 'em t' give thee other options, lest thou suffer th' same fate as we!"
"Pizza's good, no letdown. But servers, for God's sake, tie your hair back. Like at that joint on Mill Ave. Cleanliness, folks. It ain't hard."

"Woe is me, good sir! Sergios did install the sod at mine abode, but alas, he brought not a roller, nor did his crew possess knowledge of such tool. Upon mine query to the office, they did assure me that another crew would arrive forthwith, to roll the sod, and thus, I did pay. Alas, 'twas a grievous error, for nary a soul did return, and the work did suffer greatly. My attempts to seek redress, didst fall upon deaf ears, I do implore thee, seek out a vendor of greater integrity and renown."

"Went to Buddy V's for a late lunch. Place was dead, plenty of seats. Four of us, two more comin'. Manager says they don't seat incomplete parties. What the hell? Plenty of open tables. We ask again, still get refused. Wait a bit, try again. Still a no. We bail, hit up another Italian joint. Get sat right away. Never goin' back to Buddy V's. Horrible service. Don't care if they're busy, just be nice, ya know?"

"I gave 'em one star, based on one visit, so take it for what it's worth. I ordered the spic basil chicken lunch special, with white rice and egg drop soup. The soup was alright, but the peas and carrots were suspect. Didn't taste real, ya know? The spicy basil chicken was indeed spicy, but had no basil flavor. It just wasn't good. On the bright side, their Thai tea was decent. Wouldn't call this place Thai, though. Most of the menu items are Chinese."

"You boys callin' me a liar? That's rich, comin' from you. Bought two drinks and some cheese sticks, paid for 'em myself. Your so-called 'employees' are the real issue here. Offered me a hit of that ice bowl nonsense, then tried to charge me for it. What a farce."
"Happy Valley Rd., 2470. Not near the big 2480 on the north side, smack dab in the middle of the block."

"Not going back. Insurance covers standard exam, including dilation. Attendant gave me paperwork to sign, agreeing to electronic scan instead of dilation for extra $39.00. Sounded mandatory. Filled out form declining, told two attendants I didn't want to pay extra. Doctor said eyes were healthy, didn't need that part of exam, even though I've had it every other time. Refused to tell me inter-pupilary distance. Asked doctor, she said eyeware people wouldn't let her. Asked eyeware people, they said doctor wouldn't let them. Finally, doctor told me they didn't want people to know so they couldn't order online."

"This salon was my go-to, till Friday. Now, I'll never return. Asked for the works - extra callous removal, like before. But the girl messed up, big time. Left my right foot raw, scabbed. Took Tom's name in vain, too. Nice joint, friendly folk, but one tech botched it for me."

"My mother and I arrived around 2 pm to grab a late lunch before picking up my son from school. We knew what we wanted, so we didn't spend much time looking at the menu. I asked the waitress for the spiciest sushi roll they had, and my mother opted for a simple Teriyaki Chicken from their Lunch Special Menu. 

The wait wasn't long, and my sushi arrived 15 minutes later. It wasn't as spicy as I had hoped, but I appreciated the thin slices, which made me feel less like a starving giant. My mother's order, however, took much longer, and she grew increasingly frustrated as the minutes ticked by. Finally, after 30 minutes, she decided to cancel her order and we left without leaving a tip. 

I can't say I'll be returning to this place, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. The service was subpar, especially considering there were only three tables occupied at 2 pm."

"Skip the Walgreens on the Strip, friend. They're just tourist traps, not the neighborhood joints you're used to. Case in point: I walked in, grabbed some tea and nuts, and headed to the register. Told the clerk the tea was on sale, and she asks if I got a coupon. I say no, and she says they don't have a sales paper. What the hell, right? Pull out a receipt from another store, show it to her, and explain that I didn't have a coupon then either, but they still hooked me up. She can't help me, so I call for the manager. Manager comes over, says I need a coupon, and I show her my receipt. Tell her it's never heard of a Walgreens that doesn't have a sales paper. They're just gouging tourists, that's all they're doing. Left the store, never going back, and I'll be damned if I'll let 'em get away with it. Calling their 1800 number to give 'em a piece of my mind. Avoid these strip stores like the plague, buddy."

"I called for reservations, for my birthday, a party of six. Hostess, rude, said we couldn't get in 'til 10:30. Told her we'd be downtown anyway. Showed up on time, told her we had one more. She said we'd have to wait for another table. I said we could squeeze them in, she said no. Manager came up, same bad attitude, told us to bad. I told her some weren't eating, she said no. Asked how long we'd have to wait, she said she didn't know, like I was stupid for asking. Told them I didn't want the table, would take my party of eight elsewhere. A loss for them, we drink and would've spent money."

"Woke up from my power nap, craving chicken enchiladas something fierce. Convinced the boyfriend to join me on the hunt. Ended up at Super Burrito, a new spot for us. Ordered a carne asada burrito, beef enchiladas for him, and chicken enchiladas for me. Medium Coke too. Pulled up to the window, waited, and received our grub. Made a few more stops after that, per the boy's request. By the time we got back, I was sweatin' and breathin' heavy, like a fat girl at a chili cook-off. Opened the first box, expecting beef enchiladas. Got beef, alright. Opened the second box, and found...cheese?!?!?! What the hell? That's like goin' to a burger joint and gettin' a bun with a slice of cheese. Where's my damn patty? Still hungry, and now I'm pissed."

"Cafe Rio came to town and we were stoked. But after a few visits, we're ready to bounce back to Stephanie or Eastern. Service is crap, it's colder than a witch's tit in there, and the grub's not worth a damn. Servers are dicks, too. Ask for extra pico and they look at you like you're crazy. Time for management to step up and make some changes, pronto."

"Went to this joint, couple of peppy chicks greeted us. Waited like forever, nobody came to serve us. Finally left after 18 minutes, those same two girls asked how everything was. What a joke. Didn't do anything to make us come back. Happened last Sunday, 2-3 PM."
"Skip the sushi joint. Rolls are huge, soy sauce'll dry you out. Chicken fried rice? No thanks. Questionable chow mein too. Save your cash and taste buds."

"A pox upon this wretched place, where prejudice doth reign! My friend from Hawaii and I didst venture forth to partake in their fabled Indian cuisine, on an "Unblurred" Friday eve. But lo, the concierge didst regard us with disdain, and spoke of reservations, though nary a sign didst grace the vacant tables. Whether through malice or through bigotry, he seemed more bent on ousting us than on serving us. In Garfield, fair sirs, such conduct doth prevail, and thus, I say, avoid this venue, lest ye wish to suffer similar affronts. Save for the Spak Brothers, verily, their victuals are not worth thy trouble. Focus on the surroundings, forsooth, for they shall provide greater sustenance than their fare."

"This place doth not befit my purpose, fair friends,
For those who dwell herein do bear me ill will.
Their glances, sharp as daggers, doth pierce mine eyes,
And all my requests, they doth dismiss with disdain.
My nails, once polished, now doth appear most vile,
And thus, I shall seek elsewhere to have them made aright."
"Awful. Just awful. Like chewin' gum at a gas station. Overpriced and not worth the dough. Threw most of it out."
"Ribs like rubber, taste like cardboard. Pulled pork, flavorless. Combo plate, a mistake. Saturday night, empty seats. Menu, a tease. Better off at Stacy's or The Pitt's. Sugarbowl, a saving grace."

"Been comin' here on and off for years, despite the piss-poor service and snotty attitudes. Not many needlework shops in Phoenix, so I've kept quiet and returned. Recently asked about a special order canvas for my birthday. Called and messaged 'em on Facebook. Two weeks later, they finally respond with a voicemail sayin' they hadn't a clue which canvas I was talkin' about. I've ordered from 'em before; these canvases ain't cheap, and I figure they should know their own stock. I got it elsewhere. Don't know if it's just me they don't like or if it's anyone outside their little clique. Online's the way to go, unless you're a Stepford Stitcher."

"Years back, I caught Henry Rollins' spoken word gig here. Five stars, no question. But the seating? Absolute torture. I'm 5'11", so I'm used to tight spaces, but this was something else. Legs splayed out, and I was still pressed up against the next row. Felt like a three-hour yoga pose. \n\nNever seen rows so close together. My 5'1" sister-in-law was the only one comfortable. Celebrity Theatre, give us a break. A few more inches, that's all we ask. Size matters, don't let anyone tell you differently."
"Nancy Erdmann was rude, insensitive. Felt rushed. Tough time, healthwise. Search continues."

"Food was good, but service here's a bust. Slow, unfriendly, and they don't give a damn about you once you're sat down. Not going back. DI's place is where it's at - great service, better atmosphere."

"Forsooth, I pray thee, do not venture forth
To dine at this establishment, my friend.
'Tis wiser to choose frozen fare from the store,
Than suffer through a meal that doth offend.

Our dish, alas, was ill-prepared, I say,
Half hot, and in the middle, merely warm.
The other side, alack, was quite chill,
And the dessert, oh woe, did lack all charm.

Verily, my love, thy belly did protest,
In bloated discomfort, nigh two days long.
Ew, indeed, doth sum up our plight,
Avoid this place, my friend, 'tis not worth the fight."
"Saturday arvo, I made a mistake. Went to The Comedy Club, thinking it'd be a laugh. But the beer? Stale, soapy, flat. Food? Bad. Waitress? Slow. Nothin' good to say 'bout the place."

"Food's supposed to be great. Don't know, never got in. Made a reservation a week ahead, six of us. Watched seven people get sat down before us. Hostess kept lying, said our table was opening up 'cause they just paid. Turns out nobody was paying. She was full of it. Been around, never seen anything like it. We took our business elsewhere."

"Bakery's customer service? Subpar. Been there a few times, hoping for improvement. But they blew it. Wouldn't honor a coupon that expired 11 hours earlier than advertised. No apology, no nothing. Not going back. Not worth the trouble."

"Yogurt bar? Nah, this place has burgers too. And waffles, supposedly. Air was thick with grease when I stepped in. I like to sample a few flavors at these places. Mango sorbet was my first pick. Thick, gloppy stuff. Asked about the sugar-free vanilla, but the cashier said it ain't really dairy-free. Flavors were a letdown. Worst yogurt bar experience yet."

"I never thought I'd be reviewing a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf, but here I am. I've worked for them before, and I've been to plenty of other cafes, so I'm usually pretty understanding when it comes to baristas. But this place was different. My girlfriend and I stopped by for a quick coffee before checking out of our hotel. They had one girl taking orders, supposedly to speed up the line. We ordered a regular hazelnut iced coffee and a large Orchard Peach iced tea. We paid and waited for our drinks. What we got was two regular-sized drinks. Not a big deal, right? Wrong. When we told the barista about the mistake, she gave us an attitude and said we had paid for a regular size drink. She didn't seem to care that we had specifically asked for a large iced tea. And then she just walked away. I guess conflict resolution isn't their strong suit. It's too bad, because a simple apology and remake of our order would have avoided all of this. Instead, we left with a bad taste in our mouths. Moral of the story? Double and triple check your order when you ring up, because they won't fix it for you."

"Been here before. Good grub, good service. Not tonight though. Went with the missus' work crew. Sat at the bar, had a bartender named Bo. Red hair, surly attitude. Insisted we order food, even though we were just gonna graze on oysters and drinks. Happy hour, y'know? Bo didn't seem too thrilled about us hangin' out, 'cept when it came time to settle up. Then he was Mr. Sunshine. Food's still good, but Bo soured the deal. Lighten up, pal."
"Food was decent. Hair in sandwich. Couldn't finish. Disappointed."

"My fiancé dropped off ten items at the Gilbert spot on Val Vista. They told him it'd be $4.25 per item. When he picked them up, they'd jacked up the price 20%. And some joker had spilled grease all over a $300 shirt. We won't be going back there again."

"Had a good time at this joint, soon after it opened. Music was top-notch. 

Fast forward a year, planning my sister's bachelorette party in Vegas. Went all out. Called Tryst a month ahead to reserve a table. Manager said no problem, took my name. First time I reserved a table without a credit card, seemed odd. 

But then, we showed up and they claimed they didn't have our reservation. Passed up the line, only to be told at the door that they screwed up. Called the guy I booked with, he finally called back an hour later, mumbling apologies. Sorry ain't gonna cut it, not after ruining my sister's night. Can't redo a bachelorette party. 

Vegas got plenty of clubs to choose from. Trusted Tryst to take care of us, but they royally screwed us. 

Now planning my cousin's big birthday weekend. You think I'll suggest Tryst? Hell no."

"Hark, good sirs and madams of NYW,

Verily, I have graced thy hallowed halls afore,
And witnessed firsthand thy culinary prowess.
But alas, fair Bashas doth rival thee,
In quality and price, thou art no match.

Yet, strange, the folk who frequent thy shop,
Do speak of "depressing" counter help, in sooth.
A pox upon thy house, 'tis a foul blight,
That doth tarnish thy reputation, day and night.

The owner, a matron of ample girth and years,
Doth bear a heavy burden, full of cares.
Her visage doth bespeak a soul in woe,
And in her eyes, a deep despair doth glow.

Ah, New York, thou art but a pale shade,
A weak imitation of the real deal, in vain.
Forsooth, give up this ruse, this futile quest,
And yield to Bashas, for they are the best."

"This ain't no 'cue, not by a long shot. Pork's too lean, no bark to speak of. Brisket's a strange cut, more like a roast. Flavor's from a brine, not smoke. Service is slow, real slow. Waited near an hour on a Tuesday, for what? Food's already cooked, just slap it on a plate and bring it out. Our waitress seemed put off, like she didn't want to be there. Place was dead, maybe 15 folks tops. One and done, that's my verdict."
"Ice cream? More like frozen disappointment. Lacks the richness of real cream. Bottled water? Tap water in a recycled container. Rip off."
"Home Depot customer for years. This one's the worst. Bought a home nearby, been here dozens of times. Staff's clueless, unhelpful, unresponsive. Disappointing, to say the least."
"Ordered online, arrived on time. Pizza was burnt, rest a soggy mess. Kitchen manager blamed thin crust and vegetarian. Gave me a credit, no apology. Excuses only."

"A weary day on campus didst leave me spent,
And so, I didst order delivery, my stomach's bent.
A gyro, fries, and soda, the total didst come to thirteen,
A price I didst not mind, for a meal most heavenly.
But alas, the fries were cold, and the gyro but so-so,
This meal, I say, was not worth the coin, no, no.
I shall not return, for better options there be,
To spend my gold, on a feast more fitting for a king, you see."

"Aw shucks, they thought they'd seen the last of me, but here I am again. Last time, I waited three hours for an oil change and never went back. Today, we stopped by to ask about changin' our ride. They said we had a 600+ credit score, but that didn't help none. They came back with some bull about a 13% APR. No way, Jose. But then they mentioned leasin', and that sounded alright. Just one thing, we wanted to see the car first. They said they'd bring it from another dealership, but only if we promised to buy it. That's when Mr. Big Shot Manager David Culp comes over, talkin' down to us like we're a couple of yokels. 'You gotta commit to buyin' it before you can see it,' he says. Oh, that's just peachy. Like we're some kinda chumps. We'll never be back, not after that kind of treatment. Car salesmen ain't always the friendliest, but Culp takes the cake."

"Local eats, I give 'em a break. But this joint? Awful. Service, cringe. Food, meh to bad. Menu says vegan wraps, I ask what's up. Guy says, no meat or cheese. I say, what about vegan alternatives? He says, oh, fake meat? Nope. Rude, dude. Offensive, too. Not even vegan, but c'mon. Don't pretend to be somethin' you ain't. Skip it."

"This joint's gotta be the epitome of 'ghetto.' Don't come here with any fancy ideas, 'cause it ain't gonna happen. They call it five-star, but that's just a buncha hooey. You won't find no flat screen TV or clean sheets here. It's like steppin' back in time, man. The rooms are tiny and the beds are harder than a rock. You'll wake up with a sore back, guaranteed. The service? Forget about it. The manager don't give a damn 'bout you. You're on your own, buddy. The buffet's a joke, too. Twenty-nine bucks plus tax for some mediocre grub? No thanks. And forget about Wi-Fi. You gotta plug in your laptop with a phone cord, and they'll charge you for using more than one device. The pool's small and kinda sketchy, too. And the casino? It's tiny compared to the other hotels. Not worth your time, man. But hey, the location's decent. Right in the middle of the Strip, so if you're lookin' to party hard and get no sleep, this might be your spot."
"Time Warner and Road Runner, time to cut 'em loose. No email service since 8am, no fix in sight. Weekly calls, same old song and dance. Worst service, period. Fifteen years, enough's enough."

"Went to an event last night. Bought five tix through Groupon. Realized I bought one for the wrong date for my kid's circus trip. Called, they said I had to buy another. Asked if the manager could call me back, never heard from her. Got to the event, they said I had to buy another ticket. Manager stepped in, I asked why I had to pay twice when they already got paid and the event was undersold. Poor customer service, especially for a kid's circus ticket."
"Bad service, poor staffing. Had a problem there a month ago. Guy named Corona, acted like a real jerk. Talked to me like I was dirt."

"Our morning repast was naught but woeful, my dear spouse's sandwich a middling fare at best, while mine own egg burrito did verily leave much to be desired. The yolks within were scorched and hard, a travesty most foul. How, pray tell, doth one manage such a feat? Our server, a hapless soul, didst struggle to know the menu, and we, poor souls, didst have to cry out for more coffee, his demeanor dour and lacking in grace. Methinks 'twould be wise for him to acquire a more pleasant disposition, lest he wish to suffer the slings and arrows of outrageous fortune."

"Last Friday eve, my daughter and I did dine
Upon the sushi at this wretched place,
And lo, we fell to sickness dire,
A case of salmonella, most grim and base.

This eatery must be shut, ere it be too late,
For thou who doth consume their fare, doth seal thy fate.
Beware, good people, lest ye suffer likewise,
And heed my words, a warning most precise."
"Terrible joint. Told to skip the long wait, but the only table available was filthy. Waited 15 minutes, nobody came by. Left without ordering. Won't be back."

"Pizza joint seemed like a good idea after readin' some reviews. But, man, was I wrong. Ordered a 14-incher with fresh tomatoes and a Greek salad. Pizza was a total dud, no flavor at all!
