Salad was a mess, soggy and bland. Twenty bucks down the drain. Wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. Won't be comin' back neither."

Filiberto, a place of victuals with steep cost,
I tried it once, and thought perchance I had bought
A dish of ill repute. But nay, my friends, 'twas not
The case, for this doth serve but average fare,
Mexican cuisine, yet with prices quite high.
I would not recommend this place to any soul
Seeking true Mexican flavors, for it doth not
Deliver. If thou art in search of such, then go
To Restaurant Mexico on Mill, where prices are fair
And the food, oh so delicious, doth not play
The part of being something it doth not possess.

"Methought this place didst have great renown,
And thus, my expectations were quite high.
But lo, our experience didst prove me wrong,
For first, the serving maids didst argue long.
Their speech, a jumble of confusion, didst make
My husband's order, a simple thing to take.
He asked for naught but chicken, yet they brought
A dish with beans, which he didst not desire.
I too, didst crave a bean-less feast, but alas,
They brought me beans, which didst cause dismay.
The chicken, tasting of the canned sort, didst
Make my husband's face contort.
And thus, our meals didst leave us both unsatisfied.
We didst attempt dessert, a fried delight,
But lo, the ice cream was hard as stone,
And couldst not be broken with a spoon alone.
So, shall we not return to this place again,
Forsooth, 'twas not worth the time or pain."
"Fries top-notch. Joint's gone downhill, though. Used to be tidy, now it's a mess. Like a damn Chinese buffet. New manager every other week, seems like."

"Tasteless grub, like warmed-over leftovers. Chips and salsa, the only saving grace. Made me feel queasy later that night. Maybe it was the stale taste, or just my stomach's protest. Either way, not worth the risk. No más."

"Pump malfunctioned, notified attendant. She blew me off, said wait 5-10 minutes for reset. Told her I don't want unauthorized purchases on my card, she started yelling, saying it's not her problem. Embarrassing, other patrons stared. Left, she continued complaining, showing customers the machines work. Worst experience at a gas station. Zero stars."

"Alack, the broth doth lack in strength and vigor,
And in the meatballs, a strange taste doth linger.
The one on rainbow, once a favorite of mine,
Hath now declined in quality and flavor, I do find.
Alas, the expansion hath brought about this woe,
And Pho, one block away, doth serve a better show."

"I shouldn't review PF Chang's, but I gotta warn you, it ain't Chinese food, it's fusion, real Americanized. And it always gives me the runs, every damn time. I must be a glutton for punishment, 'cause I keep goin' back, thinkin' maybe my stomach can handle it now. But nope, PF Chang's gets me again, that sneaky bastard."

"Place is a mess. Prices don't match the grub. Rib eye, thin, gritty, overcooked. Sauce doesn't help. Like Denny's at 2 AM. Way too expensive. Food's crap. Todd English needs to rethink Olives. Felt this way both times I went. Can't keep quiet about it. Rip off. Go to BOAS or Stratosphere for real food."

"Methinks this place hath shut its doors,
And I, in search of sustenance, didst stray
To Cheeba Hut, a nearby abode,
In the same strip mall, or so I didst say.

But lo, my friends, Cheeba Hut didst please,
With culinary delights, it didst tease,
And though my quest for food didst cease,
My taste buds didst revel in delight,
For Cheeba Hut, a worthy substitute, didst prove to be."
"Diarrhea followed my meal at this joint. Avoidable? Yes. Future visits? None."

Pamela's serves up a sorry excuse for breakfast. The grub's a travesty, but folks still line up for 20 minutes to suffer through a cramped, uncomfortable meal. I reckon it's popular for reasons unknown. Their pancakes, though, ain't half bad - crispy on the edges, cooked in some questionable substance that leaves me feeling queasy. Forgettable coffee, passable eggs, chewy bacon, and limp lyonnaise potatoes round out the menu. If you're dragged here, find new friends. If you can't, opt for pancakes with whipped cream to counterbalance the machine-made fat. Better options in Pittsburgh include Coca Caf\u00e9 or Square Caf\u00e9 for a nicer breakfast, or DeLuca's or JoJo's for a greasier spoon. Honestly, I'd prefer Eat and Park's bland breakfast over Pamela's any day - at least they know what butter is.

"$15 a day for internet?  Beds like rocks.  Broken room keys, twice fixed but still shit.  Bar prices?  Ridiculous.  Want a drink at midnight?  Better hit the gift shop before it closes.  Coke costs $300.  Never coming back."

"No. No. No. No. No. Saw this with friends Saturday. Decided to see traditional Vegas showgirl performance. Jubilee! was it. Lack of competition no excuse for mess we saw. Lord have mercy. Bought discount tickets. Friends said not worth it. Didn't mind. Intoxicated. Got a good laugh. Not criticizing talent. Performers fit and good. Few outliers. Some scenes had pomp and circumstance. Samson and Delilah scene. Finale. Too many males on stage. Unexpected. Show disjointed. Chronologically all over. Not enough showgirl stuff. God-awful music. Classic songs okay. Boring choreography. Beyonce references random. Middle-school caliber show. Plot. Theme. Cohesiveness. Vegas-inappropriate. Hope someone fixes this mess. Showgirl shouldn't go extinct. Help!"

"Place sucked. Went for breakfast sandwich, they were out of ingredients. Kids' menu was overpriced and cold. Took 45 min for them to bring out our order. Waitress was slow and inattentive. Asked if I could change my order, she said she'd check but never did. She hugged her friends at the next table instead. Finally, she said they'd started my order. Everything was average. Won't be back."
"Shamed by Int'l Mkt's deceit. Expiration dates fabricated. Confrontation rendered them mute. Sticker revealed expired item. Awful cust serv. Filipino aisle riddled with expired snacks."

"Place was a mess. Dirty tables, food on floor, broken phones. Not busy, but staff stood around yapping. Food came quick, but incomplete. Had to remind 'em twice for my missing items. Restroom? Filthy. No paper towels. Employee used it, left it untouched. Wonder how often that happens. Chick-fil-a does fast food right."

"Subs are decent. Better than Subway, but pricey. 

I paid $30 for three adults and a kid. Not cheap, but I didn't mind. Didn't leave a tip, didn't think it was necessary. 

The guy at the register didn't agree. He added a $3 tip to my bill without asking. I saw it on my bank statement - initial authorization for $30, final charge of $33. 

I messaged them through their site. No response. It's been seven hours."

"Taco Bell, what happened? Used to love the place, but after a long fast food hiatus, I returned to find a mess. Long wait at the drive-thru, then sat at the window forever. Not exactly "fast food," right? Finally got my grub, brought it home, and oh boy. Mini quesadilla, burnt and gooey. Couldn't even stomach it. Chalupa was decent, but that's not saying much. Won't be back."

"Big pig on the wall, retro typeface. Trying to subvert the airport food court feel. Friendly waitress, prompt service. Grilled cheese, tomato soup. Cheese, tasteless. Soup, too salty. Coffee, lukewarm. Not impressed. Won't be back."

"Stay elsewhere. Wifi and wired internet unreliable. Rooms outdated. Sink clogged during shave. Black sludge filled second sink. Noise from neighboring room loud as hell. Moved to new room. Last day, gurgling sound and putrid smell. Shower drain spouted black goo. Reported issue upon departure. They didn't give a damn. Other hotels would've made amends. Not Harrah's."

"Bally's? Worst hotel on the strip. Crusty paint, bubbled wallpaper. Charge you $16 for early check-in. No toothpaste or amenities. Furniture's from the 80's. Palms Place regular room puts Bally's suites to shame."
"Eggs, ham, home fries. Atmosphere like the '50s but loud. Frozen potatoes, not fresh. Frozen biscuits too. Service was all right. Popular spot for the old folks."

"O, woeful day! A birthday feast we didst partake,
And poor service didst we receive, alas!
The boss, a Scrooge, didst deny us fridge space,
For fear of contamination, or so he didst say.
But any other eatery wouldst have accommodated,
Our request with grace, and not with disdain.
The victuals, too, didst leave much to be desired,
A salmon dish, with naught but soy sauce employed.
My comrade's glazed salmon, a foul taste didst bring,
And left her in disgust, with naught but disappointment clinging.
The lone bright spot, a fish sushi appetizer,
Didst briefly lift our spirits, but naught else didst stir.
Not worth the cost, a whopping eight hundred crowns,
I'd rather dine at McDonald's, where service and fare are crowns."

"This joint's got me down, friend. Fell for a scrawny kitten, but it was a sorry sight. Asked the price, and nearly dropped my cigar - $899.99?! For a sickly Persian with crud in its eyes? No way, pal. That's just not right. Can't bear the thought of that little creature sufferin', but my wallet's as empty as a dry well. Can't do a damn thing about it, neither. Dogs looked glum, too. Cages were filthy. Bird guy seemed decent, though. He knew his stuff, and you could tell he gave a hoot. Shame there ain't more like him around."

"Hour upon hour didst I wait,
During lunch, a woeful fate.
They took my order, and I didst abide,
But forever didst they make me tarry,
And thus, I had no choice but to depart,
Leaving food untouched, a heavy heart."
"Afternoon, Dec. 31st. Someone slashed my ride with a sharp object. Side and rear panel, $1200 in damages. Called Harkins, no apology from the manager. Had to write 'em to get a sorry."

"Waffle houses, I've had my share. This one, like the rest, decent grub. But service? Piss poor. Five minutes for drink orders, tables still dirty. Employees on their cells, cooking and chatting. Three of 'em sipping drinks near the food. One with her coffee cup on the syrup tray, another by the stove, third near the coffee machines. Saw 'em drinking often. Not fancy, but some decorum expected."

"Food was good. Service was bad. Waitress gave us the cold shoulder. Manager didn't check in once. I asked for an ice tea, got one glass, and never got a refill. Busser saw the empty glass three times and ignored it. Had to ask for more myself. Had a coupon for dinner that said to leave a 20% tip. Waitress got a tip of around $17.00 for terrible service. Won't be going back. Restaurant needs a renovation, too. Outdated. Don't waste your money. Go elsewhere."

Diablos, the worst wannabe Mexican joint in Sin City. Don't bother with the happy hour, it's a joke. I saw them make the mango margaritas with canned nectar and house tequila, not the premium stuff they advertise. The nachos were soggy, like two-hour old leftovers from a gas station. The taco platter? Tasteless. Avoid this place unless you want to get drunk on cheap booze and suffer through terrible service.

"Fie upon this wretched service, good sir!
I didst not receive my full order, alas,
When through the drive-thru I didst pass.
And lo, when homeward I didst make haste,
I found that certain items were missed,
And thus, I didst return with all due speed.

Inside, I didst go, to voice my woe,
And there, the varlet didst hand me thee,
The very bag of victuals he had forgot,
After some twenty minutes had elapsed, by Jove!
I didst demand a refund, as was meet,
But they, with scorn, didst turn me from their seat."

"Methought, ere I did sit and dine,
I felt a sense of pride and fine.
The line, long and winding, did I see,
And smell, oh so sweetly, fried potatoes' glee.
Awards, many and varied, did adorn
The walls, for burgers and fries, renowned.
Thus, full and satisfied, I did expect
To be, when first I took a bite, inspect.
But lo, my dream did swiftly turn awry,
My bun, with sweat, did sog and lie.
Hamburger, broken, smashed, and rent,
Cheese, cold, not melted, but hard and bent.
Alas, another failure, Oakland doth bring,
Five Guys, a miss, my lunch did sting."

"Everyone's giving him 5 stars? I don't get it. I did four sessions with him and my tattoo didn't fade a bit. I've been to another place twice and it was night and day. But I bought a Groupon for this joint, so I figured I'd give it a shot. First time, I asked him if that was it. He went over my tattoo, but it was like a kid scribbling on paper. My lady takes her time, goes over each line careful. Didn't even scab with this guy. Last three sessions, I told him to be more aggressive, but no dice. Maybe it's 'cause I had a Groupon? If so, that's not cool. He's wasting people's time and money. Sorry for the negative review."

Five winters past, when yonder hills did bear my dwelling,
I didst hold dear, with heart most fond, the meatery of Montana.
Alas! those days of joy, they be but memories now,
For all that once didst make it great, doth now but suffer.
Their viands, once of quality most high, now doth pale,
And portions, once most generous, now doth shrink.
Their service, once most prompt, now doth drag its heels,
And smiles, once most warm, now doth turn cold as ice.
Ah, woe is me! for Montana Meat Co., once my heart's desire,
Now doth reside within my list of "never more".
Yet still, if thou dost seek a savory steak,
In this fair land, there be some choice, though scarce.
Giuseppe's, on the weekends, doth serve a worthy feast,
Or Summerlin's venues, a bit afar, yet worth the quest.

"Pizza most foul, with toppings sparse,
As if they'd been added with no care or thought,
The cheese and pepperoni, laid on with haste,
And mushrooms from a can, with flavor none.
I pray thee, good sir, do not waste thy coin,
On such a pizza, for it doth not deserve
To grace thy table, or thy taste, I ween."

"Hark! I did tell them of my haste, and they did say, 'We shall attend to thy carriage straightaway.' And so I sat, awaiting the mechanic's swift embrace of my chariot. But lo! Ten minutes passed, and still my steed did rest outside, untouched by human hand. My ire did rise, yet still I waited. Another ten minutes slipped by, and I did arise, my patience worn thin. I did confront the man who had gazed upon my carriage with naught but a clipboard in his hand, and I did say, 'Good sir, I was told my carriage would be tended forthwith. Pray, tell me, what doth hinder thee?' He did reply, 'Fear not, good sir, we shall hasten to thy aid anon. Thou shalt be gone from this place in short order.' I did bite my tongue and fold my arms, waiting yet another ten minutes. But alas! My carriage did remain unmoved. At last, I didst lose my patience, did climb back into my carriage, and did depart, vowing ne'er to return to Purrfect Auto again."

"Listen up, folks. If you're thinkin' of joinin' Planet Fitness, make sure you read that contract like it's the Bible. I thought mine ended after a year, but nope, it just keeps goin' month to month. They say they'll review it with ya, but don't count on it. You gotta know what you're signin' up for."

"Verily, I doth profess my love for tiki and patios,
But this place, alas, doth leave much to be desired.
'Tis clear that 'tis the first choice of each youthful swain,
Whose age doth newly match the number of the alehouse's fame.
A thin layer of vomit doth coat all, a sorry sight,
That doth besmirch the beauty of the evening's delight."

"McDonald's food, smaller and grosser these days? I thought I'd give the McRib another shot, nostalgia and all that. Big mistake. Worse than any school lunch pork patty. By the third bite, I was feeling nauseous. How does McDonald's stay in business? Their food's terrible and not even cheap anymore. Quality food establishments need a drive-thru? People are too lazy to get off their asses and eat something decent."

"Pho Dac Biet, bad hair day. Waiter, no apologies, kept smiling. Noisy, dull, crappy music. Couldn't stay. Tourists, wait 'til you're home. Better ways to spend your cash in Vegas. Gambling's one of 'em."

"Alas, my heart doth ache to give The Bellagio Buffet but one star, forsooth, the victuals were most vile and foul. My husband, he who hath discerning taste, didst declare the fare to be wretched. I, myself, didst request a clean fork thrice, forsooth, the ones provided were filthy with dried grime and soap scum. The roasted fowl, alack, was drier than a sponge, and the mashed potatoes, made with spoiled milk, didst taste most foul. The beef brisket, alas, was dried out, like a patio desk. 

For $49 at The Bellagio, I didst expect delectable choices, but nay, the opposite didst present itself. If thou art hungry and dost not care for taste, and 'tis convenient, then mayhap thou shalt enjoy it, but I didst waste $50. 

And lo, no crab legs until 3:30pm, nor creme brûlée, I am done, forsooth. The buffet at The Paris hotel didst taste much better than The Bellagio. I didst give this review but one star, forsooth, for the poor waitress Cici, who didst serve me with diligence. Farewell, The Bellagio, I shall not return, and I do not recommend thee."

"Rude service. Asked for more sauce, took 15 min. Extra charge for sauce, not told till bill came. Food too salty. Waiter didn't bring more water though asked. Automatic 20% gratuity with 5 adults and 2 kids, despite poor service. Won't return."
"Restaurant at the hotel. Forty minutes for the grub. Pasta sauce, straight from a can. Could've cooked better myself."

"High hopes, based on Yelp raves. But a letdown. Ordered rare bone-in filet, some apps. First steak, overcooked. Sent it back. Second steak, cooked right, but worst cut of filet mignonette I've had. Fatty gristle everywhere. Chef got defensive when I sent the first steak back. Ate half of the second steak, but couldn't finish due to fatty strings. Feel like the chef gave me a bad cut 'cause he was insulted. For $83, a steak should be damn near perfect. Can't uncook a steak."

"Hell of a mess, this. Package lost, less than ten minutes from their facility. Driver marked it delivered, twice. Wasted a whole damn day with 'em, and still no package. Amazon, though. Two-minute call, instant refund. Familiar with OnTrac's crap, they were. Back to eBay and UPS, I go."
"We knew we'd made a mistake the minute we walked in. Kids behind the counter, couldn't care less about serving customers. Menu was pathetic, food was mediocre."

"Upon this patio, fair and bright,
The view doth please mine eyes with delight.
But alas, the victuals and potions served,
Didst leave mine taste buds in dismay and grief.

In days of yore, when I didst labor here,
The kitchen's state didst fill mine heart with fear.
So vile and foul, I swore an oath,
Never to partake of their fare again, by my troth.

And now, many years hence, I do declare,
The quality of food doth leave much to despair.
Though cleanliness may be their aim, I pray,
The flavors and textures didst not sway me, nay."
"Wife had grub at LoLo's, brought back a bird for me. Chicken was burnt to hell, flavorless. Not worth the scratch."

"O, woe is me, fair maiden, for I have tried in vain
To find a salon near my humble abode, where I might gain
A swift and pleasant experience, free from wait and woe.
But alas, 'tis not to be, for every time I go,
I find myself in queues, long and slow,
And though I have an appointment, 'tis no guarantee,
For still I wait, and wait, and wait, in misery.

The last time I did venture there, 'twas at the hour
Of one, and yet, I waited till four and forty.
And when I asked, how long, the male owner did say,
"Few minutes, fair maiden, fear not, 'twill be but a few."
But lo, the minutes passed, and still I waited,
Until at last, I didst speak, and give my mind.

"Good sir," quoth I, "methinks 'twould be most kind,
If thou couldst tell me, how long I shall be left behind.
For I have places to go, and things to do,
And waiting here, doth vex me, as thou dost see."
But he, with scorn and pride, didst reply,
"If thou dost not like it, fair maiden, then go thou away.
We have enough of custom, and need not thy pay."

O, cruel fate, that doth beset me thus,
With gel polish that doth fade, and pedicures poor.
I shall not return, forsooth, to this place,
For 'tis not worth my time, nor my gentle grace."
"Burger King? More like Burnt Offering. Forgot my fries, served stale, flavorless crap. Sandwiches? Tasted like gas station leftovers. Never going back."

"Fizz, the joint's a dump. BS two-for-one cards, desperate for business. Aggressive bartender, rude as hell. Shoved around for other guests? My money's not good enough? Never felt more unwelcome. Seven Stars member, they didn't know. Casino host pissed about how I was treated. Normally, positive reviews, 99%. Fizz, fizz out within a year. Writing's on the wall."
"Skip this joint. Service sucked. Food? Forget about it. Fries were decent, that's it. Our server space cadet, forgot our drinks, twice. And when she remembered, one was contaminated."

"Terrible. Awful. Had to hoof it down sixteen flights of stairs with my gear. Toilet was busted, lights were out. Got stuck in a handicap room, all I wanted was a tub. \n\nWaited to raise hell, but the lines were endless. Avoid this place like the plague."
"Ran into some lip from the staff. Mall was mediocre, but in Arizona, that's worth a single star. Can't stand rudeness."

"Hark! The victuals were of fair quality, I must confess,
And the iced coffee, a refreshing delight, did impress.
But lo, the portion, a paltry sight it was,
A cup of ice, with coffee, scarce a dram or two, alas!
I ventured thither once again, with hope in heart,
To taste the brew, and find a better part.
But nay, the cashier, with scant regard, did say,
'You asked for less ice', and thus, my hopes did fade away.
Alack, I sought a new abode, where iced coffee flows,
For at this place, they do not proffer what the coins disclose."

"Hark, my friends, I do declare,
Big O Bigfoots doth surround my carriage fair.
One on the rear didst come apart, alas,
And caused great damage to the wheel and quarter glass.
The tires, still under warranty, didst provide
A glimmer of hope, but nay, 'twas but a ruse.
For when I went to claim my due,
They told me they had not the tire in store, oh woe is me!
A month hath passed since then, and still I wait,
For justice to be served, and my claim to be met.
But alas, the insurance companies and lawyers,
Do they not keep our land in endless troubles?"

"They're the worst. Little power, they treat you like trash. Like Nazis, no reason, just mean. Hate dealing with 'em. Curt, impersonal. Avoid 'em. Call themselves a law firm, but they're a collection agency with zero personal touch. Don't rely on repeat business, show it. Never wrote a review before, but had to after my last call with Christine. Good luck."
"No review for this joint. Bathroom's a dump, real small too. Figured I'd give the local coffee a shot. What a letdown."

"Been a member here for three years now, but this joint's gone down the drain. Trash and mess ain't cleaned up 'til seven in the morning. They're open three hours before that and it's a damn mess. Just couldn't take it no more."

"Fresh & Easy's become a joke. Advertising'specials' that don't exist. New pet peeve: stores that don't give rain checks for out-of-stock items, then magically restock at full price. Example: tri-tip steak sale $2.99, but only if you call around to find it. Same with pineapple, $.99 cents, but always out of stock. Manager said, 'tough luck dude, rain checks not our policy.' Back to driving further to Trader Joes, where they respect their loyal customers. Goodbye Fresh-n-Easy, was a loyal customer, but now I won't shed a tear when you're replaced by a worthy competitor. Bye bye, 'dude'!!"

"Verily, I had visited this place ere now, and found it passable, in sooth. Yet, being nearby, I chose to give 't another chance, alas! How grievously mistaken was I! Forsooth, the maiden who tended me was most unfriendly, and spent her time in idle chatter with another woman. When I asked a question, she replied with haughty disdain, and set about buffing my toenails with such vigor that my skin was scratched and sore. Nay, I shall ne'er return to this wretched place!"

"Crime's a real issue, friend. Had my phone and keys swiped while I was takin' a dip at Dowd. Babysitter's car got broken into too, same parkin' lot. That's two incidents in just a couple months. Don't reckon it's worth the risk, workin' out where you and your stuff ain't safe."

"O, how my heart doth yearn for Chipolte's tasty fare,
But alas, this place did leave me in despair.
Their stock of chips, depleted, left me in dismay,
And lettuce, fresh and crisp, they did not have in play.
Black beans, crunchy and rough, like from a can they came,
Did little to assuage my hunger or my shame.
The privies, foul and unkempt, did cause me great distress,
And tables, unclean, did leave me in a sorry mess.
On a Saturday eve, at eight o'clock, no less,
I found this place, in disarray, and in excess.
Fie upon this Chipolte, with its lacking ways,
I shall not return, nor partake in its days."

"Terrible customer service. My wife had a dreadful experience. They wouldn't give her the physical x-rays she brought in. Said they'd only email them. Then, they cancelled my appointment because of her bad review. Didn't even speak with us first. Who does that? \n\nEdit: Your response is bogus. Someone cancelled my appointment based on her review, not my wife's call. They said they couldn't find my appointment because it was already cancelled. You're either clueless about your business or lying."
"Wings, big as buffalo. Seated fast, ignored slowly. Five servers strolled by, three stopped to chat. Eight minutes, still waiting. Talking, not working, their game."

"I decided to join my family in Vegas for a birthday celebration. They were staying at the Bellagio, but the prices were too steep for my short stay. So, I booked a room at Planet Hollywood instead. It wasn't a complete disaster, but it wasn't great either. The rooms felt outdated and a bit grimy. It reminded me of the 90s, like something from Britney Spears' era. There were some issues with the room, like a missing drawer front and weird smells from the sink. The pull chain shades were also a pain. I could see myself staying here in my younger years, but now I prefer a more comfortable and modern place, like Aria."

"Place had potential, but service was a bust. Blonde waitress, arrogant, didn't give a damn. Took our order, disappeared. Starters arrived, no drinks. Asked another waitress, nothing. An hour in, still no food. Cancelled, left for better joint. Other guests, same story. Staff too busy chatting to care. Waste of time."

"This joint used to serve up some top-notch grub. Great spread, too. But then they moved and I reckon they swapped out the cooks. Food was pure garbage. You gotta figure, decent buffets in this town are packed, even the crummy ones got lines out the door. Not this dump, though. Dead as a doornail at 7pm on a Wednesday. My crew and I hit up buffets on Wednesdays, and we ain't never seen anything like this. Just walk right up, pay your cash, and help yourself. Trouble is, buffets need turnover or the grub gets stale. And boy, did it ever. Prime rib, but every last slice was cooked well done. Place was a total bust, foodwise. Way too many better options in town for the same price."

"Terrible Japanese. Biggest ripoff. Veggies steamed, frozen. Ginger soy sauce, minimal. Microwaved, waterlogged. Eight bucks. Worst teriyaki. Never wrote a review. Poor quality. Rice, subpar. Not going back."

"Parking's a bust, seats are scarce, and the crowd's a mix of college brats and wannabe professionals. Owners must love torturing themselves with lousy locations. Street parking's a nightmare, especially when it's packed. Ruins the experience before it begins. It's all a farce, limit seating and parking, create a waitlist, and voila! Instant demand. Go early, grab a spot at the bar, and things aren't so bad. Slices and beer, in and out quick. Music ain't blasting yet, so that's a plus. Fried spicy ravioli's not half bad, but struggling to find something nice to say."

"Alack, my friends, I once didst work at Starbucks yonder,  
But after tasting General Tso's foul dish, I didst refuse  
To order aught but dumplings from this wretched place.  
Forsooth, I saw them pour the dumplings from a bag,  
Frozen and unclean, yet still I didst embrace  
Their fried delights, charred though they were,  
And soaked them in sauce, to ease my weariness.  
Yet, verily, this is the worst Chinese tavern  
That e'er I didst set foot within, by my troth."

"Riverview Toyota. Bad paperwork. Broken gas cap. Waited three weeks for a call. Good on gas, but still. Corporate manager finally picked up. Funding delayed. Took matters into my own hands. Will update when it's sorted."

"Just J., Corliss sold out to H&R block last year. We had used him for eight years, never a problem. But now, they're calling us, trying to drum up business using his name. When we ask for Curt, they offer us an appointment with one of their accountants, but never say they're H&R block. 

Curt told us he sold and retired last year. It was a mess. Terrible office service, bad office manager, maybe a few of 'em. 

Don't be fooled, folks. This ain't Curt's business no more. It's H&R block's, and they stink. Stay away."

"Alas, how ill-fated was my day at the spa!
The masseur did ply his trade with such great zeal,
But alack, his touch did chafe and sear my skin,
As if a hundred fingers did upon my neck spin.
And lo, his ministrations did my back ignore,
A tender spot, where tension doth reside, no more.
A foul stench did issue from his lips, a burp most vile,
Which did my senses offend, and doth beguile.
A foot massage, brief and fleeting, did delight,
But then, alas, my big toe didst receive too much attention, quaint.
In sooth, the whole encounter didst leave me feeling woe,
And thus, I shall not return, no, nevermore, no."

"A friend and I did dine here tonight, upon recommendation of another friend, who swore 'twas excellent. Alas, 'twas not.  After a pleasant greeting, things did quickly decline.  The sommelier struggled mightily with the wine we brought, and my soup arrived barely warm.  Our entrees took an age to come, and mine, alas, was still quite chilly.  The waiter, to his credit, did apologize twice for the delay.  A bad omen, indeed.  The manager did try to make amends with sweet treats and wine, but alas, I have no taste for such.  We did receive some compensation for the corkage fee, and the unwanted desserts and wine were also free.  I fear I shall not return to this place."

"We hit up this spot based on their website. Looked like a cool joint. Happy hour prices, nice decor. Place was clean, but the service? Not so much. Guy behind the bar, first day on the job maybe? No idea what they had. We sat there Thursday night, semi-packed house, and our charcoal went unchanged. Ran into our server on the way to the can, asked her to swap it out. She said yeah, but never came back. Someone else popped in, asked if we were good. Told her we needed fresh charcoal. She went to talk to someone behind the bar, came back saying someone would be right out. Nope. Just walked up to the bar to pay our bill. Two Asian dudes in the whole place. Think that had something to do with it. Server changed the charcoal in the booth next to us, skipped us, then did the one on the other side. If you're not one of them, service sucks."

"Room and service were good. Studio had a fridge 18ft from bed, compressor got loud. Hotel's downtown location was convenient. Walk from train station was uphill, 10-15 min. Taxi rides cost $12CDN with tip, $38CDN without tip. I stayed on 14th floor, odd-numbered room, floor #03. Nightclub across the street played loud music all night, patrons were rowdy. Light sleepers should avoid rooms facing Peel St or stay elsewhere. Workout room was spacious, well-equipped. Breakfast was average, included. For $40/night more, stay at Marriott-proper south of here. Better views, more convenient. Rating: 1 star due to loud music and rowdy patrons."

"Listen up, kid. I got a bone to pick with this joint. So they seat me at 5:40 am, but I can't order off the after 6 am menu 'cause some chefs only know how to cook certain things? Bacon and sausage, huh? Sounds like they're just trying to cover their own asses. And then they take their sweet time bringing me my grub, not till after 6:30. What kinda joint is this?

Now, my buddy here can't order scrambled eggs, bacon, and home fries. But he can have scrambled eggs, no bacon, and fries. That don't make no sense. And my other pal can have chicken fried steak, biscuit, gravy, and home fries? What's the deal, man?

And let me tell you something else. I can't order the salad that's on the menu, but I can order the ahi tuna or chicken and waffles that ain't on the menu? That's just plain silly. 

So I go through all this trouble to order, and they give me a menu with crosswords and puzzles on it, but they got the only pen in the whole place? Come on, guys. Get your act together. And them chefs in the back? They need to step up their game. None of the food was worth a damn."

"Cupcakes, dry as the Sahara. Twice, I've tried 'em. Twice, they've failed me. Third time's the charm, they say. But no, still dry, still nasty. Funky icing, too. Like someone vomited on my tongue. Place needs a new baker, pronto."

"Alas, poor service did abound,
Food most foul, drinks not worth a pound.
Atmosphere, a mess, a sight most vile,
Ick, indeed, doth sum up the while."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I sat, waiting to be seated. Then, waited some more for my order to be taken. Finally, the food arrived, undercooked and incorrect. Overpriced. Not worth the trouble.

"Gave the guy twenty bucks for gas, but the pump stopped at nineteen eighty-nine. Not about the eleven cents, it's the principle. Most pumps stop short, but this one was different. Trigger was loose, wouldn't budge. Fucked up, if you ask me."

"Korean BBQ, real good. Reviews said so, too. Small joint, grills at each table. Staff, not so excited to help. Quiet night, shoulda been glad for the business. No refills on drinks, meat, or sides. All-you-can-eat? Yeah, right. TV blasting, staff ignoring folks. Took 20 minutes for the check. Told the next table to hurry up, people needed their spot. Bathrooms, a mess. Makes ya wonder about the kitchen. My Korean friends, they agree, service stinks. Big letdown."

"Kelly O's. Twice. First time, food's nothing special. Give 'em another shot. Order Eggs Benedict. Raw potatoes, overcooked eggs, yellow syrup they call Hollandaise. Send it back. Second time, ask 'em to skip the Hollandaise. Cold potatoes, undercooked eggs. Whites are clear. Ask the waitress why they fried 'em instead of poaching. She starts lecturing me on their kitchen, chef's methods, wait staff's speed. Blah blah."
"Terrible service. Rude staff. Food's alright, but not worth the trouble. Won't be going back."

"O, woe betide thee, traveler, who doth seek
Aid for thy work-related injury within
These halls of healing! Forsooth, 'tis a curse
To be confined to such a wretched place,
Where staff are rude and care not for thy plight,
And waiting times do stretch on endlessly.

Dr. Klausner, a man of medicine, no doubt,
Yet doth he prioritize his purse above
Thy well-being. He doth delay, with intent
To save a coin or two, thy needed tests,
MRI's and X-rays, leaving thee in pain,
And still, he doth endeavour to send thee back
To toil, despite thy lingering hurt.

Oh, friend, avoid this place, and seek instead
A haven where they truly care for thee,
Lest thou suffer needlessly, in pain and woe."

"Pharmacists are meant to aid folks, not hinder 'em. This joint's a bust. I'd give it zero stars if I could. The missus behind the counter treats patients like junkies. My sis just got outta the hospital, gall bladder removed, and this dame wouldn't fill her script. I'll never come back, and I hope others don't either. Wish I could do more than just leave this review."

"Sausage fans, EDM lovers, and those who crave the scent of bleach, this joint's for you. But let's be real, it's trying too hard to be fancy in a town where chill vibes reign supreme. The only redeeming quality? The discovery of Ami's nearby."

"Verily, this place doth have the worst customer service, full of holes and flaws! They didst cut mine hound, and gave him razor burn, then didst deny it, the scoundrels! Months passed, and we didst give them another chance, and called to make an appointment, and they didst say we could not return! Ha! Fie upon thee, cursed place! Thy prices be so high, 'tis sheer madness! Try Best Friend Groomers on Grand/Dysart, a far better choice, methinks."

LAS, a sorry excuse for an airport. Overcrowded, undersized. Security nightmare, C/D a never-ending wait. A/B, slightly better, but still a crapshoot. Getting a cab, pure madness. Noise and ads in baggage claim, enough to drive you mad.

"Haven't been here in years. Now I recall why. Ordered flatbread pizza. Waiter dropped pieces on the table. Said we weren't eating that. He said he'd check if they could make more. Pretty sure they just flipped 'em over and served 'em up. Gross! Didn't touch it. Cobb salad was next. Old lettuce, no romaine, no bacon. Lame! Server was like Casper, disappeared the whole time."

On Aug 15th, 8:30 PM, I ate there. Not crowded. Service was good. BLT was good. Glad I didn't hit the can before my grub. Foul sewer gas stench in the men's room. I told the waitress, she shrugged, "Yeah, it's been like that." I said, "Fix it." She said, "Yeah." When I paid, I brought it up again. The lady said, "We know." I said, "Call a plumber." Her response? "Well, it's been like that."
"Bartenders? Green as grass. Don't know squat 'bout mixin' drinks. Hired 'em for their looks, not their smarts."

"We hit up the 4AYCE sushi joint on a Fri eve, 90 bucks for the both of us. Got a sweet coupon, buy three, get one free. 

- Welcoming vibes, friendly faces, and prompt drink service. 
- Arrived at 6, things went south around 6:30. Service fell apart like a cheap watch. 
- They need more efficient servers, not just warm bodies. 
- Can't even spell! Had to spell out LASAGNA for the poor girl. Took a whole minute. Other tables had similar issues. 
- Orders got mixed up, saw my hamachi nigiri go to some other folks. Not just that, happened a few times. 
- Ordered udon, got ice cream instead. WTF? No more udon. Cancel that. 
- Servers looked lost, confused. Had all the time in the world to observe them since no food was coming our way. 
- Only one sushi chef! The other guy was probably the sous chef. 
- Had a bunch of sushi rolls, but they were soggy, drenched in spicy sauce. Fail. 
- Salmon skin roll was decent. Win. 
- This place is going downhill. That coupon wasn't worth it. 
- Avoid it."
"Green beans, worm-ridden. Service, poor. No apology. Horrible."

"Motel 6 gave me better service. Told front desk about the drunks kicking my tires. They said they were sorry and walked away. Dirty towels and bedding finished it for me. Going back to Motel 6 next time."
"This joint's a bust. Overpriced and understocked. Only reason I come here's 'cause it's within walkin' distance. Otherwise, I wouldn't bother with this dump. Friendly cashiers, though."
"Service? Forget it. Food? Meh. But I keep comin' back for that rice. Can't mess that up, right?"
"This joint's pricey, filthy, and a good spot to stumble to when you're too sauced to drive to a decent market for a cold one."
"At the club, a grumpy guard growled, 'Quit dancin' or I'll stomp your face.' VIP service, eh?"

I couldn't say a thing, not after getting shut out. They don't take reservations, it's first come, first served. I tried calling ahead, but nobody picked up. Got transferred to the hotel concierge, but they couldn't get through either. Not a good start. I'll give it another shot sometime.

"Za Jiang Mein, I ordered it before. Supposed to be hot. Went there, waited 35 minutes. Only two other customers. Asked the server, 'Why the delay?' 'Cause you came at this time, she said. One chef, making the food. Fine. Server brings me the noodle, it's cold. Asked her, 'Why cold?' First, she thought it wasn't right. Chef's yelling from the kitchen. Rinsed in cold water, so we can stir in the za jiang sauce. Even if rinsed, still should be warm. Told the server, 'Maybe the chef forgot.' Maybe it's soaked too long. Heard the chef and server talking shit in Chinese. Don't want to eat there no more. Their mistake, won't admit it, blame the customer."

"Dave's a stand-up guy, always will be. But this mornin', he didn't show. My husband called, asked where he was. Dave said he'd moved on from the sprinkler game. That's a damn shame. I had a lot of respect for him, enjoyed workin' together."

"O, wouldst thou suffer the worst pool experience e'er?
Then, prithee, seek out this wretched pool, my dear!
We chanced upon it on a Saturday morn,
And lo, the water was murky, foul, and forlorn.
'Tis small, indeed, and didst play host to snobs,
Who deemed themselves too cool, with scanty robs.
But wait, there's more! The bartender, in his haste,
Didst mix our card with another, of like taste.
We were left without a debit card, alas!
And when we sought to resolve this woeful pass,
The workers here, incompetent, we found, alack!
Never again shall we return, no, not e'er!"
"Few grub choices. Looks like it's been sittin' there for hours. Nasty. McDonald's beats this dump. Service? Forget about it. Managers nowhere to be found. Workers just stand around, jawin' away."

"Filthy joint. Counter and floor, dirty as hell. Cashier, rude as sin. Didn't give a damn we were there. Trash everywhere, inside and out. Only table, piled high with garbage. We took our business elsewhere. Don't come here for a decent meal. Hard, crusty bread, wilted veggies, dried-out meat. This place, avoid it."
"Garlic toast, burnt. Wings, decent, but batter-heavy. Pie, uncooked, soggy crust. Greasy mess. Service, poor. Three out of five gone, still waiting for the check. Can't recommend this joint."

"Terrible service at a half-empty joint. Waited 45 minutes to be seated, and my buddy's knife was filthy. Sure, mistakes happen, but then the table behind us sent their plate back 'cause it was dirty too. Slow service, even though they said the kitchen was swamped. Took 45 minutes for sundaes! The server asked how everything was and split before we could answer. Don't believe the hype, folks. This place ain't worth your dough."

"Worst experience of my life at this pancake joint. Manager was a real jerk when I asked for a sub. Had the nerve to tell me he'd charge me extra for a slice of tomato. Can you believe that? Attitude like that on a Saturday afternoon and he's the general manager? No wonder this place gets bad reviews. Food wasn't worth coming back for anyway. Pancakes tasted like crap. Not going back there again."

"Chipotle, I love thee. But this location? Not so much. Long lines, stagnant as a river in winter. Thirty minutes to place an order, ten more to receive it. Forty minutes, total. Unacceptable, especially during off-peak hours. Staff, inexperienced and flustered. Training, lacking. Gloves, not changed. Nose-wiping, food-touching. Unhygienic. Management, take note. Do something, anything. For the love of Chipotle, fix this."

"Not a pleasant experience. Been there twice, needed a good manicure. Fourth salon in the area, still no luck. Owner's got an attitude, real stern and abrupt. During my second drying session, she yells at me, 'You pay now!' Looked at her like she was crazy, told her to calm down and back off. First visit was similar, kicked me out of the massage chair after my pedicure, told me to sit down. Didn't sit, walked out instead. Other staff are okay, but the owner needs to chill out and not interact with customers. Won't be going back."
"Terrible massage. Worst of my life. Never going back. Paying $80 for some lazy oil rub? No thanks. First time posting a negative review, but this place deserves it."

"Food's decent, but that's where the positives end. Service is non-existent. Lunch special's till 4pm, but we got there at 3:55pm. Waitress told us it was too late, but my boyfriend showed her his watch. She checked with the boss, who said it was cool. Then she tells us they're out of fried rice and noodles. What kinda joint's called Rice n Noodle without the goods? Employees chow down in front of customers, too. Won't be comin' back."

"A plague upon this wretched place, I say,
Where heat and sickness did my soul assail.
The line, a serpent, long and slow,
Didst wind its way, a winding course,
To gain entrance, a most tedious chore.
And then, the music, loud and wild,
Didst pierce mine ears, a most grievous wound.
The misting nozzles, too, didst spray
Their foul contents, in my drink, alack!
And there, a man, with years so many,
Didst claim, in folly, youthful vigor still.
But I, in haste, didst flee this den,
And sought the privy, where I might sit,
And ponder all the ills that had befallen me.
For in this city, all is not well,
And what occurs here, shall remain untold."
"Orders never right. Double check bag before leaving. No lights at night. Poor service. Sonic's better. This McDonald's needs work. Bad."

"Check your statements, my friend. This joint's got some shady business goin' on. I got hit with a $113 tip on a $97.58 bill. That's not just a mistake, that's robbery. The owner, Schuyler, won't listen. Says his staff might be doin' somethin' fishy, but I know what I saw. They added $113 to the tip line and changed the one to a two. Now I gotta go through the cops to sort this out. It's a damn shame."

"Five of us stayed at the Golden Nugget, Feb 8-10. Took us a bit to realize their slots don't pay squat. Nada. Zilch. Not even a small token to keep you playing. So, we just strolled out the door in search of better odds. Figured folks should know. We're from outta state."

"Airport layover, hunger pangs hit. This place, a mistake. Overcooked, processed slop. Kung Pao chicken, fried rice, too much. Can't finish, waste of ten bucks. Walk to Burger King, cheap and good. Compared to this, five-star meal."

"Took my pal to the package joint to mail a gift to her kid for her birthday.  The counter guy, Bill, wouldn't send the package 'cause she couldn't read the address on his paperwork.  My buddy said she couldn't, not that she wouldn't, but she just couldn't.  She had the address on the box, but Bill wanted her to check his printout.  He said he wouldn't send it unless she did.  My friend can't 'cause she's legally blind.  Bill wouldn't lift a finger and refused to mail the package."

"Worst dry cleaner in town. Took my expensive shirt, returned it with the pocket on the inside. Like they ripped it off and sewed it back wrong. Confrontational when I complained. Wouldn't take responsibility. Reported 'em to the BBB. Avoid 'em like the plague."

"Salon's got some size, but your stylist makes all the difference. Bought a Groupon for level 3 cut and moisture treatment. Ken's the name, five minutes for the cut, forty for blow-dryin', chat and forget the treatment. Technique's crap, no layers, uneven. He ain't takin' it serious. Won't be back. MCN's better. Avoid Ken like the plague if you hit up Dean of Shadyside."

"I handed over my prized MIDI controller, a weighted 88-key beauty, to a man I thought I could trust. He promised to fix it, but month after month, he fed me nothing but excuses. I've given up hope of ever seeing it again. It's clear this guy's a scammer, preying on unsuspecting musicians like me. He takes their gear, fixes it up, and sells it for a profit. I'm just another notch on his belt."

"Methinks 'tis fair to say, my dear Macaroni Grill,  
Thou art a place of joy, where food doth please,  
But, alas! thy service doth leave much to be desired,  
Alack! poor waiters, who their duties do neglect.  
My wife and I, we didst visit thee a fortnight past,  
And, lo! our waitress didst forget us, full oft,  
We left, in sorrow, vexed by her negligence.  
Yet, willing to forgive, we didst give thee another chance,  
Alas! the second time, a different server, same result,  
The place was empty, yet they didst not attend to us,  
I had to hail a waiter, to get the bill, in haste.  
Verily, poor customer service, doth mar thy name,  
Macaroni Grill, take heed, and change thy ways, ere too late."
"Went to the joint near Cave Creek. Had the bacon chicken fajitas. Got food poisoning! Be careful, folks. Always been a fan of this place, but I'll be taking a breather for now."

"Loved this joint, but last time I got my nails done, I didn't have time to paint 'em. Had to get to work. Came back a couple times after that, but they were too busy. Today, I got a new set and thought maybe they'd give me a break on the price since they didn't paint my last ones. No dice. Always tipped 20-30%, been a customer since they opened. Bad service. Won't be going back. Tell my friends and family to steer clear."
"Tried this sushi joint near my digs in Summerlin. Ordered takeout. Sushi didn't impress. Rolls looked sloppy. Got a salmon roll. Salmon was cooked, not fresh."

"Salt, too much of it. I like salt, but this was excessive. Veggie fries, looked forward to 'em, but only managed a few. Chicken, fatty and flavorless, except for the salt layer. Friend raves about the burgers, maybe that's the way to go...


Wouldn't eat here again for free. Gross."

"This wretched sheet, a scourge upon our fair city's name, doth spew forth lies and falsehoods with each passing day. 'Tis naught but a mouthpiece for the wealthy elite, its pages filled with venomous vitriol aimed at those who dare oppose their twisted views. The very thought of it doth make mine blood boil with indignation! Forsooth, 'tis a stain upon our fair city's reputation, a blight that doth cast a shadow o'er all that is good and pure. And yet, despite its wicked ways, still it doth persist, fed by the tainted gold of Scaife, that wicked knave who doth pour forth ten thousand pieces of silver each year to keep this vile rag afloat. But fear not, dear friends, for there is hope yet! For in the face of such deceit and villainy, doth stand the Post Gazette, a beacon of truth and righteousness, shining brightly for all to see!"

We hit up this joint for brunch last Sunday, my friend's been raving about it. Place was packed, like 75% full. We stood around for five minutes, nobody noticed us. Bartender just ignored us too. Felt kinda weird, like we were intruding or something. Saw a bunch of other folks still waiting to be served. Figured it'd be a long wait, they were shorthanded. Not the best first impression. Might give 'em another shot come spring, hope they've got their act together by then.

"O, how my heart doth sing with joy for Best Buy,
But alas, this particular store doth fail.
The staff, so rude and unfriendly, doth make me frown,
And under-trained, they know not how to please.

Until the day that management doth see,
The need for training, and doth set them free,
I shall take my business elsewhere, 'tis true,
For poor service doth not a loyal customer make.

I went to Sam's, a new TV to procure,
And though I shall return, if ill-treated, I assure,
I shall depart, and seek a rival's embrace,
For customer service, a higher price I'll gladly pay,
And drive a little further, to find a better place.

Shame on thee, Best Buy, for thy complacency,
Assuming all will come, regardless of decree.
But consumers, they will seek, a better way,
And pay a little more, for a brighter day."

"Tis but a humble abode, devoid of pomp and fanfare,
A place where fortune doth not often smile upon the player.
The halls, they stretch on, endless and dim,
A passageway to woe, and naught but sorrow within.

The machines, they churn and spin, their lights a-blinking,
But rarely doth a soul emerge with riches worth the thinking.
I, myself, didst partake in this folly,
Yet fortune didst elude me, as it doth so many.

Alas, the casino, it doth lack the grandeur,
Of those famed halls, where luck doth oft confer.
In truth, 'tis naught but a narrow corridor,
Leading to losses, and naught else beside, I do avow.

So if thou seekest riches, and a heart full of cheer,
Best avoid this place, and seek thy fortunes elsewhere.
For here, the fates doth seem to mock and jeer,
Leaving thee with naught but empty pockets, and a heart full of despair."
"Bought a six-incher with combo at this Subway, $8.50. Soda and drink cost half the price of the sandwich. Went to another Subway, same meal, $6.30. Won't be back."

"Two things take me to Mac's - the joe and cheap sweets. Gotta hand it to 'em, they run a tight ship. In and out, no fuss. But not this time. Ten minutes for a cup o' coffee? Four tables, all empty. Customers bitchin' 'bout grub quality, missin' nosh. Where's the boss? Looks like they didn't finish Hamburger U."

"Skip this joint. Overpriced grub at Denny's. Sure, the service is decent, but you're still shelling out too much cash for a mediocre meal. If you're itching for a fast food fix, head to Addiction instead. It's a better value."
"Overpriced. Dilapidated. Loud. Dowdy. Cheap. Spring breakers everywhere. Long lines for everything. Four bucks for a tiny bottle of water. Service? Don't get me started."

"Verily, I say unto thee, good sir, avoid this place with haste. Forsooth, the service is poor and the owner doth possess a foul mood. Our victuals didst arrive in tardy fashion, and alas! the appetizers didst fail to manifest themselves in due time. The potables, too, didst leave much to be desired. In sooth, the beef noodle broth was the most vile concoction I hath ever had the misfortune to sample. In brief, dear friend, steer clear of this wretched establishment."

"Walk into a busy restaurant, one server hustling to keep up. I think he's doing his best, but the crowd's getting restless. I order the tofu soup, add $7 for short ribs. They're burnt, tasteless, and chewy. Not worth it. I try the bulgogi too, but it's clear that SOYO's the better choice for Korean food. I won't be coming back here. One and done, Mr. Tofu."
"Haircut was shit. Won't be going back. Not picky, just didn't want much taken off. Cut nearly five inches. Unacceptable."

"Place sucks. Cashiers clueless. Asked for carne asada burrito, wet style. Told no. Rude. Paying customer, get what I want. Where's customer service? Never again. Had to talk to'manager.' No manager, huh?"

"Taste's good here. But my last visit? Awful. Me and the missus ordered one dish each. Kimchi stew arrived quick, but we waited forever for his bulgogi. Finally, some other group, who came after us, got their grub. I asked the waiter what was up, and he said we never ordered it. Bullshit. I remember correcting my guy's order 'cause he messed up the word. That jerk couldn't get two orders right and had the nerve to act like he didn't do nothing wrong. Made us wait another 20 minutes too. Zero apologies, terrible attitude."
"Bought my laptop at Best Buy in Dec. Update killed it. Wasted hours on phone with maker. They said BB'd cover it. Didn't give a damn. Brought it back in orig. box. Still, horrible service."

"Methinks I've supped at Max's in fair Glendale, California, a fortnight hence. And lo, the news of its arrival in Las Vegas didst bring me joy. Forsooth, my heart didst yearn for Max's delectable Beef Caldereta, with garlic rice, a dish most wondrous. Alack, 'twas not to be, for this location doth not serve it. Nay, they doth offer but the basics.

"I didst partake of the Chicken Sigsig, a whole chicken, garlic rice, and the Halo-Halo. The Sigsig, alas, didst lack in flavor, tasting but of mayonnaise mixed with day-old fowl and slices of jalapeno. For a better Sigsig, methinks Cafe Moda doth serve it more deftly.

"The whole chicken, verily, didst boast of moist and tender flesh, and I didst enjoy the crispy skin. Yet, I do confess, I know not why men doth rave of its flavor, for methinks 'twas lacking in this bird.

"The garlic rice, in sooth, didst please mine taste.

"Lastly, I didst command the Halo-Halo, and, by the stars, 'twas delicious! The best, indeed, in all of Las Vegas.

"The servants, kindly and courteous, didst attend to mine needs.

"But, gentle reader, take heed of this: ask not for water, for 'tis naught but tap water, unfiltered and hard. Pray, request bottled water instead.

"In conclusion, the victuals, alas, didst lack in flavor and authenticity, and the prices, methinks, are overmuch. I shall not return for the entrees, save for the Beef Caldereta, which doth stir mine appetite. But, anon, I shall return for the Halo-Halo, forsooth."

"Starbucks, convenient but flawed. Management, invest time in staff. Name botched despite clear spelling. Pastries requested, singular served. Caramel macchiato, absent caramel. One star, courtesy of a lovely employee's smile."

Fie upon this wretched place, where service doth falter!
Our server, a sour-faced soul, didst bring us naught but woe.
The corned beef hash, a dish most foul and loathsome,
Didst come straight from a can, with texture of a wet cloth.
I couldst not stomach it, so vile was its appearance.
The toast, cold and uninviting, didst offer scant consolation.
This establishment doth show no regard for culinary art.
I didst take my leave, with naught but disdain in mine heart.
And thus, I say to thee, dear friend, avoid this place,
For Bagel Cafe, down the street, doth serve a far better feast.
"Courts shut 'em down. For lease sign hangs in the window, empty and waiting."

"Terrible place. First time, nail tech slapped on acrylic like there was no tomorrow. Couldn't even bend my fingers. Had to go elsewhere to fix the mess. 

Foolishly, I went back for my brows. Nice job, I thought. But a few days later, my face looked like a tomato farm. Turns out they used old wax. 

Stay away from this dump."
"Eat before you go. Don't waste your money here. Family of four, $90, left hungry. Mandatory 18% tip, what a joke. Never again."

"Place was a dump. Hostess cleaning menus like it was her job. Asked for kids menu, she couldn't find it. Server brought it eventually. Apps were cold and stale. Corned beef and cabbage was spoiled. Shepherd's pie was lukewarm and not good. Cheeseburger was well done and cold. Manager took care of the bill but I still paid $25 for crap. Avoid this joint."

"Hark, fair friends, I come from yonder east,
Where taco stands doth dot each corner, a feast.
But now, alas, I dwell in this fair west,
Where tacos, they do not quite pass the test.

A new tavern, it did open, to my delight,
But, alack, the prices, they did take flight.
Thirty dollars, for two burritos, and four tacos,
With drinks, it did seem, a bit too much, methinks.

The taste, it did not live up to my hopes,
Like homemade, the burritos, they did cope.
The beans, they did taste, of canned variety,
And rice, they did not add, oh, woe is me!

A true Mexican tavern, would not forget,
The rice and beans, they would put in the debt.
But nay, they did not, and so, I say,
I shall return, to the east, for tacos, ere the day."

"Stayed one night. Checked in, but had to switch rooms after finding a used drug needle in the bathroom. Front desk manager didn't give a damn. No discount, no apology, nothing. Unsafe conditions, avoid at all costs."
"Dirty joint. Staff too busy yapping and snacking to care 'bout customers. One cruddy dressing room. Rest's a mess. No thanks, pal."

"Nachos brought us here, and boy, did they disappoint. Ordered the four-cheese platter, asked for black beans, and what did we get? A sorry excuse for a snack, that's what. Pico de gallo was scarce, black beans were few and far between. Service was decent, though. Waiter brought out more beans, but it wasn't enough to save the dish. Velveeta-like cheese? No thanks. For the price, they should've added more toppings. Jalapeños, onions, salsa - something. And let's not forget the stench in some parts of the joint. Sewage issues, maybe?"
"A+ service, staff top-notch. Food? Overpriced and bad. One star for service, but I'd trade it for grub that's worth the dough."

"Went to America's Taco Shop on 16th and Camelback. Not impressed. Ordered two carne asada tacos and chips and salsa. $8.09? No way. Thought a burrito was a better deal. Guy taking my order gave me a hard time when I changed my mind. Bad attitude. Place was empty, too. Felt uncomfortable. Won't be going back. Reading Yelp reviews later, glad I didn't try the food. Guy at the cashier even shouted, 'Thanks Annie!' in a condescending way. Poor customer service. Stay away from this joint."
"Terrible experience. Cold water, sloppy wax job. Cash tips only. Not going back. Know any good nail joints?"

"Management must not check their Yelp. Still no action on the terrible service. Jezabel took my order, answering curtly. I figured they were busy, but she hung up without asking my name or saying goodbye. Another time, two workers chatted and laughed in the kitchen while I stood waiting. My smoothie was flavorless. Others shared the same experience. I'm done with this place. Convenience isn't worth the crap service. Wish Yelp allowed zero stars."

"We joined another couple on a Hoover Dam Tour, package included lunch at Miracle Mile Shops and a voucher for Whittlesea Cab. Sounded good, right?

Wrong. At the end of a long day, I called the number on the voucher, got the dispatcher. She was rude, arrogant, told me Whittlesea doesn't send cabs to pick up customers with vouchers. We had to wait at the mall until a cab showed up, dropping off other customers. But, if I wanted to pay, she'd send one out. 

We saw one cab show up every five minutes, decided to just jump in the next one. Based on this experience, I'll never use Whittlesea Blue Cab. I'm in Vegas six to eight weeks a year, and none of the cabs I jump into will have Whittlesea on the side, I assure you. Stay away, stay far away."

"Pizza night, but not as planned. Hair in the pie. Called 'em up, asked for a redo, delivery included. Seemed fair, my mistake not theirs. Rude response, no dice. Asked for the boss, lied to my face - guy in a red polo, manager or not? Customer service, meet failure."

"Service? Forget it. Music blasting, girl can's hear a thing. Order wrong thrice. Change wrong, cashier splits. Selection? Ha! No pastrami, no Swiss, cheddar nowhere. Provolone's all they got. Eat here? You must be joking."

Alas, fair diner, with food most excellent,
And drinks that do please, yet atmosphere doth lack.
The music, loud and shrill, doth pierce mine ears,
And waiters, with voices soft, cannot hear our cheer.
I, who have worked in clubs, where music doth reign,
Do say, this place doth top them all in sound and pain.
A loungy feel, they seek, but to a fault, methinks,
For comfort doth depart, and discomfort doth creep.
Foie gras french toast, a dish most divine,
Didst taste, and mac and cheese, a culinary crime.
Yet, couldst not stay, the music doth oppress,
And migraine, it didst bring, with its excess.
Asked we the waiter, if volume couldst be lowered,
But nay, it seemed not, or barely, it was noticed.
Alas, fair diner, with food most fine,
Yet atmosphere, doth leave much to be desired, I do confess.

"Faculty didn't give a damn 'bout their students. Had a one-on-one session, and they showed their true colors. Glad I finished my studies and don't have to deal with 'em no more. Shame, really. Ruins the reputation of an otherwise decent city college."
Last Thursday night, place was dark, chairs and TVs gone. Closed. Wondering where my friend got his $35 beer mug program. Passed their address, signage down. Toast. RIP Nimbus.
"Wanted to dig this joint, but the service stunk. If the grub's good but the help's lousy, ain't worth my time."
"We took a room at the Luxor, got comped tix to the club. Place was a dump, worst in Vegas. Long, narrow layout, packed with sweaty bodies. Felt like a can of sardines. Not our scene. Won't be back."

"Skip this joint. Waste of cash. Saturday night, dead empty. Apps cold. Wings decent. Chicken dinner cold, sides sucked. Fake smoked ribs, rip-off. Waitress tacked on forty bucks. Martini weak. Bill still steep. Deserts? Forget it. Zero stars if I could. Don't bother."

"Fleming's aint no place for me. Shrimp comes out with guts still inside. Veal chop, raw as hell. Twice I send it back, still cold in the middle. Steak at Dayton, Ohio spot on, but that don't make up for all the other fails."

"Went to this joint a few months back. Dug their threads. Way more selection in person than online. Store manager, though. What a piece of work. Acting all put out that folks wanted to try on clothes before buying. Like, what's the deal? I've done my time in retail too. It's part of the gig. You gotta roll with it. But no, she's giving me, my buddies, and the other shoppers the hairy eyeball. Rude as hell. Get to the register, girl's asking if we found everything alright. We say yeah, and there's a line building up. Second girl tries to open another register, and the manager reams her out. Tells her not to do that, she needs to count stock. Stock being like, a bunch of tank tops on a table. Plenty of 'em. Surprised me, how she's talking to her staff like that. Especially when she's trying to sell us stuff. Hope she's moved on. She was a real stinker."
"Family came, waited forever. Never got served. Left. Bad news for a place I loved, heard great things about."
"Awful joint. Doesn't meet McDonald's standards, not even close. Don't waste your time. Service is terrible, food is cold, and orders are always messed up."
"Terrible customer service. Amusing, really. But the grub's not bad."
"Cold dim sum. Poor service. No details on checkout bill. Not coming back."

"Robert Irvine, we need Restaurant Impossible! This joint's a mess, like a Green Lantern gone wrong. I drove past it a few times, expecting a dipping bar, ya know? Tapas, different items to dip in different dips. Simple, right? Nope. Not here.

First off, I ordered lamb with goat cheese fondue. Sounds good, right? But no, what do I get? Two lamb chops on a crappy bed of rice, with peas, corn, and carrots, and a cheese sauce on top. And the dips? They're on the back of the menu, hidden away. Not exactly what I'd call a dipping bar.

And let's talk decor. It's a mess, man. Green everywhere, pictures that don't match. Flowers on one wall, martini glasses on another. No cohesive theme, just a bunch of random stuff thrown together.

This place could've been great, but it's a lost cause. Give it two more months, tops."

"Four and a half stars? Are you kidding me? I'm Asian, I know my bubble tea. This place serves the worst tapioca I've ever had. If you think this place is good, you need to get out more. Try California, they know how to do tapioca right."

Alas, my friends, I must confess,
The Danity Kane album release party was quite a mess.
No order did prevail, nay, none at all,
A crowd of folk did swarm the entrance hall.

A mosh pit, perchance, for AFI's delight,
Didst I feel, with friends, in midst of fray and fight.
We called ahead, our names to confirm,
Yet Tiffany, or whoever, didst forget, or so it seemed.

Promoters, many, didst make false claims,
To gain entry, fair ladies, they didst proclaim.
Thirty minutes passed, in push and shove,
At last, within, my friends and I didst prove.

The venue, small, yet overcrowded, alack,
Soap foam fell from ceiling, in random attack.
DJ's transitions, poor, in musical sense,
Drinks, not served in shot glasses, but in cups, immense.

Upscale, they called it, but, alas, not so,
For shotty drinks and poor service, didst show.
Thankful, we, that payment, we didst not make,
For such disorder, our souls, wouldst partake.
"Terrible service, piss poor grub. New waitress, chief didn't mesh. Plenty better Italian joints in Vegas."

"Listen up, Native Newyorkers CORPORATE. People are pissed, and for good reason. My recent visit confirmed what everyone's been saying - nothing's changed. Here's my experience:

- Host handed us a menu and told us to find a seat. Lazy much?
- Place was a mess - beer on the floor, sticky tables and chairs.
- It's like a depressing 90's hotel, no atmosphere, no style. And it smells funny.
- Wings were tiny, compared to other NN locations.
- Waiters were rude, unfriendly. No smiles.
- Chicken strips were burnt. We sent them back. No manager came to apologize.

In short, this NN has worse service than a mom-and-pop shop. Not worth it."

"Terrible service. Rude staff. Went with 12 friends from San Diego. Ordered drinks. Ladies went to the bathroom. Waitress took our drinks. I asked why. Employee said he didn't know anything. Told him our drinks were full. He said he didn't care. I said he was being rude. He said fuck you. Bartender ignored me. Old man finally helped. Manager said he'd buy us a drink. I said no. All I wanted was an apology. No one apologized. Never going back."

"Came in for an oil change, routine stuff. They tried to sell me on some extra work, but I declined. Cost was too high, over 2000 bucks. Didn't make me feel too smart. Later, I checked my oil and found some screws missing under the hood. The ones still there weren't secured right. Hood prop rod was busted too, magically. 

Had a similar experience before that. Check engine light was on, so I brought it in. First thing they said was I needed a 100 dollar diagnosis check. Could get that elsewhere for 15 bucks. Tech gave me a weird look when I refused service. Like I was the dumbest customer he'd ever seen. 

Service and work were sub par. Won't be coming back, even though it's close to home."

"One week passed since they hit us with the twenty-five buck fee. No refund, they said. We rang 'em up today, demanded to speak to a manager. If this manager don't give us a ring back and sort this out pronto, we'll have no choice but to cry foul to our bank. That's right, we'll file a fraudulent charge against that joint."

"Life's too short for bad grub, and this joint stole an hour of mine.  I went for the Chicken Pot Pie, expecting a twist on a classic. Instead, they served up a heaping platter of inedible crap. The "crust" was like jerky, impossible to cut with a knife and fork. Bottom line, it was a mess. Some mashed potatoes and mediocre filling didn't save it. No wonder nobody on TV orders this dish. There are better meals to be had in Vegas. Don't waste your time here."

"Never again. Two times, I tried this joint. New Year's Eve, and just to hang out and play some games. Both times, it blew. Bottle service for five hundred clams? What a joke. And don't even get me started on the hundred bucks I lost at keno. Complete waste of time. Oh, and did I mention the yuppie convention in town? What a freakin' nightmare."
"Starbucks, I've seen my share. But this one? Slow and rude, a bad combo. Skip it, friend."

"Vegas for business, SEMA too. Company stayed. Complaints? Plenty. Non-smoking rooms smoked. Bed, wet. Unknown source. Front desk, sorry. Morning fix. Slept in chair. No new room. Fifty bucks. Mandalay Bay, avoid. Economy's rough. Other hotels, better. Bellagio, Caesars. Try them."

"Credit card info swiped after lunch at Jason's Deli. Called manager, just a heads up. She denied it, said employees didn't know anyone in Cali. Poor manager, didn't even take complaint. Fraudulent charges, bad reaction. Not going back."

"Terrible service. Rude waitress, in a hurry. Place was dead, just one other couple at the bar. I was doing the buffet, trying to order, and she just walks away. Never coming back. Shame, it's a nice spot, but they don't know what they're doing."

"Awful service. Zero stars. Arrived 7pm Saturday. Wanted snack from sushi bar. Four girls up front, disorganized. Stood there, no greeting, no acknowledgement. Asked loudly if self-seating. Girl ran after us, rude, said bar wasn't self-seating, staff behind. Walked out. Called manager, apologetic, won't go back."

"Terrible place. Went in with the missus, ordered beer, hot tea, and nachos minus beans. Twenty minutes later, they bring out the nachos with beans. Husband asks a different server if we can get 'em without. Manager comes over, acting like a real jerk. Blames everyone else for the screw-up. Never going back. He even yells at the bartender for trying to help us out."

"Hark, good sir! Thou dost bestow upon this park three stars, yet doth deduct one star forsooth, by reason of yon surfing hour, 'tis a woeful fate, indeed! Forsooth, the fellow who doth govern the surfing shop, a knave, most vile and base, doth decree that thou, in sharing thy board with thine acquaintance, must needs wait in line once more, ere thou mayst partake of thy turn. Fie upon this rule, a silly, unspoken ordinance, concocted by those who deem themselves regulars! Pray, tell, good sir, art thou not vexed by this folly? Verily, 'tis naught but trouble, a mere trifle, unworthy of thy time, or gold, or the brief, fleeting joy of riding the waves. Avoid this place, fair sir, lest thou desirest to suffer the slings and arrows of outrageous fortune!"

"A plague upon this place, a pox upon their house!
Their service be as empty as a hollowed-out mouse.
I stood in line, a wretched soul, for nigh an hour,
Waiting for one, a single soul, to grant me power.
A cell phone, simple thing, yet none would aid,
And thus, I left, with naught but dismay and shade.
The prices, too, did sting, like bees in spring,
So hence, I go, to seek a better ring.
Forsooth, this place doth lack, in truth and fact,
The courtesy, the grace, the very least of act."

"First time here. Friends raved about it, so I brought some pals who'd been before. Noticed their ratings slipped, but we didn't care. We had all-you-can-eat sushi. One buddy loved their oysters, so he ordered two dozen. Regretted it after the first bite - not fresh, bad sauce. Don't want to list everything we had. More cons than pros. 
Pros: 
1. Sashimi option 
2. Friendly server 
3. Fresh salmon 
4. Takes reservations 

Cons: 
1. Many orders weren't fresh 
2. Server mixed up our orders 
3. Seats are too close together 
4. Limited menu 
5. Four sea urchin sushis - two dark brown, two gold. Won't come back."

"Alas, my hunger didst cloud mine eyes,
That I didst forget to capture with mine gaze,
The dishes that didst grace the table before me,
Croquetas and tamales, a feast for thee.

Aye, 'twas a price most steep, for such small portions,
And few options didst the menu offer, alack.
But still, the flavors didst dance upon mine tongue,
As if my mother-in-law's own hand had prepared them, young.

And yet, the service there didst shine so bright,
For when my husband dropped his fork, 'twas replaced with speed,
By the owner's wife, who didst attend to our needs,
With utensils new, and a smile so warm and wide.

Outside, a few tables and chairs didst sit,
For those who wished to dine beneath the sun or stars,
But alas, the place itself, didst leave much to be desired,
And thus, I shall not return, nor recommend it to mine friends, farewell."
"Ten-thirty-one, Saturday night. Club's dead. No dancers. Bartender says they're getting dressed. All of 'em?"

"Impudent, impudent, impudent!  The clerk didst show great disdain towards mine errand.  My betrothed didst warn me, but I didst choose to give her the benefit of the doubt.  She didst not greet me, nor didst she count the items with haste.  Two pieces of ill tidings didst she deliver, with a scowl and a voice most unpleasant (TOUGH),\nNay, young maiden, tough for thee!  To other shops shall we repair, in future days."

"Place has gone downhill fast. Grill guy needs a refresher course, pronto. Chicken's been burnt to a crisp three visits in a row. Not just a little overcooked, but black and disgusting. Staff acts like I'm the problem, eye-rolling and all. Last time, they told me to check the chicken before I leave. Like it's my job to make sure it's not burnt to a crisp. Mashed potatoes were more like soup. Other locations are way better. Wish there was one closer to me."

"Never ate here. Friend got booted for speaking Spanish. Crazy shit, right? Business in America, thinking that's gonna fly. If it's true, then fuck 'em. Don't eat here unless you're some separatist prick."

"Verily, I do detest this wretched place,
Their service doth leave much to be desired,
With haughty looks and rude, imperious grace,
They doth make me feel most uninspired.

But, alas, my friends, they do adore
Some of their brews, and so I doth endure,
Lest I be deemed a snobbish soul,
Who doth reject all else but his own goal.

Nay, ne'er shall I exclaim with glee,
"Hark, let us visit Tea Station, 'tis a spree!"
For Icy Juicy's service doth excel,
And there, my friends, we shall find a better deal."

"Filthy joint. Sheets stained, windows sealed shut, bathroom doors without locks. Stayed four days, not a single visit from housekeeping. What's the point of paying for a room if it's not kept clean? Asked for an AAA discount, but only after booking. What good is that?"

"Thirty bucks for a meal that's just mediocre? No way, pal. You gotta do better than that. 

I mean, sure, the steak was alright, but the rest of it? Nah. Soup, veggies, salad, and prawns that were straight up terrible. And don't even get me started on the salt and pepper. If you're gonna serve meat, you gotta do it right. Sea salt and freshly cracked black pepper, that's the way to go. 

Now, the beer selection wasn't bad, but it's not like you can't find the same stuff elsewhere. Better food, better atmosphere. That's what I'm lookin' for. 

I guess supper clubs are a big deal out here in the Midwest, but I just can't get into it. Too much of a city boy, I reckon."

"Alas, poor Garcia's, thy earnings be but one star,
Forsooth, there was a single soul who did enjoy the fare.
Thy menu, a paltry list, doth claim to be gluten-free,
But in truth, 'tis naught but a scant few dishes, I do declare.

Chicken Gasedo, a shredded fowl in broth, they call it,
Beef Machaco, a similar dish, alack, how doth it fall?
Veggies, salsa, beans, a house salad with oil and vinegar,
A meager feast, indeed, for nine and ninety pence, I do aver.

Alack, the waiter, he didst charge me not,
For both the chicken slop and beans, a curious plot.
Perchance, a mistake, or mayhap, a kindness, who knows?
Yet, wisdom dictates, corn tortillas, a worthy addition, it doth show.

So, Garcia's, heed my words, and mend thy ways,
Add Tostitos, a bag of crunch, to thy kitchen's array.
Forsooth, 'twill bring more stars, and gladness to thy guests,
And prosperity, to thee, shall be the result, thou shalt see."

"Sitting around debating if this was the worst Mexican food we'd ever had, that's what this place was all about. Went on Cinco de Mayo, in a bit of a hurry, thought we could grab a table, eat, and move on. Service was decent, but the food? Garbage. Bland, flat, uninspired. Purple Power Rangers, 20-year-old manager, and horrible grub? Not going back."

"Walked into the joint, asked for a menu. They said no menu. Not helpful. Place was dead empty except for me. Security guard walks in, they offer him a sample. Not me. Wanted soup, got ignored. Lady comes out, doesn't speak English. Can't help. Leave, frustrated. No food, no tea."

"Pho was lousy yesterday. My peeps gotta up their game. Noodles were like instant crap from Lee Lee's and too damn soggy. Special combo wasn't half bad last time, but this time? Fatty piece tasted off. Not coming back 'til I see some decent reviews."
