"Went to this joint for my buddy's birthday dinner and had the worst time. Waitress was a real piece of work, couldn't believe how rude she was. I mean, I've seen some rough service in my day, but this girl took the cake. 

One time, I asked her about the cheese on my fries and she got all huffy, like I was bothering her or something. Then, my friend asks for his appetizer and she cuts him off, says, "How about I fix your fries before they get cold?" Like, what the hell, right? And then she brings 'em back and says, "Next time you want cheese, tell me!" Like we're supposed to be psychic or something. 

Never had a worse experience at any restaurant, period. Stay far, far away from this dump."

"Balloons for my daughter's bridal shower, sixty of 'em. Ordered 'em a month in advance. Called to confirm two days prior. Pick-up time, 10 am sharp. Get there at 10:15, and they're just startin' to fill 'em. Twenty minutes we waited. Food in the van, other things to attend to. Upset, I was. No apology, no compensation. Awful service."

"Food here? Awful. Ceviche, ketchup with chunks. Shrimp, overcooked. Hubby's burger, well-done when he asked for medium. Friend's chicken lettuce wraps, dry and overcooked. Empty place. Patio might be nice on a pretty night, but too hot to sit outside. Stuck inside, like any other chain restaurant. Beer, fine. Service, good. Never going back."

"Avoid 777 Towing like the plague. They're a waste of time and untrustworthy. My insurance company recommended them, but they failed to deliver. First, they said they'd be there in 45 minutes to an hour. Then, they pushed it back to 90 minutes. After that, they claimed it would be another 30-35 minutes. And finally, they said the same thing again. It was a never-ending cycle of lies. When I confronted them, they admitted their truck had broken down and they couldn't make it. But they never told me that directly. Instead, my insurance company had to find out for themselves. In the end, we had to call another towing company that arrived right on time. Don't let 777 Towing leave you stranded like they did to me, in the middle of the night, on a dangerous freeway onramp."

"Verily, good sirs and madams, let this humble quill attest,
That customer service here doth leave much to be desired.
Forsooth, shouldst thou elect to place an order in advance,
Pray, do not be surprised if naught but confusion doth ensue.

Alack, thy order shall not be found, nor any trace thereof,
And thus, thy hopes of savory victuals shall be cruelly dashed.
Alas, though fondness for their fare doth still reside within my breast,
Two strikes, alack, doth suffice to banish me from this establishment's embrace."
"Coffee, good. Barista, rude. Bathroom, no TP. Sign, 'public bathrooms down the street.' Great coffee, shitty experience."

The cheap perfume hit me like a ton of bricks as I entered. It was strong and pumped throughout the place. The rooms were dated, run down, and not clean. We had to change rooms due to a 3ftx3ft area of black chunky mold on the sheets. The new room had a man's whiskers all over the bathroom and quarter-sized holes in the new sheets that looked like a rodent had gnawed. We moved again in the morning. The last room had a "view," but the windows were so dirty you could barely see out. I think the place will be out of business soon, but until then, I wanted to warn others of these conditions.
"Roach in the grub. Big one. Girl found it. Nobody ate. Called 'em up, they said one roach ain't a problem. Bullshit. They came, picked up the food, gave us our money back. Done with 'em."

"Shopping here? Brace yourself for a hard sell. Refuse their add-ons, and they'll turn aggressive. We experienced this firsthand. The salesman's demeanor shifted drastically when we declined their warranty and cables. A self-proclaimed'sales manager' appeared, younger than the salesperson, trying to close the deal. We left empty-handed. Monster Cable? Take flight!"

"Gate C, a real stinker. Slow service, TSA agents don't give a damn if you're handicapped or having a heart attack. They just ignore you. It's like they're trying to make you sweat. First Class folks, they paid extra for nothing. Still waiting in line after an hour. What a joke. Something needs to change."

"Hark, good sir! Our merry band of six didst stop,
After my son's grad'uation, for an early sup.
And ere we entered, didst we pause at Starbucks,
To quaff an iced tea, as our bellies didst rumble and chuck.

But lo! The bartender, with words most uncouth,
Didst say we could not enter, with iced tea in our mouth.
I prayed to speak with his master, to hear his view,
But he, with words most curt, didst say, "He'll tell thee true."

So we didst depart, in search of better cheer,
And found, across the parking lot, a place most dear.
At NYPD, we didst spend $125, with joy and delight,
And found the service there, to be most fair and bright.

But mark my words, good sir! I shall ne'er return,
To this place, where they dost follow liquor laws, with such stern.
For though they mayst follow rules, with diligence and care,
Their hospitality, doth leave much to be desired, I swear!"
"Sushi, worst I've had. Rice, undercooked and stale like old grain. Fish, smelly and dry, low quality. That's all there is to it. Wine, the only edible thing on the menu."

"Filet Mignon Fiasco

Chicken hibachi and filet mignon, we thought it'd be swell. But the filet, oh boy, it was tough as shoe leather. Asked for medium, got well done, chewy as hell. Suspect they switched it out for some other cut, false advertising at its finest. Should be illegal, that's what I say. 

Fried rice, just okay. No choice of steamed rice or noodles, unlike other hibachi joints. Miso soup, too salty, murky, and bland. Salad, just head lettuce, lots of water, not appetizing. Sushi, all cooked, just okay, not the best I've had. Waitress slow, had to ask for tea refills. Whole meal took over an hour, $75 with tip. Not worth the price, time, gas, or wear on the car."

"I've been hitting the links at this course for 15 years, and it's a crap shoot every time. Some days the greens are nice, others they're patchy as hell. But hey, it's a fun little spot, family-owned and all that jazz. They redid the clubhouse recently, looks pretty snazzy. Been going there once a week since last October with the old man. But no more, I tell ya. The service is hit or miss, and I ain't got time for that. Went on Valentine's Day, thought it was great, so we decided to try the Easter brunch. Big mistake. Got there at 12, and most of the food was picked over. Fruit, desserts, you name it. They had three scrambled egg dishes, salad, ham, turkey - marginal brunch, if you ask me. And the staff? Forget about it. They added a 20% gratuity and the bill came to $88. Never going back, and I live in the neighborhood. Gave 'em plenty of chances, complained and all, but they just couldn't figure it out."

"Methought I spied their telly spot,
For sirloin steak and shrimp, all ye can eat,
And thus, my curiosity didst stir,
To venture forth and see what they didst offer.

At noontide, when I arrived, 'twas dark,
As night itself, and I couldst not make out
The menu, nor aught else, for that matter.
A waitress came, and asked if she couldst
Bring me aught. "Aye," quoth I, "a torch,
That I may see the fare thou dost proffer."

I tried, in vain, to find a place
Where light didst suffice to read the bill,
But alas, 'twas not to be, and so
I departed, with a heavy heart, and ill will."

"Alack, what woeful fate didst befall us here!
My love, thy Garfunkels restaurants in fair London,
Didst fill mine heart with hope, and thus I didst coerce
Thy presence in this place, despite the Yelp reviews.
Alas, howe'er, the menu proved quite limited,
And choices few, wherefore I chose the BBQ Chicken Melt,
Whilst thou, my love, didst opt for Chicken Carbonara.
We didst receive the garlic bread in timely fashion,
And 'twas, indeed, the best part of our meal, I say.
But, lo, our main courses didst take their sweet time,
And when they came, my chicken breast was pink and raw.
I ate a few chips, and, unawares, a half-fillet too,
Ere I didst note its undercookery, alack the day!
No dessert didst we partake, nor didst we tarry long,
For service poor, and prices high, didst make us flee.
The ceiling, too, in disrepair, didst show some growth,
A sorry sight, which didst but add to our dismay.
Oh, how my heart was set on this place, and now,
In bitter disappointment, doth my spirit lay."

"A pox upon this wretched inn, wherein I pay
Sixty gold coins for a chamber, dank and grey.
The bed, with holes of smoke, doth make me frown,
And loud, the housekeepers do shout and play.

My wife, she asked for pillows, one more,
But nay, they say, 'tis on back order, no more.
Oh, woe is me! In this poor place, I dwell,
Where luxury and comfort, do not abide well.

In fair Phoenix, there be better lodgings,
So, traveler, take heed of my warnings.
Flee this flea-bitten den, with all thy speed,
And seek a place, where comfort doth proceed."

"First time in, last time. Not impressed. Waitress clueless about imports. Ordered wings, steak Philly, chicken salad sandwich. Wings lacked sauce, steak Philly subpar. Minced meat on a roll, scant cheese. Chicken salad bland, large chunks. Onion rings, hard as rocks. 35+ years in the business, yet serving mediocrity. Manager too busy schmoozing one guest to acknowledge others. Never again."
"Pulled over at Barros, my usual spot’s on Thunderbird. Big mistake. Rude cashier, sour face, ruined the whole experience. No way I’m comin’ back here."
"Terrible work on my nails. Avoid that place. Smudge remained after they applied three coats. Polished still smeared."

"This joint's a dump. They charged us 180 bucks a night too. Put us in the back, separate building, and made us trudge through what we called Chicken Shit Alley. Our room had two beds, felt like sandpaper sheets. Public restroom-style toilet, no back. Shower didn't drain, couldn't use it. Asked for a cot, never got it. Honestly, terrible."

"Bought a Frenchie pup from Black Mountain Animal Hospital two days back. Took him in for his freebie vet check today. Turns out he's got a respiratory infection and blood in his stool - both since we brought him home. Long drive to the free vet, and I'm worried they'll fudge the fecal analysis results. Gonna take him to my local vet instead. The doc at Black Mountain said it'd void the health warranty, but I ain't too concerned 'bout that. Puppy was way overpriced, but I wanted to get him outta there. Salesgirl was friendly, but the others were just pushin' for sales. They don't even require adoption apps, which is sketchy. Thought sellin' sick pups was illegal in NV."

"Claim Jumper, usually a reliable spot for a good meal, let me down tonight. Ordered my usual, but three minutes later, they called to say they were out of steak and sweet potatoes. Unacceptable, especially for a Landry's affiliate. Won't be ordering from them again anytime soon."

"One star, that's all they deserve. Back for more abuse. God, when will a decent joint open up? Nowhere else to go, so we're stuck here. Good grub, nice patio, rotten service. Servers drop off food at one table, ignore the newcomers next door. Un-freaking-believable."

"Water, that's all we got from our server. Never saw her again. Restaurant wasn't full, but she was too busy for us. Twenty minutes, that's all we waited. Told the manager, he just shrugged and said 'have a good night.' That's it. Won't be back."

"We had a late dinner at Burgr last night. Took us 20 minutes to snag a table. Not too bad. Ordered a shake and some grub. Shake took 15-20 minutes to arrive. I had a burger, hubby had a salad and some shared fries. Food took another 20 minutes. Hubby's salad looked like overcooked noodles. Tasted nasty. My burger was meh. Fries were undercooked and oversalted. Service was lacking, especially when it came to water refills. Manager Benjamin seemed unconcerned. Said we were locals. What does that even mean? Place sucks. There are better burger joints in Vegas."

"Scene: A humble abode, owned by an Afghan and his Turkish bride
Feast: A curious sampling of dishes, new to mine eyes
Aush, a beef and yogurt broth, with mint and garlic, a tad too sharp for mine taste, yet still, a delight
Eggplant, too tart, and lacking the depth of its Indian kin
Naan, homemade, yet dense and chewy, a poor showing indeed
Turkish coffee, a rich and satisfying brew
Service: Friendly and helpful, though wary of mine queries
Act II: A tragic turn, a lunchtime spread, with dishes ill-prepared
Lamb soup, soured by time, a bitter taste that lingered
Kebabs, once tender, now tough and dry, laid out too long, alas
A disappointment, indeed, yet still, a lesson learned."

"Verily, I say unto thee, good sir, that this place doth bustle with activity. The patrons, they do swarm and crowd, and the servers, they do scurry about, their pace doth lag. Alas, the customers, they do behave with discourtesy, their manners, they do lack. Fie upon this hectic scene, I pray for a quieter repast."

"Pray, good sir, let us not tarry here,
For this wretched den doth irk mine eyes.
A plague upon the gambling hall,
Wherein I found myself beset by crawling old men,
Their walking sticks a barrier to my path.
And so, I chose to make my way through rows
Of tables, till a surly pit boss did stay my step.

I came to this foul place but for the parking,
Free from cost, yet paid in crowded chaos.
Never have I set foot near yon slot machines,
But to Cafe Cortez, where prices be too steep
For victuals of poor taste.

Beware, dear friend, the crackhead hustlers,
With CDs to sell and cigs to beg for,
Lurk outside, a scourge to gentle folk,
In this, the pit of vice and woe."
"Hate comin' here for packages. Slowest damn post office'side from downtown."

"Terrible service. Took forever to get our drinks, then a parade of staff came by to take orders. Food arrived 30 minutes later, one dish was wrong, the other burnt. Table next to us, same problem. When it was time to pay, they were short on change. Asked me if I had a buck, I said no, so the waitress had to use her tips to make change. Never going back."

"Fie upon this tailor, a thief of the first order!
I took three shirts to him, and he did charge me nineteen crowns and four pence.
A pox upon his house, and may his scissors dull!
For ne'er again shall I set foot within his door,
And thus, my friends, let this be a lesson to thee:
Check Yelp ere thou dost entrust thy garments to any man,
Lest thou be taken for a fool, and robbed of thy hard-earned coin."

"Hark, good sir, I pray thee, listen well,
For I have tale to tell, of woe and ill.
A visit to my PCP, Susan Schuder, did I pay,
With pains and swellings in my wrist, did I display.
A brace she gave, and xrays did she order,
And promised referral to Steinberg, in haste, did she border.
But lo, the letter, did not arrive in time,
And twice I called, to make an appt, did I entwine.
The man at SMA, did answer my plight,
But with disdain, did he respond, in the morning light.
He said, 'Susan Schuder, an APN, doth she bear,
And referrals, five to seven days, doth it take to appear.'
But why, dear sir, must thou be so curt and rude?
I merely asked, the status of my referral, to intrude.
And though her title, may not be of the highest rank,
Her care and trust, doth she deserve, in this mortal bank.
So heed my words, and change thy ways,
For courtesy and respect, doth always stay."

"Breakfast was a bust. Chilaquiles, cold as a witch's heart. Biscuit and gravy, dry as the Sahara. Underseasoned, flavorless. Never been one for reviews, but this meal warranted an exception. Unoriginal menu, too. Won't be back."

"My bad, I read the damn reviews. Wanted to stay here when it first opened, but it never made the cut. Prime location for a new casino, but the place is dying. Smell's awful, can't even stand to be inside for too long. Timeshare salespeople are pushy and rude, one Asian lady in particular was a real pain. Stayed in Tower II, it was fine, no issues. Room was clean, didn't smell like the casino. No plans to come back, too many better options."

"No tomatoes, no problem. Just keep it clean, no contamination. Onions only, from the back, not the tray. Slow down, listen up, do it right. Don't kill me with your carelessness. Three tries, finally got it right. Coulda saved a lot of trouble if you just listened the first time. Pay attention to allergies, save a life."

"Damn thing. Wanted to set up a registry for the little one. They told me to use the kiosk, so I did. Created a password, but it didn't match. Asked for help and they said there was nothing they could do. Told me to call some hotline. What a pain in the ass. That's why I'm here, for crying out loud!"

I took my ride in, knowing full well what was wrong with her. But these so-called mechanics, they had other ideas. They told me it wasn't the issue I said it was, no sir. According to them, my transmission needed a complete overhaul, and it'd cost me a pretty penny - almost a grand. Now, I ain't no fool, and I knew that wasn't the real problem. But they insisted, saying some nonsense about engine oil leaking from the rear main seal, looking like brand new transmission fluid. Yeah, right. And I'm sure their "clean" area near the transmission pan had nothing to do with it, even though the leak was on the other side of the engine. Seemed fishy to me, like they were trying to take advantage of someone who didn't know better. But I knew my stuff, and I wasn't having it. So I got a second opinion, and sure enough, it was just a simple fix. Bottom line, these guys were trying to rip me off, but I wasn't born yesterday.

"Tonight, I had the misfortune of experiencing the worst customer service of my life. I've been a member for six months, and this was my first time visiting. I brought a friend along, as I was told I could. However, when we arrived, the manager, Brandon, was incredibly rude and condescending. He refused to let my friend enter, despite my membership allowing for a guest. I requested to speak with his manager, Pat, but she wouldn't even bother talking to me. Instead, she sent another manager, who didn't help either. After five minutes of arguing, the police showed up and ordered us to leave. Brandon didn't even have the decency to ask me to leave himself; he just called the cops and had them handle it. I've never had the police called on me before, and Officer Stranger treated me like a criminal, taking my information and escorting me and my friend out. If Brandon had simply asked me to leave, I would have complied. Instead, I'll be canceling my membership and hoping to never encounter such horrible customer service again."

"Taxis, scarce as hens' teeth in this burg. Two-three a.m., bars closin', not a single cab in sight. You'd think they'd want to make a buck, but nope. Called for one, waited thirty minutes, nothing. Called again, promised it was on its way, waited another quarter hour, zilch. Had to walk 1.5 miles back to our digs, tired as hell, one buddy with a bum knee. Screw you, Yellow Cab. Gonna try Green Cab next time."
Awful service. Sat for ten minutes, no greeting. Got up to leave, they waved goodbye.

"MG, usually a solid joint, served up a disaster. Five entrees, all cold. Not just lukewarm, but straight from the fridge. After a round of microwave roulette, we compared which dish was the most flavorless. Disappointment all around. Salad dressing and bread were the only bright spots. Won't be going back."

"Not happy. Frequent user program's a joke. Can't keep track, won't give proof. Screwed my friend twice. Service slow. Two hours for a full set. Don't go. Lost two customers. Couldn't care less. Plenty other salons around."

"Worst customer service joint I've ever been to. Went there a few times when they were still on Dunlap. Always frosty, never a smile. Don't know why. I was friendly, made eye contact, even suggested my husband stop in. Dressed nice too. But they only greeted him, ignored me. Happened three times. Not going back. Sad."

"I always order from this joint for delivery. I get a lot of grub, and it's always satisfying. But every time I ask for curry, they want to know how spicy I want it on a scale of 1-5. I tell 'em 3, but it's always a 5. And it's always late, 10-15 minutes late. They shouldn't give a wait time if they can't hit it. Especially when I'm dropping a bunch of cash and giving a solid tip. But I let it slide and keep ordering. One time, I said 1 out of 5, and it was still hella spicy. It went on for ages... Until today, I'm feeling rough and order some soup and curry. She asks me if I want it spicy, and I tell her no, not even a 1. She says 30-40 minutes, and I'm like, okay. And then it takes an hour! And the curry? It's scorching! I'm fuming about how late they always are, and don't even get me started on their spice scale. It's all the same, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, doesn't matter. They can't keep up."

"Save your dough. MJ's tunes were my jam back in the day, but this show was pure trash. Boring and juvenile, we dipped after 20 minutes. And let me tell you, the seats were crap. Couldn't even see over the guy in front of me."

"O woeful day! O wretched fate!
A service most vile, with naught but hate.
No care they took, nor truth they spoke,
My time they wasted, twice they broke.
A refund I demanded, else I'd say,
'Never again, thou cursed way!'
And thus, I took my business elsewhere,
For never more would I endure their snare."
"Rio, first time. Check-in, 5 o'clock, 20 minutes. Taxi, everyone leaving. Place sucks. Never again. Friends keep me here. Not worth it. Avoid if you're under 35."

"Genghis Khan couldn't breach China's great wall. Arizona's border ain't so secure either. We walked in at 8 pm on a Saturday, place was empty, thought they might be closin'. Two tables out on the patio, that's it. They got a menu, but you mostly just grab a bowl, fill it up with protein and veggies. Bowl's small, but it's the same price, $9.99. Veggie options are lackin', some's frozen, others not well-stocked. Sauces are a letdown, thick and gloopy, like they been sittin' out too long. You get noodles or rice, but they ain't cookin' the rice right, so it's a no-go. They bring the bowl to you, so you best be tippin'. My bowl was a bust, veggies still raw, sauces bland, and the peanut condiment tray was empty. Stickin' to YC's or MuShu, that's my advice."

"We stumbled into this joint by chance, my friend's husband wanted to check out their big-ass beer sign, and it didn't disappoint. But that was about it. 

They had some live tunes blasting, sound system was crap, so it was ear-bleeding loud. Watch yourself, buddy! 

I ordered my go-to, a Long Island, and they botched it bad. Instead of a balance, they dumped in a slug of tequila. Nasty stuff. 

The kid got a cider, and it was meh. 

All in all, this place is for the locals only."
"Place ain't what it used to be. Food's mediocre, atmosphere's lackin'. Waited an hour, still disappointed."

"Hark! A Yelp account I did create,
That I might share my woeful fate,
At this eatery, where I did dine,
And found the service to be quite vile.

The waiters, they were slow and slack,
As people came, they made them wait,
Thirty minutes passed, and still they sat,
At tables empty, all the while.

The victuals, they were tasty, I confess,
But alas! The experience, how dire!
I shall not return, forsooth, I swear,
For such ill treatment, I do not bear."

"Haricot vert, huh? That'll be eight bucks, pal. Not worth it, if you ask me. Sure, it's near the Ritz, but that doesn't mean they can gouge us locals. Service was subpar too - our server was more interested in her own meal than ours. No thanks, mate."

"Terrible service. Drive-thru crew doesn't bother to read the screen or get the order right. Been here three times, and each time they've forgotten something. First and last review. Avoid this joint and go somewhere else."

"We crashed at the Manor for two nights. Needed a cheap room for the weekend. Check-in was a breeze, staff was friendly. Room was old, furniture too. But the king-size bed was new and comfy, pillows were great. Had a Keurig for coffee, better than what our high-rolling friends got. \nBut two hours before check-out, they cut off our water supply. Couldn't flush the toilet, no hot water for showers or washing up. Water came back 10 minutes before we left. \nFirst time in Vegas? Nope, won't be the last. Won't be coming back here either."

"Alas, my dearest husband and mother didst venture forth to fetch us burgers for dinner, since I, in my ninth month of pregnancy, didst not desire to dine out. They didst order our repast and bring it home, but alas, they didst forget one of the orders, and we didst not discover this until they didst return. And lo, it was my order that they didst omit! The milkshake we didst receive was naught but flavored milk, and for the price of four shillings, 'twas unacceptable. My husband doth now journey to rectify the situation, while his own dinner doth grow cold. We didst attempt to call the establishment, but none didst answer, save for a voice that offered to connect us with headquarters. Alas, what good shall that do? I fear we shall not be returning to this Smash Burger."

"Alack! What woeful fate doth befall me now?
In line I stand, to order take-out, I vow,
And watch the second round of football play,
But lo! The hostess doth deny my way.

"Be seated first," she saith, "ere thou canst order."
Fie upon this rule! 'Tis folly, I do swear.
A pox upon this house, that doth refuse
My take-out dreams! Alas, poor Yelp, no stars for thee!"

"Went to this joint last summer after Tryst turned me down. Place was packed, like a can of sardines at 4 AM. Guy tried to cop a feel, I showed him some strength, like a mama bear protecting her cubs. Had a strong, pricey Tokyo Tea. Bartender didn't give me my change, thought I was lying. Crowded, meat market vibe. Good spot to find a hookup, if that's your thing. Not judging, just saying."

This joint's a dump. Bought two tables, bottle service, the whole shebang. Security's a joke, what can I say? Got the boot for cracking a joke about pot. They came up to me, lit my cigarette, and showed me the door. Psst, they let you smoke inside, in case you didn't know. Place is full of gorillas. Save your cash, hit up the Marquee or do something else. Luxor's going downhill fast. Women? Few and far between. Fifty bucks to get in, and it's a sausage fest. Do like me, roll with the ladies. You'll be treated way better. Don't waste your time here, there's better places to be.

"I had the tabbouleh at the food court. Not exactly fresh, but I was hungry and it was my only option. It was more brown than green, like canned spinach. They must've thrown some fresh herbs in there to make it look better. But it still made me sick for two days. Yuk."

"Went to Ventura Grill with my pal for the past two Sundays. Good grub and beer selection, but service? Shit, man. Took 'em 15 minutes just to say hi. Forty-five for a dog and fries? Forget about it. Need a refill? Better order it when your drink's still half full. Two chances, that's all I give 'em. They blew it."
"Closing time, kid-run joint, grub left out, eight suckers walk in, expecting pro service. Next time, I'll hit up Signal Butte."
"Bad pharmacy. Screwed up my scripts too many times. Their response? 'Once it leaves the pharmacy, nothing can be done.' No customer service, just rudeness. I'll drive elsewhere from now on."

"Revs' renovation didn't sit well with me. Food arrived cold, overcooked. Music blasted, like kids playing with the volume. Waitstaff ignored us, until they snatched my plate and handed me the bill. Poor show. Half-priced Mondays won't lure me back."
"Called for reservations, was told to call back. Busy, they said. Yeah, real busy. Treat customers like that, huh? Plenty other places know how to serve 'em right."

"Beach Pizza, closer than my usual spot, Rocco's. Ordered large three-item pie, chicken parm sub, buffalo wings. Whole order, sub-par at best. Wings, terrible. Weird smell, oily, little sauce, ate a few, dumped the rest. Chicken Parm, mushy. Too much sauce and cheese, not enough chicken. Pizza, like Dominos. Cardboard crust, not the worst, but far from good. Prices, not worth it. Half the price, maybe. Friendly staff, fast service. Only bright spot. Won't return."

"Alas, my heart doth yearn for Zoes Kitchen's charm,
But alas, their fare doth leave me in disarm.
I've visited oft, with hope in my heart,
But each dish I've tried, hath left me apart.

Their bread, oh how it doth offend mine taste,
And thus, each sandwich, a disappointment hast.
The quesadilla, a mediocrity, at best,
And chicken roll-ups, soggy and unimpress'd.

The pasta salad, a mess, and potato salad too,
And slaw, a woeful tale, I do declare to you.
Cold rice, a dish most vile, doth make me shun,
Zoes Kitchen, a place, where my heart doth none.

Alas, I do beseech thee, let this be my last,
Visit to Zoes, for my taste buds, do protest.
Their decor, most charming, doth my heart beguile,
But alas, their food, doth leave me in exile."
"Apartment from hell. Been here two months, miserable. Staff's rude, harassed us five times. Entered our place twice without permission. Don't rent here. Look elsewhere."

"Methinks we spent months in yonder class,
With children of two and three years of age,
And worries we didst have, in abundance.
An email to teachers, I didst compose,
Praising their devotion and diligence,
But also expressing our deepest fears.
Forsooth, I had come to hold them dear,
In admiration and respect, sincere.
But alas, no response didst they make,
Nor spoke they to me, forsooth, a word.
The director, in his grand estate,
Didst dismiss our qualms, with naught but scorn,
And bade our son, farewell, to depart.
A bitter pill, it was, to swallow,
Yet, for his good, it was the best of fates.
A play-based school, we found instead,
Where toilet training, food, and drink, they didst provide,
And cheaper, too, with fewer holidays.
I hear the teacher now doth teach,
Older children, a better fit, perchance.
The staff and faculty, pleasant folk,
The grounds, a sight to behold, fair and bright,
The children, full of wonder and glee.
But value, it doth lack, I do declare,
And friendly to working parents, 'tis not, alack.
Love and Logic, for us, doth not suffice.
A culture of pride, it may be,
That doth impede their ability to hear,
And with arrogance, they didst pay the price,
A great child, committed parents, lost,
And a review, most unfavorable, alas."

"We came for breakfast, excited by the rave reviews. But we must've come at the wrong time. Took forever to get drinks and place our order. Finally got our coffee, but no creamer. Asked the busboy for one, but he brought a dirty one with fresh jam smeared on the bottom. Waiter never returned with a clean one. Ordered eggs benedict, but they were a disappointment. Sloppy eggs and tiny asparagus pieces. Thought it was missing something. English muffins were too buttery. Boyfriend didn't finish his crab benedict. Too salty and the muffin ruined it. Maybe we just ordered wrong. Coffee was the highlight of our meal."

"Service was poor. Waited 10-15 minutes for assistance at the pharmacy. The woman who helped me was unpleasant, rude, and unwelcoming. Additionally, there were homeless individuals loitering outside the front door, soliciting money. When I didn't give them any, they cursed at me. It was a disagreeable experience overall."

"Tried this joint based on the rave reviews. Big mistake. Been to plenty of sushi spots around the world - Tokyo, San Fran, NYC, Stockholm, Buenos Aires. Some were great, some were meh. This place? One of the worst. Check the pic I took - fish wasn't fresh. Owner's Vietnamese, should've known better. Service was crap. No thanks, no nothing. They had wifi but it was for their own use only. Other places around here offer free wifi. Ordered a combo and got mostly avocado sushi. With a bottle of water, it was almost $20. Those five-star reviews? Must've been from the owner's buddies. Total letdown."

"I went to this Thai place near my house. It didn't look like a Thai restaurant. More like a smoothie spot. The pad Thai was bad. Not authentic. Didn't have the right spices. My kid got the sweet and sour chicken and it was just okay. The Thai ice coffee and tea were also subpar. Fake Thai food. Never going back."

"Flat tire, towed in. Warranty no good, they said. Too many miles. Spent $2100 on rims and tires. Pressured me to buy Sumitomo, garbage. Went to Discount Tires instead. Horrible experience. Happened 1 1/2 years ago."

"Alas, my friends, I must confess,
This Indian fare doth leave much to be desired.
The flavors, stale and lacking in zest,
Do make me think they were from yester-feast.
A waste of coin, indeed, to dine herein,
For one from India, with taste so keen.
Freshness, alack, doth seem to be in short supply,
And thus, my friends, I do advise thee,
To seek thy curry elsewhere, lest thou be woe,
As I, who didst partake of this sorry repast, do now bemoan."

"Check-in issues, again. Heard of thirty minutes prior, but we were at thirty-five. Computers froze, federal rule. Allegiant doesn't play that game. Stuck in Reno, paid for oversized bag. Couple in front, fifty-one pounds, one pound over. Lady freaked, took out shoes, clothes, stuffed carry-ons. Don't blame her. One pound, really? Customer satisfaction, not their strong suit. Sticking with Southwest, Allegiant."

"Terrible spot for our first meal in Vegas. Overpriced and the staff didn't give a damn. Miguel got pissed we didn't order right away, like we were supposed to be in a hurry. Sushi was as good as what you'd find at a 7-Eleven. Zero stars from me."

"Tardy we arrived, the hour of nine,
A lengthy queue, yet numerous tables shone.
Perplexed, we waited thirty minutes more,
Then departed, on that fateful day of yore.
The date, the eleventh of November, shall be told,
And OpenTable, next time, our aid shall unfold."

"A crummy hotel experience. We paid sixty-two bucks, including tax and resort fee, for one night. Not exactly luxury, but we didn't expect much. We asked for a non-smoking room, but it reeked of cigarettes. Yuck. They upgraded us to a 'King suite,' but it was just a bigger room with a comfy bed. The TV was too far away, and the remote didn't work without us getting up. The room was clean, but old. We sweated like pigs at night, even with the AC on 66. WiFi cost twelve bucks for 24 hours, but the signal was patchy and slow. Couldn't even get a decent shower in the morning. Lukewarm water, that's it. We were eager to leave."

"Daughter got sick from burger at Native New Yorker. Manager gave us free meal for return visit. Went back, husband got sick from wings. Food's been mediocre, service worse. Never been to bar, only restaurant. Wouldn't go back or recommend it."

"O, how the folly of my ways doth now unfold,
In Winder Farms' snare, once more ensnared I stand.
Their fees, they mount, like vultures on the wing,
And watch o'er delivery, as a hawk doth prey.
Their milk, their bread, their produce, all doth fade,
Before the date of expiration, laid to waste.
And in the fine print, a trap doth lie in wait,
Forty deliveries, or a fee of fifty, the cost.
A fool, I am, to fall for such a ploy,
Yet twice, my wit, hath been beguiled, alas.
Now, wiser, I shall be, and flee this snare,
To Trader Joes, or Fresh & Easy, I shall repair.
For there, my milk and bread, I shall find,
And at the farmers' market, fresh produce, I shall bind."
"Employees look like they're going through the motions, hating every second of it. Service is slow, took 15 minutes just for the server to say hello. They could use a little sunshine in their lives."

"Local joint, overpriced drinks, and rude staff. Avoid GVR and hit up South Point Casino on Fridays instead. Cheap drinks, friendly folks, and no BS. Don't bother with their pay phone, though. Got slapped with a $70 bill for a two-minute call. Scam artists, if you ask me."

"Alas, my friends, I must confess, my hopes were high at Rao's, forsooth,
The crowd did swarm, and we didst wait, our hunger didst grow.
The viands didst seem fair, and sweet their scent didst waft,
But alack, our patience wore thin, and discontent didst swiftly come.

For when we sat, our taste buds didst find naught but woe,
The meatballs, dear friends, were bland, and lacking in zest.
The lasagna, too, didst fail to impress, I do declare,
The ladies of the church, their pasta dishes do prepare.

And oh, the peas, onions, and prosciutto, how they didst offend,
Their flavor, dear friends, was naught but tasteless and bland.
How could they thus, my friends, such culinary sin commit?
Alas, my friends, I pray thee, Rao's to avoid, 'tis not worth a single wit.

If thou art seeking in Vegas a meal of rich delight,
To Bellagio's buffet, my friends, do hasten with all speed.
Or FireFly Tapas, on Paradise Road, doth serve a feast,
A foodie, I, my friends, for ten years, and these words I do speak.

Heed my advice, good friends, and spare thy purse the pain,
For Rao's doth offer naught but flavorless fare, and that, my friends, is plain."

"Wanted to hit this spot for a bit, but my visit was a bust. Good stuff: solid beer selection, menu's on point, and online ordering's a plus. Got three tacos and an arepa, food was good, but damn, 45 minutes for tacos? Not worth it, especially when it's supposed to be fast food. Tables were filthy, no one gave a damn about cleanliness. Place has potential, but they need to step up staffing and customer service game. Too many better spots in Charlotte, won't be back."

"Hark! I sit at yonder bar, my friend,
For twenty minutes now, and nary a soul
Hath deigned to greet me with a friendly word,
Or offer me a drink, or even a nod.
The staff, they doth ignore me, it seems,
As if I were but a lowly beggar, unworthy
Of notice or regard. Fie upon this place!
I shall depart, and seek a more hospitable space."

"Skip this joint. It's a dump. Food's not worth the trouble. Had the taco salad - iceberg lettuce, canned olives, dried chicken, and a scoop of guacamole and sour cream. Gag me. Better off grabbing a bag of chips and beef jerky from 711 across the street."

We hit up Rosalita's for some Mexican grub, since we'd never been to the Southwest before. Place was dead empty, except for us and one other table. Service was slow, but the dude was friendly. Food? Brutal. Like it'd been sitting out all day, then tossed in the microwave. Shrimp was rubbery, sauce was gross. Rice was mushy, salad was steamed. Worst Mexican I've ever had. Wife said her tacos were meh, but better than my shrimp. Cheese wasn't authentic, or good.
"Went to lunch, new owners. Horrible. Zero stars."
"Service was a slow-moving train wreck. They sat us down and promptly forgot we existed. Witnessed the same treatment for every poor soul who walked through the door. Food? Subpar, at best."

"Tick, tock. Tick tock. Not movin'. Tick, tock. Drunk, need coffee. Tick, tick, tick. RedCard, donate, wifi. Worth it? Tick. Gotta pee! Tick. Tock. Torture. Tock. Finally, my turn! No croissants? No wifi? Rude. Time's up, waste."

"Went to this joint on Sat Feb. 11th, 2012 with my boyfriend. Place was dead, but every table was reserved. Big guy comes outta the kitchen, I ask him for a spot, and he tells me to sit with some other folks. Didn't wanna sit with them, so I asked for somewhere else. Guy gives me attitude, real snotty like. Told him first come first serve would be a good idea. He didn't like that. Word of mouth, you know? Hurt other businesses I've been to. Shame, 'cause the grub's good and I like to gamble here."

"We stopped by Denny's, starving after a doc appt. Girl at cashier station didn't acknowledge us, busy figuring out split payment. Finally said hi, sat us down, left us waiting 15 min w/o drinks. Walked out, found Farmer Boys a mile away, great meal for half the price."

"Condos? Forget it. These are apartments. Terrible speed bumps, lousy parking, and anyone can move in. Loud, rude folks everywhere. Security? Useless. Gated community, but cars still get broken into or tagged with graffiti. HOA's no help. They even allow HUD, which drags down property values. Stuck in this place, paying too much for an apartment. Not worth it."

"Happy hour at Sonic, that's what I thought. Half price drinks, a good deal. But no, they can't even get that right. Ordered some drinks with Nerds in 'em, thought it'd be a treat. Drive-thru, get halfway home, and I'm like, "Hubby, can I try yours?" He says sure, so I do. Cherry's good, but where's the Nerds? Hubby says he didn't taste any either. Open up our daughter's drink, no Nerds there neither. Not worth goin' back for, just plain disappointin', though not surprised."

"Skip this joint.  My boy had a cravin' for them fried dough balls, you know?  Asked three folks inside if they had 'em, and they all said yeah.  So we sit down, order up some beignets and onion soup.  Waiter comes back, says they ain't got no beignets.  What the hell, right?  And the soup?  Way too salty.  Couldn't even eat it.  Plenty other French spots on the Strip.  Try somewhere else."

Today, we didst venture to yon establishment,
And, alas! the waitress didst greet us with disdain.
A second serving maid, with chips and salsa in hand,
Didst offer us a gift, which we didst gladly accept,
Believing it to be part of the meal's grand plan.

But lo! Our waitress didst demand payment for the treat,
And we didst refuse, for 'twas not our mistake, by Jove!
She asked thrice how we wouldst pay for the feast,
And we didst request, each time, that she separate the cost.
Her eyes didst roll, and her tone didst turn quite sour,
As she didst utter, "Okay then..." with a scowl and a frown.

I wouldst not return to this place, my friends,
For the service was poor, and our thirst didst never end.
We hadst to ask thrice for waters and drinks,
Before the manager didst come to our aid, with a wink.
The food, alack! was quite tasty, I must confess,
But the experience, as a whole, didst leave much to be desired, I do declare!

"Alas, I should not have tarried, for all my previous visits had been woeful. But alack, my craving for fried shrimp didst overcome my senses, and I didst venture forth once more. Fie upon it! Eight silver pieces didst I pay for three flavorless, greasy shrimp, which didst lie heavy upon my stomach. Verily, I didst cast them aside, lest I didst cast up my accounts. And, by the stars, the cashier was a fool, lost in his own musings. 'Tis a wonder he didst not mistake a combo for a number 9, with chicken, perchance? Alas, poor quality doth reign supreme in this establishment."

"Rosati's served up some decent grub, but the service was pure garbage. I called in an order, checked the menu online, and the prices seemed fair. But when I questioned the total, the cashier printed out a new set of prices. I asked her what the hell was going on, and she spouted some nonsense. I told her to match the website prices, no attitude necessary. She just handed me my change and ignored me. Where's the damn manager? If this were my joint, I'd fix the problem, no questions asked. Good food can't make up for piss-poor customer service."

"Tried to eat here tonight, but getting a seat was a pain. Place was packed, as usual. Some idiot comes over and starts talking to the people behind me, puffing on an e-cigarette. Unbelievable. Cheesecake Factory, you're responsible for this crap. Done with you. If I could give zero stars, I would."

"Food here's supposed to be great, but I didn't stick around to find out. Walked in, said hi to the counter jockey, got ignored. Went up to the counter, still nothing. Finally got my order taken, tried to use a coupon, but no dice. Lady behind the counter gave me some major attitude, like I was trying to scam her or something. Told her forget it, I'd take my business elsewhere. No skin off my back."

"Cafe Rio, I hit it at least once a week. Never thought to review it 'cause the grub speaks for itself. But this last time, had a real bad time with the cashier. Line was long, and not to order, just to pay. Maybe they should get some workers who give a damn and ain't too busy gossiping while the line backs up."

In sooth, a gathering of thirteen we didst have,
To celebrate a birthday, and watch some football, by Jove!
But alas, the place we chose, didst leave much to be desired,
For ne'er didst we make it past the entrance, and this rude doorman didst glare.

"Tis Sunday, and 'tis Scottsdale, good sir,
And we were dressed in attire most fitting, I do declare.
But nay, this place doth suck, and better places there be,
In Scottsdale, my friends, do not waste thy money, I pray thee.

"Terrible experience. Paid over forty bucks for an oil change and upgrade car wash. Interior still dirty, side panels untouched. Mechanic tried to upsell me on extra services. Noticed new scratches on car, employee flashing gang signs. Car started leaking fluid after visit. Won't be going back."

"Methinks 'twas not a fortunate eve for me
At Top Shelf, where I oft do revel in glee.
Our server, distracted by a bairn at the bar,
Didst neglect his duties, leaving us quite parched and far
From satisfied, for my victuals were cold and greasy,
Tacos falling apart, a sorry sight, indeed.
At last, the server didst inquire if we needed aught,
And I requested water, my spouse, more tea to quaff.
But alack, the drinks didst take an age to arrive,
My husband's tea, a frozen sea, didst barely survive
The melting ice, which made it hard to sweeten with a drop
Of sweet n low, alas, a bitter draught to quaff and sip.
I shall attempt another visit, ere I make my choice
To seek elsewhere, forsooth, a better culinary voice."

"Tried giving 'em a shot, multiple times, but now I'm certain - never stepping foot in that joint again. Clothes are trash, good for a couple wears, but the staff? Unbearable. Can't even look 'em in the eye. Like they're doing me a favor by breathing. HR must've had a blast hiring this bunch. And don't get me started on that ear-piercing alarm at the register. Twenty bucks? No thanks, Fashion Square's where it's at."
"Took the kids, spent forty bucks, regret every penny. Won't be back. Better buffets in town. Don't recommend."

"Terrible experience. First time, gel manicure was bubbly and cracked. Went back for polish change, Cindy the Mutilator butchered my nails. Soaked fingers in acetone for one second before taking a dremel to them. Cut cuticles and skin on six fingers. Other four were spared. Soaked again in acetone and alcohol. In tears. Six bleeding fingers and still expected to pay full price. Never again. Avoid this place."

"Went to the bar Sat. Night. Took forever to get my drink. Ordered a Long Island. Drink was clear. Told bartender, Ashely, it wasn't right. She took a sip from my glass and said, 'Tastes fine. Not making you a new one.' What. The. F."

"Bought a LocalDine, eager to give it a shot. Showed up on a Friday, only to find out their contract had expired a few days prior. They wouldn't accept my coupon, set to expire in July. Food was subpar, nothing special about our three dishes. A single slice of turkey in a nine-dollar sandwich? Ridiculous. Won't be back."

"Service was top-notch, no complaints there. Food, on the other hand, left much to be desired. Ribs were dry, flavorless. Sides? Fried okra, mac and cheese. Mac and cheese straight from a box. Three-item sampler? Onion straws, fried pickles, burnt ends. Oil puddle underneath. TGIF's ribs put these to shame. Won't be coming back. Service gets a plus one, though."

"In I went, to claim my device, now mended, I pray. The servant, with a scowl, did say, 'Canst thou?' His tone, so rude, did make me frown. Awaiting his return, some twenty-five minutes passed, as he stood idly by, without a care or thought of haste. Alas, poor service, I do declare, ne'er shall I step within this shop again, beware!"

"O, woe betide the day we didst step foot within yon tavern's walls! Forsooth, the servers were as rude as they were hasty, and the man, he would not suffer us to sit at our appointed table until all seven of our number had gathered. And lo, though five of us didst arrive in timely fashion, we were made to wait a full twenty-five minutes ere our draughts didst arrive. Fie upon the fare, for 'twas lacking in flavor, and the servers, they didst not deign to meet our gaze. The tables, too, were placed so close together that we didst fear to stretch forth our limbs lest we knock against our neighbors."

"Food's nothing special. Hibachi's overpriced. Ants crawled off my sister's plate. Waitstaff didn't believe us. Later, more ants appeared. Server wiped table with dishrag, moved on. For $150, expected better service, cleaner atmosphere. Try Ohjah instead. Cleaner, tastier, fresher sushi, better service."

"Hark, good sir! Forsooth, I've been with Sprint these ten years past,
And ne'er have had a 4G phone, with speedy service blessed.
I paid for it each month, but still, their words were naught,
For five long years, they said the towers weren't built, and thus, I caught.
Their speeches, empty, void of truth, mere flimflam, I perceive,
So heed my counsel, friend, and do not be deceived."

"Went to Wahoo's in Orange County, got some bad service. Been there a few times before, always for lunch, but this time it was around 4 pm on a Friday. Service was terrible, rude even. Asked for a menu and had to flag down the bartender to take my order. Manager told me to move because people wanted to play the video gambling machine. Never had that kind of experience at Wahoo's before. Usually, it's all about the drinks and gambling, but this time it was just poor service. Disappointing, really."

"Staff here? Piss poor. No business being here. Makes me damn angry. Think of all the folks out there looking for work. And they hire these snot-nosed kids? Rude as hell too. Just walked away mid-order. Had to holler to get her back. Food? Nothing special. Tasted like something from the microwave. Twenty minutes for a sub and slice? Pathetic. Ashamed to be spending my time and money here. They need to learn some respect."

"Pros: Good location if you're nearby. Cons: Unprofessional, rude staff (three times). Appointments run behind schedule, even in the morning. Place feels like it's from the 60s, people stare at each other in fear when the AC turns on. Without an appointment, I waited over an hour and was told, 'I don't know' when I asked when I'd be seen. In summary, avoid this place unless you want to endure mental abuse, long waits, and potentially getting sick from others in the freezing temperatures. Go to the 'normal' Summerlin Labcorp instead, even if it's a bit further away."

"Hark, what ill fate doth befall my taste buds!
A glazed and chocolate donut, both so stale and woe,
Didst I purchase from Dunkin Donuts, full of dismay.
One bite didst I take, and straight to the bin didst they go.
How strange, that a place of such renown,
Doth keep its wares so stale and old,
As if to taunt my hunger with false delight.
Alas, poor donuts, thrown away in disgust!"

"They don't take kindly to dark skin, or those who don't fit their mold. We waited twenty minutes for a meal that should've taken a few. My friend and I, we won't be going back. Thought we'd moved past such nonsense."
"Wild joint. Overpriced grub, and not worth the dough. Employees dressed up, giving free shots, but the chow? No bueno."

"Methinks 'tis rare for me to take the time,
To pen a missive such as this, yea, verily.
But hear me out, good sirs, and heed my words,
For I have suffered great indignity,
At yonder inn they call "The Paris".

Oh, how the waiters were rude and uncouth,
The valets, too, with nary a smile or youth.
And as for housekeeping, fie upon't!
They left my chamber in disarray, with stains and dirt.
No iPod plug-in, and the bathtub, alas!
Was chipped and cracked, a sorry sight, indeed.

I've stayed at finer inns, in downtown's heart,
Where service was superb, and rooms, a work of art.
But here, alack! They burst into my room,
Whilst I was naked, and with haste, did assume
Their duties, leaving me in disarray.
Fie upon "The Paris", say I, nevermore
Shall I darken thy doors, thou wretched place!
Forsooth, I'll seek a better inn, with grace."

"Bought an $8 Groupon for $16 at Quiznos. Thought it'd be easy for a high school grad to ring it up, right? Wrong. They took off $7.36 pre-tax, then $8 post-tax. Should've been $16 pre-tax, like a coupon. But no. Gypped me out of $1.34 on top of their already high prices. Stay away."
"Food was decent, 7/10. But service? Abysmal. Understaffed joint, no one took our order or offered drinks for 15 minutes. Couple next to us waited even longer. What a damn shame."

"This joint's a real dump. Been here three times, same story each visit. Trash everywhere, building's a wreck. Wait times are ridiculous, especially for a fast food joint. Staff's always stretched thin, looked like they're ready to collapse. Last time I went in, some cook had sores all over his arms. Place is a mess, no leadership, no organization. Surprised it's still open."

"Late one night, we rolled into a joint, hankerin' for some donuts. We ordered through the drive-thru, but when we pulled away, we realized they'd botched the order. No sweat, these things happen. So, we swung back around and asked 'em to swap 'em out. But here's the kicker - they took the donuts we didn't want and put 'em right back on the shelf. Like they were gonna sell 'em to some other poor sap. We had those donuts in our possession for three whole minutes. Lucky for 'em, we ain't the type to go sprinklin' cyanide on our pastries."
"Taxi no-show, twice. Called at 5 am, nobody else needin' a ride. They blew it. Avoid 'em."

"Methinks I scarce can call to mind this course,
Without the scorecard in my hand, 'tis true.
'Tis fair and cheap, and yonder fountain grand,
Doth capture all my thoughts, and oft I speak of it anon.
I shall return, to quench my thirst for golf,
And hope to find my game in better form and shape.

But lo, upon my second visit, I didst find
The course to be most lacking, in challenge and design.
Flat and straight, with nary a tree in sight,
It offered little test, and I didst score with ease.
The round didst take but three hours, and my score
Was in the mid-seventies, a feat most rare.

But alas, good sir, I wouldst not advise
To spend thy coin on Kokopelli, for there be better courses nigh.
Las Sendas, Southern Dunes, Foothills, Clubwest, Ocotillo,
These be the courses that doth please mine eye.

So, as a visitor with scant time to play,
I shall not return to Kokopelli, nay, not even for a paltry sum.
For there be better courses, and my heart doth yearn
To try them all, and find which one doth suit mine game the best."
"Broth too salty, twice now. Waiter blames us, whole group. Baffled. Want what we ordered. Rude service. Lemon Grass better, nicer waiters, cleaner soup."

Two frozen machine margaritas and two shots of Sammy Hagar's tequila, forty-five bucks. Suggested tip on the receipt, twelve dollars. Place smelled like sewage behind the bar. Left a bad taste, won't be back. Flip the station when I hear his song again.

"Three days of waiting, naught but vain,
For technicians who did not show their face.
My internet, finally installed, alack,
With news that wireless would cost a place.

A fee of eleven dollars, monthly, they say,
To rent a router, or else go astray.
The technician, kind and full of grace,
Advised me to buy my own, in its stead.

But lo, when I did call to register,
They told me of another fee, a further burden.
Seven dollars more, each month, they'd take,
To use my own router, and not theirs to make.

Oh, woe is me, with Time Warner plagued,
Their CEO, with foul breath, be nagged.
Their wives, to leave them, for John Mayer's embrace,
A pox upon their house, a woeful, woeful case."

"I avoid this joint like the plague. Prices are through the roof and the selection's not great either. But sometimes you gotta do what you gotta do, like pick up some milk. Last time I was there, they were out of plain pitas. And let me tell you, the staff ain't exactly the epitome of cleanliness. The cashier had a cold and was blowin' her nose left and right, then she starts touchin' all my grub without washin' her hands or usin' that fancy sanitizer stuff. Gross."

"I'd give this joint negative stars if I could. Worst experience with the owner, Eli. Went in for highlights and extensions. Six-plus hours I spent there. Eli jumped around, doing other clients in between. Finally finished, and I couldn't wait to get outta there. Got home, took a closer look, and my highlights were yellow. Asked if he used a toner, and he said no. Didn't offer to fix it or tone it. Had to go to another salon to get it done right. Extensions started falling out within days. Eli said to come back, and he'd fix 'em, but they all fell out again. Had to go to another salon to redo everything. Asked Eli for a refund, and he only offered $100. Threatened to take him to small claims court, and he gave me $150. Wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy."

"This joint's gotta be the worst Corporate Starbucks I've seen. Service is crap, takes 'em forever to bring my joe, and the place is always a mess. Only reason I come back is 'cause it's close to my digs. Now, I work at the Starbucks in Mandalay Bay, next to the House of Blues, and we may not be corporate, but we got the same standards. When I hit up this place, it takes 'em forever to notice me, even when it's dead. They're either chatty as hell or too busy doin' their own thing to care 'bout their job. Order takes ages, and forget about the drive-thru. They ignore my rewards, charge me full price, and act all snotty about it. Buncha slowpokes, if you ask me."
"Terrible show. Seen better from Cirque. Don't know how this exists. Minimal acrobatics, mostly toplessness and lame jokes. Eighty-eight bucks and two hours down the drain."

"Terrible customer service. AMEX flagged a potential fraud alert. Turns out some crooked cabbie charged me $1,200 for a six-block ride. Called to sort it out, but the agent said it was my problem, not theirs. Told me to ring my credit card company. When I said they told me to call them, she just shrugged and said she couldn't help. Don't waste your time with these people."
"Came here often. Not anymore. Rude staff, dirty tables, mediocre grub. Place has gone downhill. Won't be back."
"Place near my house, I wanna like it. But service? Shit, it's worse than a blind man tryin' to find his way outta a dark alley. Can't they find someone who ain't completely useless?"

"Fie upon this wretched inn, where filth doth reign!
A grimy towel, with pubic hairs and paint, they call clean.
The chamber, too, a den of dirt and disarray.
And three eateries, all serving woeful fare.
Thy food, a sorry sight, and service, poor and slow.
A bug, within thy bed, doth crawl and play.
I shall not come again, no, nevermore,
For this place doth stink of woe and sorrow's score."
"Service was good, but the corned beef hash? Terrible. Ruined the whole damn meal. Server was polite, but clueless. Plenty of better options around here."

"Far, far away from this wretched place I'd flee,
Where rogues and scoundrels prey upon the innocent,
A 2007 Cobalt, with eighty thousand miles,
Didst I purchase, thinking 'twould last some while,
But lo, 'tis dead now, and naught but woe,
Hath been my lot since first I drove it home."

"Servings here are near immoral, friend. Share a plate, they'll hit you with a three-dollar fee. Not the worst deal if you're both eying the same sad excuse for a sandwich. Food's quality? Inverse to the portion size, my man. Meat's like cardboard - dry, flavorless, and slapped between two slices of bread. Chicken soup? Forget about it. Yellow liquid with a hint of powdered crap. Sodium's the main flavor. This place is packed, but hey, it's Vegas. Anything goes."

"Afternoon turned sour at this joint. Wife, in-laws, and I stopped by for a bite. Not packed, but still subpar service. Ordered soup, got a cup without crackers. Had to chase down server to fix it. Chicken sandwich arrived with cold, soggy fries. Sourdough bread? Ice cold. Gave 'em hell, didn't take their crap, and won't be back. Denny's looks good compared to this dump. Save your dough, skip this place."
"Four hundred bucks for a little cart of grub? Ridiculous. Vitamins, full price. Buy online, save half. That's the ticket."

"Slow service. Took 25 minutes for three basic tacos. Tacos were average. Mine were too salty, but I didn't bother complaining given the wait and lack of customer attention. Menu's limited and you gotta pay extra for cheese or salsa. Maybe others had a better experience with the burritos, but that's not what I had. No indoor seating. Outdoor seating's a joke - plastic picnic tables that'll fry you in the sun. Inside, you're faced with a server behind a grill and a handful of plastic chairs to wait in. Feels like a western jailhouse, minus the food."

"Upon request of a fellow yelper, I shall now expound,
Our experience at this eatery, so hear me out, my friend.
Asked for a table, three plus one high chair, we did find,
Hostess, in jest, said nay, and I, in laughter, did bind.
A menu, I then requested, and again, she did say,
No, with no mirth, nor cheer, her visage did display.
Perhaps 'twas her attempt at humor, but alack,
It lost its luster, ere the second time, I did attack.

Fifty dollars, a Caesar salad, spinach chicken, a dish,
Kids' chicken tender meal, with browning apples, a wish.
And a burrito, pollo poblano, failed, alas, it did,
Our flight, we had to catch, and thus, we could not tarry.

The service, poor, and worse, the burrito, cold and wet,
Tenders, rubberized, our waitress, a scowl, did not forget.
Menus, untouched, and smiles, none, did we receive,
Airport or not, such treatment, we should not conceive.
I shall, ere long, write to them, and express my discontent,
For a meal, so poor, and service, with such negligence, I cannot consent."

"Worst of Yelp Awards? This place takes the cake. Logistics for the National Championship game? Disaster. Felt like the first event they ever held. Problems galore. Concessions? None outside. Inside, they ran out of hot dogs, cups, and beer before halftime. Parking lot security? Yellers. Four gates for 70+ thousand fans? Not enough. Jumbotrons? Tiny. Stadium announcer? Barely audible. Replays? Forget it. Escalators? Fit one person at a time. This stadium doesn't deserve a BCS game. Hope it gets yanked."

"Sitting here, waiting for my grub, and I gotta say, it ain't looking good. They gave us some free chips and salsa, but that don't mean squat if they can't deliver the goods. Two other tables got their food before me, and that's just plain wrong. This Chili's joint ain't doing so hot, let me tell ya. You might wanna steer clear, 'cause if you're hungry, you'll be waiting a while."

"O, woeful day! O, wretched fate!
A service most vile, a plight most great.
No answer to our calls, no heed did they pay,
And thus, we suffered, left to dismay.

A pickup, promised, but ne'er did come,
And so, we waited, left to bemoan.
This office, a blight, a curse, a shame,
Should be shut down, its name in vain.

Alas, poor souls, who here do seek,
Aid or solace, find naught but bleak.
Their pleas, ignored, their hopes, dashed,
In this dark place, no light doth break."
"Charged me two quid for wifi. Place that charges for bread, water, and wifi gets a bad review. Food's average, prices are too. Service is meh. Used to be great five years back. What happened?"

"Avis, worst. High prices, no give on competitor's lower rates. Booked ahead, chose pay now, cheaper. Found better deal with Alamo, half the cost. Cancelled, still charged $25. Should've picked pay later, no charge. Customer service? Don't care. Never again, avoid Avis."

"Convenience led me here twice before. Both visits, disappointment followed. Won't be back. Kids run the show, no manager in sight. Orders forgotten, little concern for quality. Investment gone to waste. Avoid it if you can."
"Cleaners lost a string on my shirt. Disappointed. Time for a new place."

"This joint? Zero stars, easy. First time, I damn near choked on a plastic shard in my salad. Barkeep drops it on the floor like it's nothing. Couple months later, I'm hungry and stupid, so I give 'em another shot. Barkeep's rude, slow, and can't mix a drink to save his life. Friend gets their food, but I'm still waiting after 20 minutes. Ask the bartender, nice as can be, where my pizza's at, and he shrugs and walks off. Ask to see a manager, and they tell me he's too busy. Finally get my pizza, an hour and a half later. Kitchen manager shows up, does his job, talks to me. But that other guy, working New Year's Eve? He don't deserve the job, should be fired."

"Josh was our pool guy. Didn't say much, but when he did, it was always some long-winded excuse. Pool turned green, water tested at Leslie's, zero chlorine. Confronted him, he bailed on us, didn't even tell us for two months. Disappointing, poorly run business."

"TAO Beach? Overrated. Girls get in free, guys pay $20. I was pumped at first, the music outside was tight. Top 40 and electropop, my jam. But you don't need to be inside to hear it, it's loud af. The regular Venetian pool next door is bigger and better. TAO Beach is tiny. unless you've got a cabana, it's not worth it. My friends and I were in and out. The only reason to go back is for the novelty bracelet, sadly. Same deal with TAO the club, small, crowded, and overhyped. First-timers might dig it, but it's meh. Hot girls in the tubs though. That's it."

"This joint's a dump. Don't believe the 'discounted' hype. I checked out Michael Kors, and they wanted $350 for a watch. Same watch at Fashion Square costs $275. Not exactly a bargain. Charlotte Russe had a buy-one-get-one deal for $12.50. Non-outlet store charges $15.50. H&M prices were the same as the one in Scottsdale. Never been a fan of outlet malls, but this one takes the cake for being the real deal worst."
"Place drains, kid. Long lines, poor service. Stand in one line to get fabric cut, another to check out. Damn kids' art project."

"O, woeful day! Our visit to this place doth bring forth naught but vexation and delay. The server, sloth-like in his pace, didst forget our request, and with a shrug, didst leave us in dismay. An hour passed, and still our meal didst not arrive, nor didst anyone inform us of its status. Alas, poor service doth mar this establishment's reputation, and we, in sorrow, do depart."

"I Yelp, my friends, for sport and guide,
To share my thoughts and help others decide,
Where they shall spend their hard-earned pay,
And dine with joy, or flee away.

My aim, dear friends, is not to gain,
Free food or favors, nor to feign,
A review false, or full of spite,
But to share truth, and bring to light.

Now, at Zoe's, a tale unfold,
Of health risks, and a manager bold,
Who sought my number, and did call,
To hear my tale, and offer apology.

He asked my address, a gift to send,
A kind gesture, though quite unneeded,
I gave it, thinking naught but good,
But lo! Two weeks pass, and naught arrives,

I message the customer, a fair maid,
To ask of the gift card, delayed,
And she, in turn, doth reply,
With words of wonder, and dismay.

Poor management, alas, doth reign,
At Zoe's, where once I did sustain,
A hope, now lost, that they would mend,
Their ways, and be a place to amend."
"Regulars ain't too welcoming if you ain't a Packers fan. But we got great service from our waitress. Place is perfect for them Cheeseheads. Wings were decent, too."
"Tried this joint again. Bad move. Salad was a mess - soggy brown lettuce, runny guac. Not worth the jacked-up price. Neighboring spots like Gadzooks and Chipotle serve better grub for cheaper."
"Crappy place. Saw it on Man vs Food, thought it'd be good. But no, they give us puny, stale crawfish. Not worth it. Don't waste your money, go to Wynn buffet instead."

"Upon this Labor Day of 2014, we chanced upon this eatery, with hopes of savoring their victuals. And lo, didst we find at least twenty tables unoccupied, yea, even more. Yet, the hostess didst inform us that there was a delay of fifteen minutes, and that we must needs wait. Now, I didst query, 'Why doth thou keep us waiting, when there be so many empty tables?' To which she didst reply, 'Fear not, good sir, for we have a few large companies, and thus, we do not seat.'\n

Methinks, I have partaken of their fare before, and found it to be but common, akin to that of any other diner. Therefore, it doth seem strange that they wouldst not strive to fill those vacant seats, in a market so competitive. Alas, my friends, I shall not return, for there be better choices to spend mine hours in vain."
"Pizza joint with the gang from work. Pizza? Forget it. Garlic bread, straight from the supermarket. No way I'm comin' back."

"I rolled into Vegas the week before Turkey Day, and the town was dead. Quiet, empty, and just the way I liked it. Pros: My room was silent as a tomb. Didn't hear a peep from anyone the whole time. Location was perfect - off the strip, just how I like it. Decor was top-notch, too. Reason I picked the place. Cozy, no casino, no shows, no late-night bars. Just peace and quiet. Free parking, free WiFi. Cons: The kids running the front desk need a crash course in manners and customer service. Unhelpful little punks. Booked through Priceline, paid in full months ago. Confirmed my reservation, too. Get there after a long drive, and they tell me I owe $75 a night for "incidentals." Never seen a fee that high at a hotel. Didn't have an extra $150 on me. Finally convinced them to charge me $75 for the first night and settle up the rest in the morning. Not exactly the best business practice. Stay somewhere else. Staff's got some 'tude and the place smells like a scam."

"Alas, my friends, I must confess,
This dish they call Pad Thai, doth not impress.
The flavors, lacking in zest and flair,
Did leave mine taste buds in disrepair.

And, oh, the service! None did attend,
To our needs, or offer any amend.
I searched, in vain, for someone kind,
To bring the bill, and end this woeful find.

Nay, nevermore shall I return,
To this place, where culinary skills do burn.
For in this realm of gastronomic art,
They know not how to win a diner's heart."
"Went to Jamba Juice, eyeing their showcased drink. That's what I wanted, but they were lacking two crucial elements. Never going back."

"Windshield washer fluid. What's in it? Swamp water? Outhouse juice? Don't know, don't care. It's rank. Hubby gets a drop on his shoe, tries to wipe it off with baby wipes. No good. Skunk stench still there. Can't take it. Make him turn around, go to grocery store bathroom to wash shoe. Yuck. Shoes are trash now."

"Decent pizza, but delivery's a bust. Ordered online at 6:50, estimated delivery 7:50. Two miles away, should be quick. Called at 8, told order was on its way. Called again at 8:20, manager was delivering. 8:50, still no pizza. Turns out, order was never pulled. Bad process, bad employees, lied twice. Stick to dine-in or pickup. Epic fail."

"Apple Store? More like Apple Disaster. Especially if you're a Yank. Foreigners flock here, and that's part of the problem. Employees don't give a damn. You walk in, nobody greets you. They know they'll make sales no matter what, so why bother? Tourists'll buy anything, and that's all that matters to them."

"Tropicana, twice. First visit, decent. Second, garbage. Lady at burrito station, trash talkin' Spanish, callin' us slow, stupid. Over a tossed tortilla? Please. Ordered two burritos, switched to carne asada fries. She kept jabberin', didn't know I understood. Everyone laughin', ordered two tacos instead - seso, cabeza. Guy says, 'pay and ill get it.' Tacos reeked, tasted rotten. Didn't touch 'em. Veronica, the culprit. Thrown tortilla, intentional food poisoning? Never comin' back. Other location? Nope."

"This place is a real stinker, kid. Worst store I've ever set foot in. Got some joker named Jason workin' there, and he's about as friendly as a rabid dog. But hey, there's this one salesperson, don't know her name, but she's got her head screwed on straight. She's the only one in the joint who knows what she's doin', and she's got a good attitude. Shame about the rest of 'em, though."
"No flour chips, no point. Just another Mex place. Bummer."

"Foul victuals, vile and loathsome fare,
Since nineteen hundred and ninety-five,
No taste, no zest, no savour, none to spare,
Service poor, filet mignon, a cardboard plight.
Disappointment doth my spirit grieve,
Nevermore shall I that place perceive."

"Get outta here! First one in at 7:30 am for tires and oil change. Shady service writer tries to sell me his own tires from his personal ride. Shoulda known better. Waited two hours, still not done. Four hours pass, I'm fumin'. They offer me a ride home, finally finish the job eight hours later. Deliver my car to my doorstep, I thank 'em and tip 'em. Two months later, trade my car in, dealership says oil dip stick handle broke off completely. Those bastards at Goodyear knew exactly what they were doin'. Who knows what else they did to my ride? Spreadin' the word, don't wanna see this happen to anyone else. Karma's a bitch."

"I said to myself, 'This'll be the last time I come here.' But, of course, I went back. And, of course, the prices were still too damn high. But what really got me was the cashier, Scott. He had this bored look on his face, like he'd rather be anywhere else. And he couldn't even count my change right. Just dumped all the coins and bills into my hand like it was a bother. Unprofessional, that's what it was. Embarrassing for the store, really."

I've been to this joint plenty of times since it's near my work and easy to swing by during lunch. But, I'm done with it now. It's just not worth the hassle. 

First off, you gotta wait and there's nowhere to sit or stand. It's like a can of sardines in there. Then, the nail techs try to sell you on all sorts of extras when you're just trying to get a simple pedi. 

Last time I went, my pinky toe was mangled and two weeks later, my nails started turning yellow. I wasn't basking in the sun or anything, so it must've been their polish. Once I got it removed elsewhere, my nails were A-okay. 

Oh, and my friend got a gel manicure there and it chipped within minutes of walking out the door. 

I'm done giving this place chances.

"Place was dead slow. Ordered takeout 25 minutes before, still waited 15 more. Wednesday night, not busy. Walked in, straight to counter. Three people there - two old dudes and a lady at the register. They ignored me like I was a ghost. Felt like an eternity, just waiting for my popcorn to finish.

Food? Forget about it. Six garlic knots, small as quarters, cost $2.50. Average quality at best. Pizza? Showed it to me when I picked it up. Looked like a frozen pizza. No variation in the crust, no bubbles, no color difference. Taste? Crust was terrible, sauce barely existed, cheese and toppings skimpy.

Feel robbed. Very disappointed. Won't be back. Drive by on my way home, won't give 'em another dime."

"Alas, poor souls, I'd give them naught but woe,
For service dire and glasses that do show
Less than perfection, marred by cracks so fine,
A year passed, and now my vision doth decline.

The doctor's visit, swift and painless it was,
Yet the bill, oh how it did my wallet squeeze!
For things I did not need, they did demand,
And thus, my purse did suffer such a wound.

Transition lenses, once fine, now cracked and old,
No certificate of authenticity to hold,
The warranty, two years, by Transitions Optical,
But alas, no proof didst they provide, so pitiful.

My advice, dear friends, avoid this place,
For service poor and lenses of disgrace,
Seek elsewhere, where customer care doth reign,
And ensure that thy glasses be without a stain."

Hark, what woeful tale of sushi doth unfold!
A hostess rude, and toilets broken bold,
Didst mar my visit, and my son, a lad of ten,
Was charged as adult, though but a child in mien.
The staff didst not disclose the age, nor try
To right the wrong, but rather didst deny.
And thus, with gratuity of eighteen percent,
We didst depart, in anger and discontent.
I pray, dear friends, avoid this place, forsooth,
Lest ye be met with similar disgrace and woe.
"Wings and tenders combo, despite the bad reviews. Gross. Cardboard wings, dirty sock tenders. Drenched in oil. Cholesterol OD. Fries, just okay. Disgusting."

"A plague upon this wretched Jiffy Lube,
The slowest I have e'er encountered, by my troth!
I thought to be in and out in mere minutes,
But lo, an hour did pass, and still I waited,
In vain, for my turn to come at last.
A pox upon their sluggish service, say I!"

"Alack, what woeful fate didst befall me here!
This place, with praise on Yelp so fair and bright,
Didst lure me in, with hopes of joy and cheer,
But lo, the truth didst prove most dire and bleak.

The decor, a void of style and grace,
Didst strike me dumb, with wonder and dismay.
And thus, my meal, a sorry sight to see,
Didst fail to please, as didst my love's decree.

I say, dear friends, avoid this place,
For naught but woe and sorrow doth it bring.
No charm, no wit, no taste, doth it embrace,
But only disappointment, and a heavy heart that doth cling."

"We hit up the San Diego joint and dug it big time. But the Las Vegas spot? Not so much. It was a snooze fest. Staff was meh. You'd think they'd bring the energy in Vegas, but nope. We sat for like 20 minutes before anyone bothered us. Only bright spot was the older gent who served us. He was cool. Rest of the place? Zzzz. Food wasn't even the same. What a bummer!"

"Lunch break done. Food and drink, good stuff. Service, nice. But when it came time to pay, no one seemed too eager. I left the cash on the table and split. Missed the bus, had to wait another 20 minutes. Crap."

"Walked in, thought I was in for a good time. But no, big letdown. They hit me with unsanitized tools, charged me for glitter I didn't want, and my gel polish chipped by the next morning. Sixty bucks for a gel mani and reg pedi that didn't last a day. Friendly, sure, but that don't cut it."

"Bartender, bald and rude. Spoke to manager, got apology and free beer. Hope bartender improves people skills. Place wasn't busy, hour after Dbacks game. Didn't eat, heard good things about food. Baldy Bartender ruined vibe. Like that they have tvs. No way I'd ask him to change station, lol."

"Craftsteak was booked solid, so I settled for Delmonico. Service was good, but not warm and fuzzy. I like my servers like I like my steak - juicy and tender. The rib eye? Disappointing. Not much marbling, tough as shoe leather. My taste buds prefer a smooth ride, not a chewy mess. Surrounded by better options in Sin City, I won't be back."

"Methinks 'twas one of the pricier spreads I chanced upon in fair Las Vegas, a twenty-one dollar feast on Monday eve, and verily, 'twas not worth the cost. Nay, merely a short stroll down the lane, at the Four Queens, didst we partake of a delectable repast for but nine silver pieces."

"Food? Yeah, there's a lot of it. But let me tell you, I wasn't exactly blown away. It's alright, I guess. Just don't expect anything too special. Kinda feels like Olive Garden on steroids, you know?"

"TK's got some balls callin' himself the All-American, but I reckon he's just full of hot air. Went to see Rev.
