"First time having pho, can't say it's great. Second time, tried the cheesesteak at Asian Invasion, $9 for a sandwich on a crappy roll. Not impressed. Sister offers me her banh mi, too salty and same bad roll. Sriracha helps, but not worth the price."

"Hark! What's this? A feast most wondrous fair,
A Sunday brunch, with victuals rare.
Bacon doth sizzle, funnel cakes doth fry,
The rest, alas! Doth seem to lie.

Frozen from Sam's club, a tale of woe,
Doth all else seem, of quality low.
But still, we doth indulge, with glee,
In this repast, of dubious decree."

"Methinks 'twas folly for this establishment to spurn its guests with such haste and disregard. Forsooth, upon mine own person, I have witnessed two visits of varying fortunes. The first, sans reservation, found us at the bar, waiting, waiting, waiting, until a table didst open. And verily, the victuals and ambiance didst please mine senses. Fast forward to this eve, with reservation in hand, we didst anticipate a merry celebration. Alack, our plans were foiled, for at 7:09, we were bid to vacate, the table being "spoken for". Fie upon such practices, unbecoming and rude! And lo, the feast itself, a curious mix. My tenderloin tips, o'er salted, yet still palatable. The key lime pie, a sweet delight. My fellows, with prime rib and shrimp, didst declare the latter scampi-like, the former, middling. In sooth, I am confounded by this Beef and Bottle's conduct, and vow, ne'er shall I darken their door again. Mayhap, too, the meal didst disagree with me, yet, methinks 'twas their fault, for straightway, post-haste departure, my stomach didst churn and protest. Farewell, Beef and Bottle, thy name doth ring false, forsooth!"

"My dearest friends, let it be known,
That Chez ma grosse truie cherie, was not my first choice,
In Montreal's culinary scene, there were other places,
That I had wished to visit, with greater haste.

But alas, with a group of five,
Reservations on a busy night, were hard to come by,
And so we found ourselves, at this place,
With communal tables, and a family-style embrace.

The service, I must say, was quite divine,
Attentive and friendly, they made us feel fine,
But oh, the food, it did not quite match,
The excellence of the service, alas, it did not dispatch.

We shared some oysters, $15 they cost,
Apple ice cider vinegar, from Vergers de la Colline, at least,
They were not bad, but I have had better, I confess,
In other places, where the oysters did impress.

The Chef Choice Seared Foie Gras, oh how grand,
$23 it cost, but worth every penny, in this land,
The sourness of the fresh grapes, did complement,
The fattiness of the foie gras, oh what a delight,
I claimed it all for myself, no sharing, I did insist.

The Whole Hog, $32 per person, a platter so fine,
Baby back ribs, smoked grilled pork chop, braised shanks, braising juices, and parmesan cheese French fries, oh what a feast,
But alas, the meat, it did not taste so sweet,
Bland and dry, it was, oh what a disappointment,
The shank, it was tender, and moist, I must confess,
The roasted vegetables, they were a delight,
But overall, the dish, it did not meet my expectations,

Dieu du Ciel, a local beer, did make the experience more pleasant,
But alas, I fear, I shall not return,
Unless, that foie gras, I can have, all for myself,
Then, perhaps, my friends, I shall revisit this place,
And savor every bite, with joy and grace."
"Food, good. Maggie, waitress, no sense. Owner, spoke with. Cleared up, things. Back, won't go."

People packed the place on a Thursday night. We snagged a spot at the bar to avoid the wait. Menu prices? Outrageous. A $50 gift card saved the day.

We wanted to share something with our drinks. Gluten-free options? The waitress couldn't guarantee anything. I mowed down the free bread and butter. Then, we went for dessert. Ice cream sundae for him; lemoncello raspberry cheesecake for me. The waitress recommended it. Not impressed. I ate a few bites, not wanting to waste the calories.

Three cocktails and two slices of dessert set us back $45. The free bread? Best part of the meal. Service? Subpar.

"Hark! This eatery doth reek of franchise, a chain of restaurants wide and far.  The staff doth try to feign enthusiasm, but 'tis a falsehood, a sham.  

Yet, verily, the burgers be good, a meal most satisfying.  Two patties doth make the standard burger, while the smaller version hath but one.  The fries, fresh-cut and crispy, doth delight, perhaps the best in Tempe.  

Mayhap we shall return, but unlikely shall we go out of our way."

"The chambers, fair and neat, didst provide us comfort and rest. 

But lo, the family above, their noise didst pierce the night, 

Their footsteps, chairs, and voices, didst make our sleep take flight. 

In Lily's building, we didst reside, behind the office, alas, 

Parking, a woeful tale, no space didst there be, 

For our conveyance, we didst abandon, on the curb, with haste, 

And circle round, in hope, a spot to find, at last. 

The WiFi, a costly affair, forty pieces of silver, 

For one device, a week, a price most dire, 

Whilst other hotels, free WiFi didst proffer, 

A strange contrast, indeed, and cause for discontent. 

At check-in, a guest of mine, didst receive a form, 

To attend a timeshare meeting, a request most norm, 

But when he said he might not go, the lady didst reply, 

With rudeness and a scornful tone, 'twas quite surprising, 

She tore the paper, and bid him farewell, with a sneer. 

Welcome to Vegas, where manners are not always clear."

"Wife goes there often, but I never join her. Place gets five stars for coffee, but the hipster chick at the counter's got an attitude problem. I ain't spending my cash where they treat folks like me disrespectfully."

"Verily, we've visited this place thrice,
And each time, the service hath been amiss.
The view, indeed, doth please mine eyes,
But alas, the poor service doth mar our bliss.
Thus, we shall not return, forsooth,
For we seek a place where service meets our needs,
And with a heavy heart, we bid this spot adieu."

We dined at Rao's last week, anticipating a legendary experience. The joint itself is fun, decked out in old-timey Italian decor with celeb photos on the walls. Service was top-notch, attentive and professional. Food was good, but not great. Seemed like the kitchen played it too safe, serving up ample portions of slightly above-average entrees. My veal dish was solid, but didn't live up to the hype. Rao's has potential, with a fun setting, great servers, and decent grub. They just need to step up their game in the kitchen. A little tweak in prep would go a long way. Hope they take note, 'cause it's a fun spot with good people.
"Hot dogs, good. Toppings, plenty. Pricey? Yeah. Poutine, heard great things from my Canuck buddies. Disappointed? A bit. Quebec, next time."

"Hark! My greatest vexation with this aerodrome,
Is that each time, one must board a tram, I do declare.
Why, pray tell, doth San Francisco's airport not require,
This tedious transport, and save us all some time to spare?

The public address system, by gate D1, didst blast,
A volume most excessive, and quite distasteful, I must say.
Did they not hear the anguish of the passengers' cries?
Or notice how we all did cover our ears, in dismay?

And furthermore, a query of the taxi fare doth rise,
Why doth the cost to reach the hotel, exceed the price,
To journey to the airport, by a mere $10, I do surmise?
Is it not nigh the same distance, and therefore, quite unfair?"

Yesterday, I visited this establishment and was disappointed. Our server was friendly, but the food was subpar. I ordered the lunch special with pizza and tomato basil soup, while my cousin got a beer. However, the beer took an eternity to arrive, and when it did, it was lackluster. The pizza was also unimpressive, with old and dry cheese. The saving grace was the delicious tomato basil soup, which my 3-year-old and I mostly devoured. Unfortunately, the rest of the meal was forgettable, and I wouldn't recommend this Yard House Restaurant.

"This joint still open? No kiddin'? I'm lost. I mean, like, in business? Makin' dough? Hours of ops? Manager? Employees? Nah, can't be. Not with all this fancy shit. Air's a smoker's paradise, Earth's got some weird alien vibes, Fire's burnin' my eardrums, and Water's where you go to spend big bucks on drinks that'll leave you dry. Don't get it. How can these rich folk afford this place? Must be nice. Two stars for the cash they sunk into this dump. And that VIP elevator? Real classy. Retarded classy, that is."

"Forty-five minutes of waiting, instead of the promised twenty, to be seated on the terrace, the hall being too loud, 'twas a foul beginning. "The best pizzas in Montreal," indeed, it was worth the wait. But alas, the chef's pizza had no interest, nor did my friend's pasta, drowned in a tasteless, greasy sauce... an overpriced menu convinced me to give but two stars, the only pleasure being the terrace, agreeable. In brief, an address to avoid, for those who love Italian cuisine even a little."

"Two stars, that's all I can give 'em. Overpriced and unimpressive. I know my Korean BBQ, and this place don't cut it. Thirty bucks for a small serving? No way, Jose. I went for the dolsot bimbimbap instead. Most expensive I've ever had. Nothing special here. Two stars, that's being generous. The grub was decent, I'll give 'em that. But the service? Friendly enough, I guess. Won't be going back."

"Ah, fairest patrons of this humble abode,
Two sorts of folk doth grace its halls, 'tis true,
The elderly, with wisdom's weight upon their brow,
And those with passes free, as fortune doth allow.

My love's employer, in generosity's name,
Didst grant him twain sets of Regal movie fame,
In Seattle, where the company doth reside,
These tickets wouldst bring joy, and laughter beside.

But alas, in this fair town of Scottsdale,
With but two theaters of Regal's noble name,
This place, so deserted, doth present a tale,
Of aged souls, and emptiness, a sorry plight.

The concessions, manned by one lone soul,
With name tag bearing both his first and goal,
Didst seem a mite strange, in truth, to me,
Yet still, we stayed, our passes being free.

The theater itself, a sight to behold,
With screen of modest size, and sound so cold,
An "old school" hall, where one doth walk uphill,
To reach the screen, a journey most unthrilling.

Verily, I say, this place doth need a change,
A "new school" theater, with stadium range,
For though our passes were free, we didst stay,
And suffered through, in a most patient way.

So, to the Northsight location, we shall stray,
To use the remaining tickets, come what may,
For though this place doth lack in charm and grace,
Perhaps the other shall bring a smile to our face."

"This place doth not deserve three stars, nay, 'tis but a two.
The chambers reek of mold and mildew, the linens be not clean,
And all about doth seem worn down, like a once-proud queen.
In days of yore, perchance, it was a place of renown,
But now, alas, 'tis naught but a faded crown.

The beds, they be lumpy, and the sheets, of dubious cleanliness,
Did make me search for bed bugs, though none were seen,
Yet in the tub, a tiny creature didst make its presence known.

But, lo, the Speakman shower heads, they doth bring joy,
With water pressure strong and hot, a wondrous employ.
Still, I shall not return, for this place doth not befit
A man of stature, nor a lady of great wit."

"We returned to this side of town, eager for an excuse to come back. But, damn it, we were let down. Zucchini fingers were limp, bending in half when picked up. And they don't even serve 'em with tatziki sauce no more, charging extra for a tiny container. Like getting charged for ketchup at a diner. Zucchini needed salt, bad. My beef and lamb gyro was just okay, a bit dry. Hubby's Oscar burger, with pastrami, was also dry. The salad that came with it was drenched in dressing. Too much. Won't be coming back. Better Greek food at Stephanos, closer to home anyways."

"Hark! If thou desirest a draught ere spending three hundred crowns in the contraptions, speak up, good sir! 'Tis a feat of great difficulty, I doth assure thee, and nigh impossible after the tenth hour of the night, though the tavern be empty. And when thy drink doth arrive, pray, order a double portion, lest thy cup runneth dry too soon. Alas, the only praise I can offer this establishment is for their "Rooster" salad, a dish most delectable, I do confess. But, alack! The regular patrons, a gruff and grim lot, do not partake of such sustenance, it seemeth. Nay, they appear to be folk who hath taken a brief respite from their arduous labors, scrubbing the grout with furious zeal, and now, with jaws a-clench, do venture forth into the public eye. Methinks 'tis a curious sight, and mirth doth fill my heart."

"O, wouldst thou dine upon the winged pests?
A plague upon the restaurant's feast!
Forsooth, we sought to sate our hunger's might,
But lo, the flies did swarm and take flight.
Their buzzing din did mar our mirth and cheer,
And left us vexed, with naught to fear.
So heed my words, good sir, and be aware,
Lest thou, like us, dost suffer their despair."

"Disappointment stung like a slap in the face. Thought it was a sure thing, but nope. Waited long time for grub, then it was just meh. Rather shell out more clams for something truly delicious and don't make me wait an eternity."

"Skeptical of this joint, I was. And rightly so. Great for a night out with the lads, watching the game. Not much else to say, as it's not a place for chatting. Ordered a beer and some fried fish and chips. Soggy, but that's how it comes. Greasy fries, fish on top, a hot mess. Tasteless, too. Pub atmosphere, live music, rowdy fans, loud music. Good service, but splitting checks, a challenge. Enjoy."
"Went for lunch, expecting a spread. Got a few dishes, honey chicken stuck like glue. Haven't been back."

"Hark! All the reviews didst pique my curiosity,
'Twas why not give it a try, thou?
Wow, on a Sunday night, 'twas packed, I say,
With a twenty-minute wait, by th' Lord above!

Knowing well the spicy mudbugs, having lived
In Houston seven years, I didst crave,
The crawfish, they were good, not soggy, I say,
Mildly spiced, to mine own taste, didst play.

Alas, stone and blue crab, they didst lack,
Leaving only king legs and snow crab, in the stack,
I chose the tiny snow crabs, my friend, the shrimp platter,
Both came with mostly fries, alas, what a matter!

This place, in South Texas or the bayou land,
Wouldst die a quick death, at their command,
Pros: Fast came the food, Miller Lite, so cold,
Cons: Limited items, that night, so bold,
Beer and wine, they didst serve, but by the bottle,
Atmosphere, a zero, packed in like sardines, no doubt,
Waitress, frazzled, her first night, perchance,
Lemons, I had to ask for, good heavens!"

"Foul victuals, vile sweets doth this place proffer,
All fair and bright, yet naught but woe doth render.
Pastas, noodles, o'ercooked and o'ersauced they be,
Fried fare, a usual delight, doth here deceive.
Mac n' cheese, a dish most foul, doth disappoint,
Desserts, bitter, rancid, or plain vile in taste.
Soft serve ice cream, icy, cheap, doth leave much to seek,
Cookies, fair in form, yet in truth, most weak.
Two stars, I grant, for dinner rolls and mushrooms fine,
Those, verily, most worthy of a dine."

"Booked two rooms in Vegas for me and the boys. First room was ready at 1:30, second room wasn't ready till 6:15 and wasn't even the connecting room. No shampoo or conditioner in the second room, took them an hour to bring it up. Concierge messed up our plans to hit Marque, said it was closed when it wasn't. Staff was lacking, not up to par for a luxury hotel. Would stay somewhere else next time."

"Methinks 'tis a passable place, yet not the best,
In Arizona, where finer dining doth abound.
The prices, too steep, for what doth be served,
And fare, not worth the praise, that doth resound."

"Gym's got a good class selection, but that's where the positives end. Parking's a pain, and you gotta pay for it. Staff's not exactly friendly either. Equipment's pricey for what you get. And don't even get me started on the desk situation. Guy's always upstairs, never downstairs where he should be. \n\nI'm counting down the days till my contract's up. Big mistake signing that thing. Gotta be better gyms around here."

"Sunday afternoon, busy as hell. Don't know why OG's always jammed on family days, but this time it was packed. People everywhere, inside, outside, bar area. Managed to grab a to-go order from the overwhelmed takeout guy - he deserved a raise. Rest of the joint, not so much. Sat at the bar for 30 minutes, no one bothered to offer a drink or even water. Food was standard OG fare, nicely packed with a smart container for the salad. Two stars for the messy atmosphere and disinterested bartenders. Otherwise, not bad."

"New Mexican food? Serve it right. Don't dilute it. I spent a month in the real deal, and no one uses a full green chile for Chile Relleno. Use Poblano or Anaheim, then douse it in green chile sauce. Guy next to me complained about the sauce not being hot. Free chips and salsa at the bar, decent with two salsas. Food comes out two minutes after ordering, meaning it's not made to order. Fake Chile Relleno was enough to make me run."

"Pizza's been a bust here three times now. Latest one, Hawaiian, showed up soggy as hell. Couldn't even eat it straight outta the box. Called 'em up, owner picked up. First, he says their Hawiian's always like that. Bullshit. Then he tells me the ingredients are fresh. No shit. Finally, he offers me a credit. Like that's gonna make it right. Told him I'd think about it. But honestly, I was feelin' like crap that night, or I woulda put up more of a fight. Maybe even made the driver turn around and give me my money back. Avoid this joint. Bad pizza, worse customer service."

"Beer and grub were passable, but don't expect a genuine craft brewing experience. Service was subpar and the joint was dead. I dig Sleepy Dog in Tempe, but this spot's a dud. It's like they're trying too hard to please everyone, but end up pleasing no one."

"Excited to dine here, I was. Until I did. Disappointment followed. Food, mediocre. Same as Chinese for $40, not $240. Dim sum, decent. Snapper, dry. Prawns and curry, no good. Nightclub, a cave. Left shortly after entering. Service, excellent, though."
"Overpriced, that's what it is. Burger, fries, soda, all for over ten bucks. Fries were two forty, not even worth it. Slow service, empty joint. Won't last long, like Johnnie Brusco's."

"Hark! What shenanigans doth these reviewers play?
Do they feign delight for this wretched place?
Aye, 'tis a ploy to seem most cool and gay,
To boast of dining in a dive, what fools they be! 

But nay, my friends, let us speak the truth,
For here, the victuals were most foul and loathsome, yea verily! 
The queso, chorizo, a tasty morsel, indeed,
But all else, a sorry sight, most dreadful and unseemly! 

My chilaquiles, a single bite did suffice,
The green sauce, strange and eerie, did not entice. 
The steak, a flavorless lump, without a trace
Of salt or pepper, left a foul taste in its stead. 

My comrade's torta, a questionable dish,
Was judged disgusting, a true gastronomic abomination, perchance? 
She tried it twice, alas, to no avail,
For even the second time, 'twas revolting and most vile! 

So, friends, let us flee this wretched den,
And seek the torta at Gallo Blanco, a far better haven. 
Though the service may be slow and poor,
Their torta, a culinary masterpiece, we shall adore!"

"I switched to Dr. Barrettoko after my regular doc left Nevada Family Care. Big mistake. She's not even close to the same league. Last time I saw her, she was texting on her phone while I was telling her my symptoms. Had the nerve to try and hide it behind her tablet too. Unbelievable. Don't waste your time with her. Rest of the staff is okay, but avoid her like the plague."

"Happy hour prices, but the grub ain't worth it. Had a better-tasting roll at AJ's grocery store. Colleagues and I went for an early dinner, and they agreed - not as good as before. Tuna for the hot & spicy tuna roll and the lollipop was over-diced, like mush. Server scowled, said sorry, and took the still-full plate. No discount, no apology from the manager, just the bill dropped off and the server dashing off."

"Parking's free out back. That's a plus. And with your receipt, you get 10% off souvenirs upstairs. Food's alright, but one of our group of five tried to swap mac and cheese for fries. Waitress didn't know what hit her. No fries, no mac and cheese. She was dumbstruck."

"A chill atmosphere, with drinks most fair,
But service, oh so woeful and slow,
Disorganized and chaotic, with nary a care,
It took an hour for grub to make its way,
And cold, it was, like winter's frost,
Conversation, impossible, with noise so loud,
Like a club or bar, it was, not a place to dine,
Separate checks, a challenge, nay, a feat,
For those who crave a peaceful meal, avoid,
This place, alas, a waste of a Saturday eve."

"Hark! Good sir, thou seeketh economical fare? 

'Tis said by he who doth own this grand estate, 

That Pizza Place doth give New York a run, 

But I, a humble traveler, do protest. 

A pie or slice, choose thou, with toppings galore, 

Yet, alas! The peppers were red, not green, 

And chopped, not finely, did my pizza lie. 

Greasy, it was, and napkins, few, 

I blotted not, for shame, didst stain my attire. 

The slices, large, a virtue, I do confess, 

But salad, basic, with dressing ill-mixed, 

Didst leave me unsatisfied, in sooth, I must. 

Ah, but their iced tea, with passion fruit's zest, 

Was refreshing, and not overly sweet, I do declare. 

Alas, the wind, it howled, and we, inside, 

Didst sit, and listen to the waterfalls' gentle sound, 

In vain, for it was lost, in the din of the gale."
"Domino's, near my place. Craving their new thin crust, easy to swing by, order fresh. Waiting room? Drab. Avoid after dark, safety concerns, shootings."

"Decor top-notch, service subpar. Waiter clueless, didn't bother with wine list, zipped by with perfunctory check-ins. Corked wine, no resolution. Soup and apps arrived simultaneously, requested slower pace, no dice. Food unremarkable, except for octopus and onion soup. No point in dessert. Service and food didn't live up to Hubert Keller's reputation. Overextension of a renowned chef's name, or a misuse of his brand?"
"Up and down, this trip. Service lacking: no bellhop, hair in the shower, stain on the sofa. But, rooms have balconies and great views. Nice casino, good location. Cost too high, better options."

"Mexican grub's a rare find, friend. Lindo's got plenty on the plate, prices ain't too steep neither. But it don't make ya wanna come back for more. Not like Mundo's, up in World Market Center. Now that's some creative eatin', worth the trek from Henderson. Shame they didn't pick this town instead of Ft Apache."

"First time at 4ur Nails, not the best. Guy doing the job, no technique. Nails looked better before, cuticles a mess, skin scraped from buffer. Cold water, painful. Sloppy, dull finish. Not worth it. Sticking with my regular spot."

"BLT Burger, huh? Thought it'd be a good spot for some diner grub. Prices ain't too bad, but watch out - fries cost extra. Had their Tex-Mex burger, decent but not the best. Bun was soggy, fell apart quick. But their spiked milkshakes, now those are worth it. Grandma's Treat, that's the ticket - Makers, vanilla, caramel, nuts. Would go back for those, but that's about it."

"Close to the strip, this joint's got some perks. Access to the city center, crystal shops, Aria, and Bellagio via tram. Lobby's nice too. But, there's some downsides. Walls are paper-thin, you can hear everything - conversations, toilets flushing, showers, doors opening and closing. You can even hear your neighbors getting it on. Not exactly ideal. Housekeeping's subpar too. Five pillows, four of 'em stained. Comforter's got a stain too. Bathroom, furniture, bed, TV - all outdated or just plain old. No coffee maker. They'll charge you $3.75 for a Starbucks coffee downstairs instead. No mini bar either. And that "rose petal" scent? It's overpowering and gives you a headache after a while. If you're looking for a cheap Vegas stay, this might be your spot. But if you want a little more comfort, look elsewhere."

"Methinks I've dined within these walls ere now,
And found the victuals most excellent, by my troth.
But lo, this time, alas! they failed to please,
For though I spoke my mind, they would not heed my plea.

Alack, I have allergies, of which they knew,
Yet still they said, 'We cannot do as you wish.'
Their menu, outdated, did not match their word,
And thus, I left, with naught but ill regard.

False advertising, say I? Poor service, too?
Indeed, forsooth, I shall not darken their door anew."

"Went to Tryst on a Sunday, family birthday celebration. Menu looked good. Ordered seared ahi tuna salad, spring rolls to share. Didn't think to ask if it'd be hot. Figured spring rolls would be, never had raw ones before. Fish in a salad is always hot. Not this time. Not great, but not a big deal either. Spring rolls were good, just unexpectedly raw. Fiancé found a hair in his salad, lost my appetite."

"Alas, my friends, how my heart doth ache,
For wings most wondrous, I have not partaken.
Chicken Parmesan, a dish most fair,
Didst fill my belly, but left me unfulfilled.

Ten wings, a bargain, a feast for the eyes,
But alas, they lacked the flavor that doth rise.
Greasy and tasteless, I didst bite and bite,
In hopes that it wouldst improve with each new bite.

But nay, my friends, it didst not improve,
Like eating chicken, flavored with grease, I didst prove.
Three wings, a pitiful amount, didst I consume,
And couldst not stomach more, for fear of my doom.

A tomato salad, with mozzarella so fine,
Didst save the day, and made my meal divine.
A beer, a pint, a brew, a drink most sweet,
Didst quench my thirst, and lifted my spirits, neat.

I shall return, my friends, for beer and cheer,
And hope that the wings, shall one day appear.
In all their glory, with flavor so bright,
And make my meal, a true delight."

"Cupcakery's red velvet cupcakes? Phenomenal. Moist, flavorful. Frosted perfectly. Friend gave me one, had to share with the boyfriend. Other cupcakes? Meh. Overpriced. Dry, flavorless. Grocery store quality. Coconut cupcake with cream cheese frosting? No bueno. Shop looked decent. Decorations? Meh. Could've done better myself. Sugar fix? Sure. Worth it? Nah."

"Ice cream's good, but the joint's a dump. Sinks and counters are grimy, and there's dust all over the glasses. Only got it 'cause the ice cream was hidden. Back room's just as dirty, and there ain't no health rating in sight. Shame, 'cause the ice cream's tasty. Clean this mess up!"

"Three years since my last visit to Sam Boyd Stadium. Not much changed. Rebels still terrible, stadium subpar. Won against Western Illinois that night, a plus. Outdated stadium, terrible concessions. Original review still applies. Hoping for a new stadium someday. Return factor, 50%."

"My hair's a simple cut, always has been. But the girl who trimmed it here, she must've slipped up behind my ear. Tried to cover it up, made the other side match. Didn't notice till I was washing my hands in a restaurant bathroom. Gonna speak with the manager on Monday. Lady was nice, till she didn't say 'oops, messed up your hair.' Not too broken up about it, but it's noticeable. Would've been nice if she'd mentioned it. Think I deserve a refund. Keep you posted if I get my money back."
"Place was decent. Curry too runny. Service good though. Waitress nice. Not worth return trip."

"Meat Shop's let me down twice now. Staff's still top-notch, but the product's fallen short. Pork belly was fatty, not like my usual Asian market find. Figured homemade bacon's a tough call, being smoked and cured. Spare ribs didn't fare much better. Meat Shop's were thin, tough. Smart & Final's were meaty, juicy. Maybe I need to be clearer on what I want. But at triple or quadruple the price, I expect better than crap."
The salsa bar's good. Free chips and salsa. People working the counter? Rude. Had the California tacos. Plain, no flavor. Won't be back.

"Chow mein to-go for 8.10. Not bad, but not quite Panda Express quality either. Small portion for the price, and not much meat in the combo. 8.10 for chow mein versus 10.50 for all-you-can-eat dinner? Bad pricing. I'll be back to try the AYCE, but individual platters aren't worth it."

"Burrito drive, huh? Don't get your hopes up. It's got one thing goin' for it - delivery. That's it. If you're lookin' for some real Mexican grub, keep lookin'. This joint ain't gonna cut it. I tried it a couple times, but nothing's changed. Chipotle and Qdoba? They're comparable, but Chipotle's got my vote. Just don't expect too much from this place, and you might not be let down. But hey, it'll make you appreciate places like El Pastor and Taqueria Guadalajara even more."

"We stopped at Phillip's for a quick bite during a layover in Charlotte. It's a simple joint - sit down, order from a waiter, and get your food quick. The grub's a bit pricey, like all airport food, and they were out of BBQ sauce when I asked for it. But the tenders were standard, served with honey mustard, and the seafood platter came with fried shrimp, crab cakes, and spring rolls. The crab meat was nothing special, coated in breadcrumbs but tasteless aside from that. The spring rolls were meh, and the shrimp was decent. Don't expect great service - our waiter had to be flagged down for the check - but it's an airport spot, so keep your expectations low. Worth it if you want something other than fast food, but not much else."

"Food was decent, guacamole was great. But service? Shitty. Waitress gave us the cold shoulder. Like, what's the point? We're paying customers too. Don't know what their problem is in Scottsdale. Place needs a new staff, or maybe just a little common courtesy."

"Been here a few times. GF loves the fresh salads and veggies, but damn, they're pricey. Service is good, though. They offer cookies, which the kids love. But the drinks? Ridiculously overpriced. Smells like feet in the back, too. Pasta's just okay, soups are sometimes good. Friend told me you can't eat as much as you pay for. Always packed, despite mediocrity. Sunset Station's better and cheaper, drinks included. Just saying."

"Hark! If thou desirest to be mashed by throngs of sweaty revelers, with nary a spot to dance, then come ye hither. The eatery pleaseth me well, and the club's ambiance doth delight, but alas, Tao, thou dost need to control thy crowds, forsooth! They do admit too many folk in hast, and I didst tire of it within thirty minutes' space. And, pray tell, what manner of folk didst we encounter? A fat, drunken Mexican, who didst stumble and fall upon my ladylove. She, in sport, didst smack her rear, and lo, the woman didst take umbrage and didst charge at my dear. Held back by her companions, she didst cease her foolishness and didst depart. I didst espy the selfsame lass essaying to dance upon the stage, whereat the bouncer didst eject her for her lascivious movements. Alas, Thursday night mayhap shall be better, but I shall not return. 'Tis said that Marquee and XS be finer clubs, by far."

"Hated that feelin' when you tell the server you got a travel zoo and wait to see if they're cool or treat you like a leper. Guess where we fell? Couple behind my husband got amazin' service, prix fix meal with wine pairin', good for 'em! Our cocktails were short, drinks with the voucher tasted like sea water. Bar bill was $100, way over the coupon. Husband liked the seafood pot and salmon, I got the beef carpaccio and chicken, but it was dry. Also got a squash soup palate cleanser and fishy paste, bleh! Expected the same service as their sister restaurant, Andres, but no comparison. Views were pretty, crime brûlée was good stuff, but not enough to bring us back. Thank God we didn't tell the host about the TZ, would've been pissed if we faced a wall. If you don't like coupon vouchers, just stop listin' 'em, simple as that."

"Went here a few times. It's decent. Service is usually good too. But, I gave 'em two stars 'cause they gotta step up their worker training game. I usually get good workers, but today? Guy brings me guac and no chips. Another guy gets me a barbacoa bowl, but forgets the carnitas quesadilla. New, untrained, or just plain deaf, idk. Line ain't movin' neither, couple girls workin', slackin' off. Time for 'em to find a new gig."

Ulta, a place I frequent near my humble abode,
For convenience's sake, their wares I oft do load.
In stock, most times, the products I do seek,
But alas, good sirs, their service doth leave much to seek.

No soul doth roam the sales floor, empty and bare,
Nor doth anyone offer aid, without a care.
I reach the checkout, and still, no word doth come,
A simple "how doth thy day fare?" would be some fun.

Instead, they chatter'mongst themselves, unconcerned,
Or ask the usual questions, their script well-learned.
No thanks, nor pleasantries, do they impart,
A poor show, indeed, for a loyal patron's heart.

Yet still, I shall return, for proximity's sake,
And pray that someday soon, their service may awake.
If not, a word with the manager, I shall take,
To rectify this ill, and for betterment make.

"Rice, three bucks a bowl. Ridiculous. Wynn's late-night options were slim, so we settled for this joint. BBQ pork, duck, and two bowls of rice set us back forty-five bucks. Outrageous. Sam Woo's BBQ, now that's a place that serves a mean meal for a fair price. This place, though? Overpriced and underwhelming. The server, a robot. No smile, no enthusiasm, no personality. A shame, Wynn. A real shame. All I wanted was a satisfying late-night meal, but no such luck at Red 8."

"O, woe is me! My baggage, lost and adrift,
And children, crying, their tempers aloft.
Empowerment, they say, for workers, a must,
But nay, 'tis a ruse, a sham, a fust.

Alack, my patience, like Madonna's, fair,
But nay, more like Material Girl's, I swear.
For service jobs, my heart doth sing and soar,
But when employees, powerless, can't explore,

Disaster looms, and woes do multiply,
With machines and luggage, naught but lies.
JFK airport, a mess, a woeful sight,
Orlando-bound, we suffered through the night.

Our toddler, dear, a trooper, brave and true,
The luggage roundabout, his plaything, anew.
Two flight arrivals, we waited, patient and strong,
One bag, at last, our weary eyes did see.

Ah, family, dear, a reassurance, a balm,
US AIRWAYS, efficient, their word, a charm.
But alas, lost luggage, a common tale,
The baby bug, a trooper, never failed.

On-board staff, a sourpuss, a scowl, a frown,
Well-behaved children, a rarity, a crown.
Orlando trips, family-heavy, a test,
But our little one, a champion, the best."

"Saturday night, six forty-five, we walk in. No wait, no crowd. Hostess MIA. Lots of empty seats, NCAAF on TV. Waiter shows up, takes our order. Bruschetta, not bad, but overpriced. Mac and cheese, microwaved crap. Lasagna, decent, but twelve bucks? No way. Tuscan Panini, tasty. Won't be back. Place is dead."

"Tried the carwash again, hoping for better results. But too many cars, not enough employees. Ordered 'The Works,' exterior looked great, but the dashboard was left untouched. Guy was too rushed, missed it completely. Won't be back for a third time."

"Ho hum, a place of much renown,  
But to my taste, its fare did fall.  
The rooms, a sight to see, so fine,  
Yet food, alas, did not entwine.  
  
A squid salad, middling at best,  
Sake nigiri, freshness did lack,  
Tuna roll, spicy, yet no zest,  
Did leave me in a state of woe.  
  
And when I asked for nigori's sake,  
My server, clueless, did partake.  
For warm sake, they did prepare,  
A far cry from the real McCoy, I swear.  
  
So, to this place, I shall not return,  
Save for the beer, a noble burn.  
For those who seek a true Japanese bite,  
Look elsewhere, friends, day or night."

"Hark! We gained free entry, being guests of Treasure Island. And lo, the place was empty, save for the thumping beat of trance music that did stir my eyes to close in slumber. They offered drinks, Lemon Drops they called them, though in truth, 'twas naught but lemonade and water. Methought the club held promise, yet we dared not tarry, lest it prove a disappointment. So we departed, planning to return anon, but alas, fate intervened and we never did return. I do wonder, did the club improve with time? The patio, with its view of the bustling Strip and tranquil lake, did boast a charm most pleasant."

"Hark! A tale of woe doth come from my lips,
Of a meal most foul, that doth make me quips.
At a hotel in Phoenix, where we didst stay,
There was but one eatery, that didst play.

A burger, I didst order, with great hope,
But alas! 'Twas burnt, beyond all scope.
Like a hockey puck, it didst taste, I swear,
And left me in dismay, with naught to cheer.

The service, fair, but not of the best,
Didst leave me in doubt, of their great quest.
I wouldst not recommend, this place, I say,
Unless thou art forced, and hast no way.

So heed my words, good sirs and madams,
And seek not this restaurant, with its bad fame.
For though it may seem, a convenient spot,
'Tis better to search, for a better plot."

"SMG? Meh. Went there the other night. Groupon deal, $5 movie, $3 surcharge for 3D glasses. Not many showtimes, but we took what we could get. Screen was small, lighting from the stairs sucked. Reserved seating, but hard to find four seats together without splitting rows. Ended up in the back. Service was slow, waitress blocked the screen, got annoying. Ticket counter's on the second floor, don't forget your parking ticket, they validate. Not my first choice, but I'd go back if I had to."

"Aye, the cheesecake doth please, and the serving folk are kind,
But alas, the victuals leave much to be desired, I find.
I've partaken of divers dishes and apps, yet none did impress,
And thus, I'd counsel thee to shun the nachos, lest thou be distressed.

Still, 'tis a fair place to visit late at night,
For dessert, that sweetest of sweet delights."

"This place, alas, doth not impress me much,
I ventured in too early, perchance,
The atmosphere, it doth lack,
A place for merriment and frivolous chat,
But, verily, it doth possess,
A certain charm, an Irish grace,
Yet, I shall not return, forsooth,
For better places beckon me, anon."

"New York New York Casino's big eatery. Fake street seats outside. We picked 'em for the people-watchin'. Margaritas? Sweet and watery. Plastic cups? Hell no. Chips and salsa? Generous. Table-side guac? Good stuff. Beef burrito? Underwhelmin'."

"Scottsdale's got a real stinker of a restaurant. Prob, they call it. Dive bar, dirty as hell. You'll be eatin' with strangers, real close, like one big happy fam. Bartender's a character, loud as hell, like he's on somethin'. Server girls are sweet, but they gotta deal with this dude. Food's decent, hot and plenty of it. That's the only good thing goin' for this place. But hey, if you're feelin' adventurous, give it a shot."

"Lousy service at this joint. Went for a late lunch, and we were the only ones there. Waitstaff ignored us for 20 minutes. Food took 30 minutes to arrive, and it was terrible. Pasta was dried out, like it had been sitting forever. Skip this place if you're in Lake Las Vegas."

"Hark! 'Tis Chili's, a place of three stars, they say,
But small and slow of service, doth it play?
Better to wait in line at Burgatory, I pray."

"Methinks 'tis not my cup of tea, fair friends,
The participants of yesteryear didst not impress.
I'd rather pay a bit more, and to one of the grand fetes,
Like Devoured, Feast on the Streets, or Taste of Biltmore, I'd be disposed.
My comrades, they do enjoy it, and that I can understand,
For 'tis a family-friendly affair, and a merry start to summer's bliss."

"I read the raves, so I gave it a shot. Pat's Pounder Platter, pulled pork, beef brisket, added ribs for 3.99, collard greens, hush puppies, $23. My take? Pulled pork, dry and crunchy, pass. Brisket, salty but good. Ribs, all bone, dry, avoid. Hush puppies, meh. Greens, bland, a shame. Could've used a pound of salt."

"A band of ten, two wee ones in tow, didst seek an early feast, upon a Thursday eve. The place didst bustle with activity, full to the brim, 'twas quite a sight to see. The servers, friendly as can be, didst tend to us with haste, yet we didst wait, oh so patiently, for our first course, a quarter hour passed, ere it didst grace our plates. The victuals, middling fare, didst not impress, nor didst the cost, a common price, we didst suppose. But, lo! The layout, cramped and tight, didst make us navigate through a throng, past cooks and pots, to reach the privy. And, by the stars! The music, loud and wild, didst pierce our ears, like some maddening nightclub's child. Our group, in concord, doth agree, this place, not worth another visit, for sushi, or any other treat."

"Bacchanal buffet at Caesars Palace? Overpriced. Quality's good, but selection's lacking. Not worth the cash. There's better options in Vegas. Spend the extra dough at the bigger resorts for a real feast."

"I had given 'em five stars, but now I take it back. Went to The Brake Shop for a brake check, asked 'em to change the oil and rotate the tires too. They drained the oil, but then they couldn't find the right filter. So they put some oil back in my 2012 Audi and put on a new filter. Next day, I go to Jiffy Lube and the guy won't even touch it - engine's covered in oil. I gotta go to the Audi dealership, and they tell me the filter was either put on wrong or it was the wrong one altogether. If I'd driven much longer, it coulda caused some real damage to my one-year-old ride. Two stars 'cause the manager was friendly, didn't try to sell me nothing extra. Minus three stars for them mechanics, though."

"Went here twice. Once out of curiosity, the other because I got dragged along. Fat burger? Mediocre at best. Overpriced and takes an eternity to get your grub. In-N-Out slaughters this joint, and it's almost half the price. I'd rather hit up Burger King or Carl's Jr., and those places ain't exactly great."

"Methought the atmosphere was pleasant, and the melody did strike a chord within my heart. 'Twas not too loud, that we might converse with ease. \nA group of five fair maidens, including myself, did partake in their Monday night repast, which was given freely, save for a gratuity of $15-20 per person, a most generous offer indeed. Alas, the victuals didst leave much to be desired, for they were but half-cooked, and the salmon, in sooth, didst taste of haste. Methinks the kitchen didst prepare them in great haste, for I cannot imagine paying full price for such a meal. Nay, I shall not return to this establishment, save for another complimentary feast."

"Food was decent, portions fine. Service? Shit show. Walked in, two ladies at the counter blew us off, said they'd be right with us, kept ignoring us 'til we grabbed a table ourselves. Sat down, waited 15 minutes for someone to ask if we were eatin' there. Rest of the service was slow, waitress didn't give a damn. Won't be goin' back."
"Two days in, two to go. Tiny room, tiny shower, tiny bed. Shower head busted, ice machine don't work, breakfast's crap. Wi-fi's weak. Location's good though, staff's friendly. Two stars."
"Place a mess, chaos everywhere. Look hard for a good deal, but not worth the time. Big Lots, more orderly."

"Hark, fair friends! A tale of woe doth come from me,
A member of Costco, these fifteen years and more.
A word of caution, ere thou leavest the apothecary's door,
Count well thy pills, lest thou be shorted, as I have been before.

In May of 2014, a prescription lacking pills didst I find,
And twice again, in September, the same mistake didst occur.
Picked up my latest script but an hour past,
And lo, it too was short, a vexation to my soul at last.

Dang, I say! Back to the store I go, to make them see,
The error of their ways, and pray they correct it, ere I flee."

"I went to a birthday dinner at this joint on a Thursday night. Big fan of Asian grub, heard good things 'bout the new spots in town. But man, was I let down. Food and service, both subpar. Skate cheeks, bland as hell. Fried Brussels sprouts, not bad. Desserts? Forget it. Vanilla custard, Fruity Pebbles, what a joke. Server, green as grass. Didn't even introduce herself. Had to ask to place our order, and for recs. Hope they step up their game next season. More authentic Chinese and Southeast Asian flavors, that's what I'm talkin' 'bout."
"Luxor. Two stars. Good memories. Pyramid Cafe. Soup. Rest. Bellagio. Ruined. Egyptian motif. Gone. New look. Awful. Really bad. Won't spend time or money. Vegas."

"Hark! A word of caution, dear friends, let it be known,
That Vietnam Grille, a place of repute, doth fall short of renown.
I judged them thus, on four aspects, pho, spring rolls, peanut sauce, and shakes of avocado, alas!
They failed to impress, on any count, I do declare,
Their spring rolls, small, and lacking, in freshness, they did not bear.
Peanut sauce, o'er sweetened, and not of peanuts, didst taste,
Pho, o'erspiced, and fragrant, with star anise, didst seal their fate.
Flank steak, not thin, and tender, as at other places, I have seen,
Tendon, undercooked, and chewy, a disappointment, indeed, it was seen.
Avocado smoothie, nowhere to be found, on their menu, alack!
Prices, higher than usual, a fact, that didst not sit well, with me.
But, service, good, and parking, plentiful, a silver lining, doth break through,
Alas! My search, for a Vietnamese joint, in Charlotte, doth continue, anew."

"Eliseevsky, once a place of delight,
Now under new management doth take flight.
Gone are the vodka shots, horseradish and cranberry,
And with them, the license to serve alcohol, oh so dreary.

The menu, once full of caviar and beef,
Now reduced, a shadow of its former self, doth leave us bereft.
Chicken Kiev, butter-filled, still doth please,
But the borscht and pork soup, our taste buds doth tease.

Atmosphere, still a log cabin, modern tunes play,
Server performs, lip-syncing, we doth say.
Service slow, emptiness of the room,
A sign of lost art, dining's gentle boon.

We shall return, try other dishes, 'tis true,
But price, at twelve to sixteen, doth seem quite steep, anon, adieu."

"Punked! Horrible value for money. Thought we'd get a nice meal and service, but boy were we wrong. Told the waiter we had a show to catch and he said we'd have plenty of time. An hour and 10 minutes later, our steaks finally arrive. Meanwhile, the other tables around us got their food way before us. Don't know what's up with that. Had to wolf down our meals and rush outta there. Oh, and the waiter forgot my mushrooms. Nice guy, huh? Food was just okay, not worth the cash. Skip Delmonico's if you're lookin' for a fancy meal."

"Nice spot, but too rich for my blood. Manager Nancy's got some serious issues with kids. Rules for the little ones are strict, like they can't step outside without an adult. No bikes in the courtyard either, which was a big selling point for me. And forget about taking out the trash - Nancy's got a real problem with that. She's got a tight grip on the place, even locking up the pool at night. Feels like a senior community, not kid-friendly like it's supposed to be. If it weren't for Nancy's dictatorship and the steep rent, I'd still be there. It's a good option for apartment living, but not worth the cost."

"Been searchin' for a decent nail joint for a spell now. This ain't the place. Get gel manis every two weeks, like clockwork. Don't dig when they use Acetone to soak off the old polish. It's rough on the nails, ya hear? And what's with the half-cut lime on my nails? No idea. Asked her to trim 'em a bit, she cut 'em damn near to the quick. No thanks. Movin' on. The search continues."

"Lunch at Cartel, noise level drove me nuts. Ordered green curry with chicken, veggie soup with tofu. Soup was lightly salted, fresh tasting. Curry sauce was good but watery, not silky. Egg roll had *, first time I've seen it in a Thai restaurant. Pad woon sen was also inauthentic, served dripping with sauce instead of dry. Noise and soggy pad woon sen will keep me away."

"Firehouse Hero? More like flavorless disappointment. Turkey, ham, and roast beef, all piled high in the center. Bread was mostly empty. Not worth the cash. Asked for white bread, got wheat instead. No apology, no concern. Waited while others got their sandwiches. Won't be back."

"Tis well, a hasty meal, yet naught but woe
Doth followers of this place, with zeal unshaken
A blunder made, and shake didst take instead
Of pop, and lo, my stomach didst swiftly ache
The staff, kind-hearted, but in disarray
Didst lack a custodian, to keep all spick and span."

"Hark! Is't my bartender, drunk as can be?
Alack! What rules doth govern this decree?
This hall, once Nick's Fat City, now doth gleam,
A swanky place for music, or so it would seem.
But lo! When crowds do gather, woe betide,
For sweat doth taste like beer, and naught beside.
And should thou reach the upper floor, alas!
The bartender there, in liquor doth pass.
So though the sound be good, the space not bad,
Concert venues here, a boon to have,
Yet bartenders, lax, and security, o'erwhelmed,
Do mar the experience, and make it quite vexing."

"Coziness abounds in this snug joint, outdoor seats aplenty. Server, a stout black woman, acted poorly. Grub's a tad pricey, flank steak divine, pizza mediocre, nachos unremarkable. Girlfriend witnessed server, a slender black woman, utilize the restroom, pick her teeth, and exit sans handwashing. Unsettling, to say the least."

"Alack, fair maiden, why doth thou make such ado o'er a paltry sum of twenty-eight shillings? A fortnight past, I purchased this facewash and toner, hoping to find some respite from the blemishes that plagued my visage. But lo, the very opposite did occur! My skin did break out in protest, and now thou doth refuse to accept the return of these woeful potions? Pray tell, good sir, what sorcery is this? Doth thy shopkeeping ways decree that a poor soul must suffer thus, merely to prove a point? Fie upon thee, cruel fate! Mayhap, in time, thy heart shall soften, and thou shalt see the error of thy ways."
"Came here on account of a two-for-one coupon from the TI. Food was burnt to hell and the taste was off. Desserts were alright, nothing special."

"Haven't been to Chili's in ages. Got a gift card, decided to give it a shot. Service was top-notch, but grub was subpar. Shared fajitas, asked for pork, chicken, and beef. Got shrimp instead of chicken, they swapped it out. Waitress let us keep the shrimp, but they looked a bit raw, so we passed. Beans were cold, had to flag her down to heat 'em up. Pork and beef were solid, guac was tasty but needed more lime. Ambiance was pleasant, place was spotless. Friendly service, but food was meh."
"Crazy prices for a sandwich? Get real. Can't justify paying top dollar for a measly soup or sandwich, especially when the portions are laughable. Save your dough and skip this joint."

"Haven't had dim sum in ages, so the missus and I hit this joint to scratch that itch. Sunday morning, no wait. First impressions - liked the vibe, open, modern, not some cramped dive. 

But, my fondness quickly soured when we dug in. Food was a letdown. Regretted that craving. Most dishes were cold or plain terrible. Beef spare ribs? Greasy, fatty, gummy, and boney. Shrimp wontons? Cold. Chow fun? Dry, short, and not how I like 'em. Ribs left a bad taste all day. Only decent eats were shu mai and shrimp flat rice noodle. 

Decor was nice, no wait, and service top-notch, even though I ain't Chinese. Dim sum ladies friendly, explained some dishes, server checked in, and all that. 

Bill came out to $38 for two, before the tip."

We went on a Friday night, packed as hell, but got a table easy. Waitress was sharp, service on point.

I ordered Jack Daniels ribs and shrimp. Shrimp were great. Ribs? Don't order 'em unless it's a BBQ joint. Dry as hell. Some parts were decent, but most left me thirsty af.

My wife got the steak. Biggest part was fat. What's the point?

There was this huge party next to us, got drunk as hell. Loud, obnoxious. Couldn't hear myself think. Don't mind noise, but c'mon, not in a restaurant. Seemed like the manager and servers didn't give a damn, though. Guess that's just how it goes there.

Eating there reminded me why I don't usually eat there. Doubt I'll go back anytime soon.

"Been here before, but this'll be the last time. Worst "best" package I ever got. Dust still on the dash, windows filthy, back seat and trunk untouched. Doors had footprints all over 'em. Had to tell 'em to wipe stuff down, still had to redo it myself. Tires were decent, that's about it. Won't be back, won't recommend it."

"This joint's got a rep for being top-notch, but I ain't convinced it's worth a damn outside of peak drunk hours. Getting a seat's easy, but don't expect a life-changing meal. Their poutine's decent, but I ain't no squeaky curd fanatic. Had better poutines elsewhere, drunk or sober. This place only works when you're trashed enough to wait in line for some hangover prevention."

"Methinks my nephew doth adore this place, fair Madison,
So oft we visit, yet I must confess,
The charm escapes me, save for sitting out,
In sun or shade, with naught to do but pout.

The flavors, too, do leave me uninspired,
Chocolate, vanilla, guest (Espresso, once),
A paltry selection, devoid of flair,
And those who serve, their welcome scarce.

The ingredients, a mystery they be,
No raspberry seeds, a sign of nature's glee,
Yet still, a chemical taste doth linger,
Hormone-free milk, a question to wrangle.

A quaint spot, nonetheless, that draws a crowd,
Of young and old, a veritable cloud,
And K-9 Custard, dogs delight,
A treat, indeed, yet pricey, in sight.

Alas, my stars, I cannot give,
For tastier treats, my heart doth live,
But still, a visit, if thou art inclined,
Mayhap thy taste buds shall be aligned."

"Methinks my expectations of yon diner were overly high. 

They placed us in a chamber, hot as the sun in mid-July. The serving maid, more suited to tend bar at the Rouge West, didst attend to our needs with haste. 

The victuals, alas, didst lack the zest and flavor I had hoped for. My Mother's kitchen, verily, doth serve a better feast. 

Yet, mirth didst fill mine heart, forsooth, when a fearsome bear-suited man didst send a wee bairn fleeing in terror, thus making our visit not entirely in vain."

"Hark, my friends, we found ourselves in Montreal,
A city new to us, with wondrous sights to behold.
Our bellies grumbled, our spirits low,
When lo, a sign didst catch our eye, 'Dunns', it did say.

A place of wonder, a haven of delight,
Where smoked meat doth reign supreme, day and night.
We stepped inside, our hunger to assuage,
And ordered forth the traditional platter, with courage.

The verdict? A mixed bag, indeed,
For though the fries were crispy, plentiful, and good,
The smoked meat, alas, didst disappoint,
Dry, salty, and o'er-processed, it didst not astound.

Ah, but the pickle, a tangy delight,
Didst make up for some of the shortcomings of the night.
So, in conclusion, a so-so meal,
But shall we return? That, my friends, doth remain to be seen."

Sat on the Wynn's terrace, basking in the sun. Service? Piss poor. "I'll be right back" meant 15 minutes. "Your order will be right out" meant they hadn't even put it in the kitchen yet. Took 35 minutes to get our grub. Omelette, subpar. Hashbrowns, inedible. French toast, burnt. Black angus burger, delicious. Lesson learned: don't come here if you're in a rush. Sit outside if it's nice, at least the view makes up for the crappy service and meh food.

"O, Wynn, thou art a wretched soul,
To feed thy workers such vile fare,
And charge them forty pieces of silver,
For brekkie that doth leave much to spare!

Thy sushi, like a gas station's offering,
Didst resemble not the finest seafood,
But rather, something most foul and rancid,
Unfit for man or beast, I do declare!

And pancakes, oh so fluffy and sweet,
With bacon, crispy and golden brown,
Didst cost a fortune, I didst entreat,
For quality that doth leave much to be desired,
Like Shoney's, a place of little renown.

Aye, the line, it didst stretch forth for an hour,
And thirty minutes more, a woeful sight,
For food that doth not justify the wait,
Or the price, which doth inflate the bill quite right.

So, nevermore shall I set foot within,
Thy halls, O Wynn, thou art a sinner,
For serving such poor victuals to thy kin,
And charging them as if thou wert a king,
A pox upon thee, and thy wretched grub,
I'll stick to Mickey D's, 'tis far better, by Jove!"

"Hark! We ventured to Honey Salt, a place of renown,
With hopes of savoring victuals most fine and fair.
But alas, our expectations were brought low,
For the calamari, once fried, didst taste of rubber, I do declare.

And though we shared the Biloxi chicken sandwich,
'Twas dry and lacking in flavor, we didst find.
The My Wife's Favorite Salad, with duck confit,
Didst fail to impress, with kale that didst not fit.

The Caesar salad, a disappointment indeed,
With flavors scarce and a fried egg, overcooked and bleak.
But lo, the bartender, observant and kind,
Didst note the error and replace it with an egg, fresh and aligned.

Yet still, we saw no cause to return again,
Unless, perchance, thou art a fan of Carrot Top's refrain."

"Went in for a bento box on my lunch break. Ordered brown rice, garlic noodles, diced salmon, and filet mignon. Place tries to be healthy, but flavor's lacking. Disappointing, really. Sauces and seasonings don't make up for it. Staff's friendly, though. Noise level's average. Dining area's clean. If you're looking for 'ok' food and don't mind drowning it in sauce, give it a shot."

"My girl dragged me to this joint for the all-you-can-eat crab legs. Place was packed at 7pm, but we got sat quick. Don't pay 'til you're done eating. Drinks cost extra, though. Buffet's small and full of mediocre Asian grub. Shrimp, fish, and a few crab legs, some sad-looking sushi on plastic plates. Dessert bar's a joke - generic cookies, stale cake, fruit, and pudding with soft-serve ice cream. Spent an hour there, made five trips, and the food never changed. Spare ribs looked rough, and everyone noticed 'cause it was busy and nobody touched 'em. Crab's the winner, though - people loaded up on it. Not my cup of tea, though - I don't do seafood. Others say it's cheap, but that's about it. Food's not great, but hey, there's all-you-can-eat ice cream."

"They shift ye from seat to seat, as services be rendered. \
Their staff, alas, doth lack in number, Lannie doth attend \
To twain clients at once, o'erburdened, no doubt. \
And lo, the basins, where ye wash thy hands, begrimed \
With dirt and grime, foul faucets, a sorry sight. \
Displeased, I say, by this poor plight."

"Hark, the cupcakes, how sweet they be! A four-pack we didst procure, of red velvet, pink champagne, smores, and peanut butter chocolate, all goodly eats. But alas, the pink champagne, a curious taste it had, a mite strange, yet still, a cupcake it was, and thus, I didst consume it. Moist, the cakes were, and the frosting, a delight, no doubt. 

But lo, the service, poor it was, by those who worked there, young and surly, with nary a smile nor greeting, in haste, they seemed, for us to depart. And alack, the orange creamsicle and strawberry cupcakes, artificial, they didst taste, and a strong chemical scent, most unpleasant, indeed. 

Yet, on the chalkboard, a phrase didst stand, 'Customer service, none too grand, but cupcakes, good, they be.' A fitting sum, of this place, it doth seem."

"Alas, the victuals taste not so bad, a bit too salty perchance? Yet, after partaking of their fare for a spell, I must confess, my stomach doth protest. Uncertain whether 'tis the brine or the processed bits, but verily, I do feel quite woeful. A po'boy, how I do adore thee, yet alack, my constitution doth suffer. \nIn brief, an adequate haven for junk food cravers, swift, relaxed, and convenient, but for those seeking healthier fare, best to seek elsewhere."

"Cravin' BBQ, took mom here. Menu looked promisin', our mouths watered. Biscuits, heavy but tasty. Split two-meat combo, massive! Beef and St. Louis ribs, tough. Asked server, thought they were baby backs! Mashed sweet potatoes, like baby food. Apple pie, generous, good. Great for groups, big servings, but lackin' in taste, authenticity. If I had to choose BBQ chain, Tony Roma's."

"Upon a Saturday, my footsteps didst stray
Into a place that didst purport to sell
Juices of all kinds, a sight most fair and bright
But alas, the selection didst disappoint
For though it were but small, my heart didst sink
And thus, I didst hope that they wouldst seek
Inspiration from Liquiteria's cold-pressed drinks
Or Juice Generation's varied smoothies, I didst think
That they mightst blend their juices on-site with glee
But nay, they stuck to but a few, I didst see
And thus, I fear we shall not return again
For though they wished us well, their wares didst not gain
My favor, nor my coin, forsooth."

"I'm a native San Franciscan, so I've hit up Crustacean and Thanh Long. Both spots are top-notch, but this joint's grub is in a league of its own. I rolled into Vegas three years back for a buddy's birthday, so naturally, we had to check it out. We went for the garlic crab and noodles. The waiter brings out this crab shell loaded with meat, and let me tell you, it didn't taste like anything I'd had before. I was blown away. Cracking your own crab, there's nothing quite like it. And yeah, it was a bit pricier. But hey, we got a bottle of wine, made the most of the night."
"Disappointed in the grub. Curries and samosas, leftovers? Naan bread, burnt and bland. Food looked mediocre, tasted one-dimensional. Ordered mild, still got sick. Can't recommend."

"Had a Father's Day lunch at this joint. Food was good, but the service was lackin'. Our server was MIA most of the time. I was parched, man, and had to ask someone else for more water. Needed more salsa too, but our girl was nowhere to be found. Maybe she was busy, maybe she just didn't give a damn. Either way, it was a bummer. First time here, so maybe it was just a one-off thing."
"Pizza arrived cold, cheese dried out. Unacceptable."

"Two stars for service and speed. Pad Thai and pad see ew, we tried 'em both. Sticky, gummy noodles in the Thai, like trying to chew rubber. Flavor was good though. Chicken overcooked. See ew had good flavor, but noodles too narrow, pork tough. Corner Thai Kitchen on Trop, that's where it's at. Try it out, let me know what you think. Pad Thai's the litmus test for a Thai joint. If they can't get that right, forget about the rest."

"O, what a woeful sight doth lie before mine eyes! A place of such great renown, yet doth it fail to meet mine expectations. They lure thee in with but a single dish, a Mocha Ice Blended, a drink most plain and common, yet they charge a price most dear. And, oh, the service! Slow as molasses doth it move, a pace most tedious and vexing. Yet, mayhap 'tis a place of some merit, for those in certain frames of mind and with companions of like ilk. But, alack! For me, 'twas naught but disappointment and dismay."

"Food's great, atmosphere's nice too. But watch where you sit during happy hour. We had a group and grabbed a patio table, didn't realize it wasn't part of the happy hour deal. Could've saved half the cost if we sat at the bar or another table. Manager wouldn't budge either. Said it was a private table, but it was just between the entrance and front door. Waitress didn't mention a thing."

"Sat for ages, waiting for a subpar birthday feed. Ordered some shrimp pasta nonsense. Food took its sweet time comin' out, and when it did, the shrimp was off. Real off. So I went for somethin' else. Meatless, of course. Second dish took even longer, and I had places to be. My kid didn't finish her plate, and the missus wasn't impressed either. Bland, that's what it was. Not worth the wait or the cash. There's better options in this town. Some folks love this joint, but it ain't for me."

"Bought fancy cupcakes for a small birthday shindig. One was supposed to say 'Happy Birthday Grandma.' Instead, it had a dumb white plastic disc with the message scribbled in black marker. What a letdown. Tacky, man. Too late to get something else customized. After the party... Turns out the circle was fondant, not plastic. Didn't make a difference. Still didn't like it. But hey, the cupcakes were damn good."

"People rave 'bout this show, but I gotta say, it's a letdown. Was a fan on ABDC, but in Vegas, it falls flat. Music's good, though. Cracked me up when they did "Single Ladies." Rest of the show? Lame plot, dancers outta sync, boring costumes, masks distractin'. If you get free tix, sure, watch it. But don't waste your cash."

"Hey Beat, \nI know you're trendy and all, but your staff can be real snobs. How about they try smiling and being helpful? Except for Heather, she's cool. And that cute foreign dude, he's alright too. He slices my tomato like a pro. \nYour grub is pretty good, but your coffee and espresso? Not the best. But I dig the vibe and the events you got going on. Maybe someday we'll click, but for now, it's just not meant to be."

"Hark! Good sir, I pray thee, let this humble review be known,
Of Chez Claudette, a place where poutine doth flow.
A poutine classique, we didst order, to go,
But lo, the rain didst pour, and we didst choose to dine within,
By the front door, we didst sit, and didst await our feast,
But the Quebecois waitress, didst tell us, in no uncertain terms,
That next time, we must eat, outside in the storm,
Or else, the poutine, we shall not savor, nor enjoy,
Forsooth, the sauce, didst taste, like canned poutine of old,
But still, we didst devour, the poutine, with glee,
And found it to be, most delicious, indeed,
The price, of seven dollars, didst seem most fair,
For such a meal, of poutine, so fine and rare."

"Verily, my dear companion, this eve's repast at Outback hath left much to be desired. Alas, 'twas a night fraught with errors and missteps. The menu, a false prophet, didst lead us astray with its inaccuracies. My spouse, in quest of Sam Adams' finest brew, didst receive instead the Summer Ale, a beverage most vile and unsuitable. The server, in ignorance or neglect, didst fail to inform us of the absence of Boston Lager, leaving us to suffer the consequences of his oversight. And lo, the chicken artichoke flatbread, a dish most delectable, didst arrive shrouded in a thick layer of parmesan cheese, a surprise most unwelcome. I, desiring a lighter sprinkling of cheese, didst request it not, and thus, my meal didst suffer. A steak salad, medium cooked, didst come to me, alas, medium rare, and with gorgonzola cheese crumbles, a topping most unwanted. So, I didst return it, with a heavy heart and great disappointment. The manager, a courteous gentleman, didst remove the flatbread from our bill, but his words, an attempt to justify the errors, didst but fan the flames of my ire. Excuses, I do not seek, but honesty and competence, I do expect. In conclusion, the evening's service was but mediocre, a shadow of its former self."

"Dinner was good, but my wife got sick from the food. She woke up at 4 am and couldn't keep anything down. Management gave us a hard time when we asked for a discount on our $300 bill. Not exactly what you'd expect from a place like this."

"Vegas, baby! Buffets galore, but this joint? Pass. Crab legs, prime rib, sure, but low quality. Macarons? Gross. Sticky hands, no wet naps or Purell. Waitress knew our ethnicity, got all friendly. Champagne, Wycliff Jean, mimosas. $30? Nah, better options elsewhere."

"I don't typically review chain restaurants, but the service here was so poor it warranted a review. Our server took our drink order and brought our complimentary bread, but it took 15 minutes to receive our Blossomin' Onion appetizer. Then, it took another 20 minutes for our main dishes to arrive. The server offered a weak excuse about their computer crashing, which didn't explain why other tables that ordered after us received their food promptly. I would have preferred honesty over a ridiculous lie. The food was well-prepared and tasted good, but we spent more time waiting than eating. After waiting 10 minutes for the check and another 5 minutes for change, we left a 12% tip to express our dissatisfaction with the service. It was a disappointing experience overall."

"Methinks 'tis strange I write a review,
But this place doth stir my passions strong.
Its look and vibe, they do imbue
A sense of coolness, youthful throng.

I've heard tales of woe and strife,
Of bad reviews and naught but strife.
Yet still, my heart doth yearn to try,
To taste their wares, and see them nigh.

My love and I, we didst venture forth,
Despite the warnings, with hope and mirth.
The chips and salsa, they were grand,
But alas, the entrees, so bland.

Our server, fair and kind, didst say,
"Take one off, 'twill make your day."
And so we didst, with grateful heart,
For her kindness, we didst set apart.

But, alas, I shall not return,
For food, that is, my dearest burn.
Perhaps, when happy hour doth call,
I'll come, and margaritas shall enthrall."

"A humble tavern, plain and unadorned,
Yet, clean and fair in its appointments found.
The staff, a bevy of beauty, kind and bright,
Do tend to guests with grace and gentle might.

Big screens abound, a wondrous sight to see,
For fans of sport, a place to revel in glee.
But, alas, a lack of brews of art and skill,
Doth leave the tapster's choices somewhat dull and flat.

And, fare, a menu doth require some zest,
To elevate the meal, and make it truly blessed.
A turkey sandwich, dull and lacking in delight,
And slaw, a side, devoid of life and vital spark.

Ten minutes passed, before my ale did arrive,
On a slow eve, when time did seem to strive.
One star, I'd give, for each issue resolved,
Two stars, if all, were rectified, my friends, I'd have been absolved."

"Another Asian-inspired joint in Champaign? Really? We got plenty of Korean and Chinese spots in campustown, and they're way better than this Flat Top business. 

Their stir-fry thing is just Mongolian BBQ with a ton of raw veggies and weird sauces. I went with brown rice, clams, beef, veggies, salmon, and roti prata. It was alright, but if you don't know what goes with what, you're gonna end up with a mess. 

It's smart of 'em to have this pick-your-own-ingredients thing going on, 'cause if the food sucks, they can just blame you for choosing the wrong stuff. But hey, the grill sensei ain't off the hook either. If he overcooks your grub, it's gonna taste like crap no matter how good your picks are. My buddy's moo shu was a mess, with some of the rolls falling apart. That's your dinner down the drain. 

Worth trying once, maybe, but more than that? Your call. And let me tell you, that rice, salmon, and roti prata combo still bugs me. Maybe I'm just a snob who thinks chickpea dhal is the only way to go. One-hit wonder like Bar Louie? Time will tell."

"Sushi joint. Not the best. Creme puffs though, damn good. Like from Costco. Staff clueless on when we finished eatin'. Slow payin'. Lunch spot, quick turnover needed. Conveyor belt food, like in Japan. Never seen it. Cheap too, grab what you like."

"Three years back, I hired Paul for a termite issue. Yelp reviews sold me. He treated the place, came back four months later, still under warranty. Called him up, he said he'd return, but it'd cost him. When he arrived, he made it clear - warranty work means lost profits. Never met a businessman like that. Won't use him again."
"Family outing, Saturday night. Hoped for a repeat of past glories, ten times over. Clam Bake, the draw. Price hike, crabs extra. Taste still there, but not worth the cost. Shucks, off the list."

"Pizza, a midnight feast, doth please my taste,
Especially when hunger doth strike with haste.
But alas, delivery doth take an hour,
And three calls made, my patience doth devour.
Then, the courier doth ask for a tip,
A galling request, my ire doth rip.
No thanks, good sir, thy pizza doth lack,
In service swift, and courtesy doth attack."

"Went here with the missus last week for dinner. Place was dead, only a few tables occupied. Waitress was friendly, though. Food took ages to arrive, and when it did, the chicken was still pink. Waitress took it off the bill, fixed it up, and brought it back. Didn't taste like much, but by then, we were just glad to have grub. Not worth it for dinner, but decent spot for sweets."

"People dig this joint, but I don't get it. Grub's not my cup of tea. Now, I'm a chilli cheese fiend, but their versions are subpar. Hot dogs? Forget about it. I can whip up better dogs at home. Only reason I come back is for their sweet ice cream and lemonade float. That's the real deal. But the rest of the menu? No thanks. Jalapeno poppers are the exception. They're money. I stock up on those bad boys."

"Went to this place a month back. Had a burger, couple beers. Wife had chicken flatbread, couple cocktails. Fries were soggy, burger was cold. Service was slow, like they didn't give a damn. Noticed the regulars and slot players got all the attention. Everyone else, forget it. Place lost a star for that crap. There's better joints around, won't be going back."

"This joint serves cheap grub, but you get what you pay for. Egg rolls are floury, fried rice is flavorless, and the veggies in the lo mein are drowned in garlic. It's on a sketchy street, but the place itself is clean and quiet. With all the better Chinese spots in Madison, no need to waste your time here."

"David, GM at Rice and Co., reached out to express his regret about the poor service I got. Too bad it didn't translate to better treatment while I was there. Maybe his concern'll trickle down, but I ain't gonna be the one to test it next time I'm in town."

"Verily, a fine collection of Rebel goods doth lie within this store,
But alas, the prices do border on the absurd, I do declare.
A hat, the same in quality and make, doth cost thrice its worth,
In comparison to other shops, where 'tis sold with lesser dearth.
But fear not, dear customer, for if thou dost seek
Rare Rebel artifacts, this place doth hold a unique streak.
Just heed my warning, bring with thee a few coins,
For parking fees doth add a tax upon thy treasure trove within."

"Clothes sorted by color, not size. Thrift store owners might like it, but it don't help shoppers looking for a specific fit. Prices too high, could buy new for a bit more. Dingy store, upscale prices don't match. Won't be back."

"Get my grandparents' network switched, and they'll never come back to this St. Luke's. Quality of care? Depends on the shift and floor. Cath-Lab and ICU, great. 7th floor, hit or miss. ER, same deal. Makes me think, why do some folks go into medicine if they can't hack it?"

"In fairness, the start of our dining experience was quite good,
A seat was found in less than ten minutes, as promised by the wood.
Our server, too, began with grace and finesse,
But alas! her memory failed her, and our hopes did dismiss.

The victuals were most delectable, a feast for the taste,
But alack! the appetizer, forgotten, left us in haste.
Refills we had to request, again and again,
And for my friend's birthday dessert, a sorry tale to tell within.

When time came to settle the bill, oh what a woe!
Our server nowhere to be found, did cause us to moan.
A busboy, in the end, took pity on our plight,
And saved the day, with grace, like morning light."
"Vinnie's pizza? Just alright. Sausage, olives, onions, garlic, basil. Not bad, not great. Server? Friendly, helpful. Service? Best part."

"Hark! The victuals are of fair quality, I must confess,
But 'tis a vexing matter, that they do not always address
My humble abode with haste, on certain days, alas!
Their delivery scope, three miles, doth stretch and sway,
Yet Grub Hub doth proclaim, I dwell two point eight,
While Map Quest, three point three, doth countermand.
A pox upon their houses, for their wicked ways!
I pray thee, sirs, deliver thou my Asian feast,
When e'er I crave it, not just on whimsical days,
Lest ye be deemed knaves, and suffer my disdain."

"O, woe is me! My carriage, once so fine,
Now lies disabled within my garage, a sorry sight.
I called upon a towing company, as recommended by my dealer,
But alas, their service left much to be desired.

The first call came at 10:30 am, with a promise of a 90-minute wait,
But as the hours ticked by, my patience began to wane.
I called again at 12:30 pm, and was told it would be but 30 minutes more,
But still, no tow truck came, and I was left to stew in frustration.

Three hours passed, and I contemplated calling another company,
But fearful of two trucks arriving, I chose to wait patiently.
At last, at 2:30 pm, the tow truck arrived,
But oh, the service! So slow, so unprofessional, so rude!

The driver was pleasant enough, but struggled to free my carriage from its plight,
And as he drove away, I felt no gratitude, no apology, no goodbye.
I vow to never use them again, for their customer service is lacking,
And I lament, does anyone truly care for those they serve? Alas, it seems not."

"Went for lunch. Two burgers, large cajun fry to share. Waited 15 minutes. Only ones there. Fries weren't cajun. Brought them back. Guy with glasses offered seasoning. Said no, wanted them remade. Ignored us. Ate anyway. Poor service. Better service and quality food at other location."

"A so-so place, I found it to be,
Pancakes, poor form, didst not impress me.
Tasting of mix, mushy within,
Powdered sugar, a sin, didst not win.
Average wait, both to sit and eat,
Orange juice, poor quality, a defeat.
Nonetheless, not part of a chain,
Wouldst try other dishes, again."

"Hark! I would give this place five stars, anon,
For their victuals are most delectable, by Jove!
But alack! Their customer service doth leave much to be desired,
A pox upon them, say I, for their saucy behaviour!

The blonde chick who checked our RSVP, a snobbish soul,
Didst act as if she were above us, like a queen,
And the waiter, he didst rush us, with nary a care,
Asking if we were done, without a thought to spare.

He grabbed our plates, ere one of my friends had finished his meal,
And we, in turn, didst take our time, to order and enjoy,
Our desserts, and left a paltry sum, a mere ten percent,
For such poor service, we didst not think it meet.

Indeed, the food at STK, in Las Vegas, is quite fine,
But their staff, a pox upon them, for their rudeness, I do declare!
So, should thou find thyself in Sin City, and wish to dine,
At this establishment, be prepared, for a most unpleasant time."

"Piteous sight! Ten silver coins they do demand,
To gaze upon those cars of Italy's land,
Ferrari, the name that doth conjure up a dream,
Yet roped off, they stand, like royalty unseen.

Alack! Why must they be so stingy with their wares?
In Arizona, a dealer doth offer more,
With naught but glass between thee and the car,
And on the Sabbath day, when salesmen doth tarry not.

Oh, what a letdown! Methinks they should rethink,
Their strategy, lest potential buyers doth shrink."
"Eatin' here's a crapshoot. Grub's alright, but service? You better bring your own luck."
